--- Document Chunk 12035 ---
4.4.3 ISOLATION 

--- Document Chunk 12036 ---
4.4.3.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12037 ---
4.4.3.1.1 In Isolation mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall be physically isolated 

--- Document Chunk 12038 ---
from the brakes  and can be isolated from other on -board equipments/systems 

--- Document Chunk 12039 ---
depending on the specific on-board implementation. 

--- Document Chunk 12040 ---
4.4.3.1.2 There shall be a clear  indication to the driver that the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12041 ---
equipment is isolated. 

--- Document Chunk 12042 ---
4.4.3.1.3 To leave Isolation mode, a special operating procedure is needed (no transition from 

--- Document Chunk 12043 ---
Isolation is specified). This procedure shall ensure that the on -board equipment is only 

--- Document Chunk 12044 ---
put back into service when it has been proven that this is safe for operation. 

--- Document Chunk 12045 ---
4.4.3.1.4 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12046 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12047 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12048 ---
4.4.3.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12049 ---
4.4.3.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2, level 3 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 12050 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12051 ---
4.4.3.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12052 ---
4.4.3.3.1 Isolation of the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is performed by the driver under his 

--- Document Chunk 12053 ---
complete responsibility. 

--- Document Chunk 12054 ---
4.4.3.3.2 Once the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is isolated, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12055 ---
equipment has no more responsibility. 

--- Document Chunk 12056 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12057 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12058 ---

--- Document Chunk 12066 ---
4.4.4 NO POWER 

--- Document Chunk 12067 ---
4.4.4.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12068 ---
4.4.4.1.1 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is not powered, the equipment is in the 

--- Document Chunk 12069 ---
No Power mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12070 ---
4.4.4.1.1.1 Note: in order to ensure cold movement detection function, some parts of the 

--- Document Chunk 12071 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment may be fed by an auxiliary power supply. 

--- Document Chunk 12072 ---
4.4.4.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall permanently command the emergency 

--- Document Chunk 12073 ---
brake. 

--- Document Chunk 12074 ---
4.4.4.1.3 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter 4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12075 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12076 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12077 ---
4.4.4.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12078 ---
4.4.4.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2, level 3 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 12079 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12080 ---
4.4.4.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12081 ---
4.4.4.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has no responsibility in this mode, except 

--- Document Chunk 12082 ---
commanding the emergency brake and (optionally) monitoring cold movements. 

--- Document Chunk 12083 ---
4.4.4.3.2 The notion of responsibility of the driver is not relevant for the No Power mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12084 ---
4.4.4.3.3 If it is required to move a loco in NP mode as a wagon, ETCS brake command must 

--- Document Chunk 12085 ---
be overridden by external means. 

--- Document Chunk 12086 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

4.4.5 SYSTEM FAILURE 

--- Document Chunk 12097 ---
4.4.5.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12098 ---
4.4.5.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch to the System Failure mode in 

--- Document Chunk 12099 ---
case of a fault, which affects safety. 

--- Document Chunk 12100 ---
4.4.5.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall permanently command the Emergency 

--- Document Chunk 12101 ---
Brakes. 

--- Document Chunk 12102 ---
4.4.5.1.3 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12103 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12104 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12105 ---
4.4.5.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12106 ---
4.4.5.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2, level 3 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 12107 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12108 ---
4.4.5.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12109 ---
4.4.5.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for commanding the 

--- Document Chunk 12110 ---
Emergency Brakes. 

--- Document Chunk 12111 ---
4.4.5.3.2 No responsibility of the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12112 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12122 ---
4.4.6 SLEEPING 

--- Document Chunk 12123 ---
4.4.6.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12124 ---
4.4.6.1.1 The Sleeping mode is defined to manage the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of a 

--- Document Chunk 12125 ---
slave engine that is remote controlled. 

--- Document Chunk 12126 ---
4.4.6.1.2 The desk (s) of a sleeping engine must be closed (since there is no driver, no 

--- Document Chunk 12127 ---
information shall be shown). 

--- Document Chunk 12128 ---
4.4.6.1.3 As the engine is remote controlled by the leading engine, its ERTMS/ETCS o n-board 

--- Document Chunk 12129 ---
equipment shall not perform any train movement supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 12130 ---
4.4.6.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform the Train Position function; in 

--- Document Chunk 12131 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine (i.e., not the train) shall be used to refer to 

--- Document Chunk 12132 ---
train front/rear end. 

--- Document Chunk 12133 ---
4.4.6.1.5 Sleeping mode shall be automatically detected on-board via the train interface. 

--- Document Chunk 12134 ---
4.4.6.1.6 If possible, the train must not be stopped due to a safety critical fault in a sleeping 

--- Document Chunk 12135 ---
engine. The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment sh ould therefore try to memorise the 

--- Document Chunk 12136 ---
occurrence of such fault(s), which sh ould be handled when the engine leaves the 

--- Document Chunk 12137 ---
Sleeping mode. The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment sh ould also try to send an 

--- Document Chunk 12138 ---
error information to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 12139 ---
4.4.6.1.7 If a desk of the sleeping engine is opened while the train is running (t his is an 

--- Document Chunk 12140 ---
abnormal operation), the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch to Stand -By 

--- Document Chunk 12141 ---
mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12142 ---
4.4.6.1.8 If the “sleeping input signal” is lost (no more detection of the remote control), the 

--- Document Chunk 12143 ---
switch to Stand-By mode shall be made only if the train is at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 12144 ---
4.4.6.1.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12145 ---
4.4.6.1.10 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall open a communication session with the 

--- Document Chunk 12146 ---
RBC when at least one of the following events occurs: 

--- Document Chunk 12147 ---
a) in all levels, on receipt of the order to contact the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 12148 ---
b) In level 2/3, when entering or exiting Sle eping mode (to report the change of mode 

--- Document Chunk 12149 ---
to the RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 12150 ---
c) In level 2/3, when a safety critical fault of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 12151 ---
occurs (to report the fault to the RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 12152 ---
4.4.6.1.11 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12153 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12154 ---
4.4.6.1.12 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 12155 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 12156 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12157 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12158 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12159 ---

--- Document Chunk 12164 ---

--- Document Chunk 12165 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12166 ---
4.4.6.1.13 When in levels 2 or 3, if no compatible version has been establishe d between the on -

--- Document Chunk 12167 ---
board equipment in Sleeping mode and the RBC, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard 

--- Document Chunk 12168 ---
equipment shall react as specified in 3.5.3.7 d) 2nd bullet but no driver’s indication shall 

--- Document Chunk 12169 ---
be given. 

--- Document Chunk 12170 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12171 ---
4.4.6.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12172 ---
4.4.6.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2, level 3 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 12173 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12174 ---
4.4.6.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12175 ---
4.4.6.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of an engine in Sleeping mode has no 

--- Document Chunk 12176 ---
responsibility for the train protection. 

--- Document Chunk 12177 ---
4.4.6.3.2 The notion of responsibility of the driver is not relevant for the Sleeping mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12178 ---
4.4.6.3.2.1 Note: The leading engine is responsible for the movement of the train. It is then the 

--- Document Chunk 12179 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of the leading engine that is fully/partially/not 

--- Document Chunk 12180 ---
responsible for the train protection, with respect to its mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12181 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12182 ---

--- Document Chunk 12191 ---
4.4.7 STAND BY 

--- Document Chunk 12192 ---
4.4.7.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12193 ---
4.4.7.1.1 The Stand-By mode is a default mode and cannot be selected by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12194 ---
4.4.7.1.2 It is in the Stand-By mode that the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awakes. 

--- Document Chunk 12195 ---
4.4.7.1.3 Data for mission are collected in Stand -By (see SRS -chapter 5: “Start of Mission” 

--- Document Chunk 12196 ---
procedure). 

--- Document Chunk 12197 ---
4.4.7.1.4 In Stand-By mode, the desk of the engine ca n be open or closed. No interaction with 

--- Document Chunk 12198 ---
the driver shall be possible as long as the desk is closed, except isolation of the 

--- Document Chunk 12199 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 12200 ---
4.4.7.1.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall perform the Standstill Supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 12201 ---
4.4.7.1.6 Note: for the list of ma in functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12202 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12203 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12204 ---
4.4.7.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12205 ---
4.4.7.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2, level 3 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 12206 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12207 ---
4.4.7.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12208 ---
4.4.7.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for maintaining  the train at 

--- Document Chunk 12209 ---
standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 12210 ---
4.4.7.3.2 The driver has no responsibility for train movements. 

--- Document Chunk 12211 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12212 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12213 ---

--- Document Chunk 12221 ---
4.4.8 SHUNTING 

--- Document Chunk 12222 ---
4.4.8.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12223 ---
4.4.8.1.1 The purpose of the Shunting mode is to enable shunting movements. In Shunting 

--- Document Chunk 12224 ---
mode, The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise the train movements 

--- Document Chunk 12225 ---
against: 

--- Document Chunk 12226 ---
a) a ceiling speed: the shunting mode speed limit  

--- Document Chunk 12227 ---
b) a list of expected balise  groups (if such list was sent by the trackside equipment). 

--- Document Chunk 12228 ---
The train shall be tripped if a balise group, not contained in the list, is passed 

--- Document Chunk 12229 ---
(When an empty list is sent, no  balise group can be passed. When no list is sent, 

--- Document Chunk 12230 ---
all balise groups can be passed) 

--- Document Chunk 12231 ---
c) “stop if in shunting mode” information. The train is tripped if such information is 

--- Document Chunk 12232 ---
received from balise groups 

--- Document Chunk 12233 ---
d) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 12234 ---
4.4.8.1.2 The Shunting mode shall not require Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 12235 ---
4.4.8.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall perform the Train Position function 

--- Document Chunk 12236 ---
4.4.8.1.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12237 ---
4.4.8.1.5 When in Shunting mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall not manage level 

--- Document Chunk 12238 ---
transitions. However, an immediate level transition order or a conditional level 

--- Document Chunk 12239 ---
transition order shall be stored and evaluated only when another mode than Shunting 

--- Document Chunk 12240 ---
or Passive Shunting has been entered  (i.e. when the Shunting movement is 

--- Document Chunk 12241 ---
terminated). 

--- Document Chunk 12242 ---
4.4.8.1.5.1 When receiving a communication session establishment order, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 12243 ---
board in Shunting mode shall not establish the communication session, but shall store 

--- Document Chunk 12244 ---
the RBC ID/phone number. 

--- Document Chunk 12245 ---
4.4.8.1.5.2 When in Shunting mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall not manage RBC -RBC 

--- Document Chunk 12246 ---
hand-over, except for storing the RBC ID/phone number given at the RBC/RBC border. 

--- Document Chunk 12247 ---
4.4.8.1.6 Shunting mode can be selected by the driver, only accepted when the train is at 

--- Document Chunk 12248 ---
standstill, or ordered by the trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 12249 ---
4.4.8.1.7 In case of selection of Shunting mode by the driver: 

--- Document Chunk 12250 ---
 in level 1 operations, the switch to shunting is always accepted by the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12251 ---
equipment 

--- Document Chunk 12252 ---
 in level 2 and 3 areas, the on -board ask s the trackside for an authorisation. The 

--- Document Chunk 12253 ---
switch to shunting is possible only after receiving such authorisation. The trackside 

--- Document Chunk 12254 ---
can send a list of balises, that the train is allowed to pass while in SH , together with 

--- Document Chunk 12255 ---
the authorisation 

--- Document Chunk 12256 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12257 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12258 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12259 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12260 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12261 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12262 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12263 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12264 ---
Page 18/75 

--- Document Chunk 12265 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12266 ---
4.4.8.1.8 In case of order to switch to Shunting mode from trackside, the order: 

--- Document Chunk 12267 ---
 in level 1 is given by a balise group. A list of balises, that the train is allowed to pass 

--- Document Chunk 12268 ---
after the entry in Shunting, can be sent together with the order 

--- Document Chunk 12269 ---
 in level 2 and 3 is sent via radio. A list of balises, that the train is allowed to pass 

--- Document Chunk 12270 ---
after the entry in Shunting, can be sent together with the order 

--- Document Chunk 12271 ---
4.4.8.1.9 When the switch to shunting is ordered by trackside, a driver acknowledgement is 

--- Document Chunk 12272 ---
requested. 

--- Document Chunk 12273 ---
4.4.8.1.9.1 Note: in Shunting mode the train is only partially supervised, therefore it is necessary 

--- Document Chunk 12274 ---
that the driver takes the responsibility. 

--- Document Chunk 12275 ---
4.4.8.1.10 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed and, only on 

--- Document Chunk 12276 ---
driver request, the permitted speed.  The display of the permitted speed shall also be 

--- Document Chunk 12277 ---
stopped on driver request. 

--- Document Chunk 12278 ---
4.4.8.1.11 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12279 ---
4.4.8.1.12 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12280 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12281 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12282 ---
4.4.8.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12283 ---
4.4.8.2.1 Used in level 0, NTC, 1, 2 and 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12284 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12285 ---
4.4.8.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12286 ---
4.4.8.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for the supervision of the 

--- Document Chunk 12287 ---
shunting mode speed limit, and that the engine with the active antenna is tripped when 

--- Document Chunk 12288 ---
passing the defined border of the shunting area (only if there is a defined border: 

--- Document Chunk 12289 ---
balise group not in the list given by trackside, or balise  group giving the information 

--- Document Chunk 12290 ---
“stop if in shunting”). 

--- Document Chunk 12291 ---
4.4.8.3.2 The driver is responsible for: 

--- Document Chunk 12292 ---
a) Remaining inside the shunting area defined by a procedure or an external system 

--- Document Chunk 12293 ---
outside ERTMS/ETCS (also when the shunting area is protected by balises) 

--- Document Chunk 12294 ---
b) Train/engine movements and shunting operations 

--- Document Chunk 12295 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12296 ---

--- Document Chunk 12305 ---
4.4.9 FULL SUPERVISION 

--- Document Chunk 12306 ---
4.4.9.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12307 ---
4.4.9.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall be in the Full Supervision mode when all 

--- Document Chunk 12308 ---
train and track data, which is required for a complete supe rvision of the train, is 

--- Document Chunk 12309 ---
available on board. 

--- Document Chunk 12310 ---
4.4.9.1.2 Full supervision cannot be selected by the driver, but is entered automatically when all 

--- Document Chunk 12311 ---
necessary conditions are fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 12312 ---
4.4.9.1.3 To be in Full Supervision mode, SSP and gradient are not required for the whole 

--- Document Chunk 12313 ---
length of the train, but must be available at least from the FRONT END of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 12314 ---
4.4.9.1.4 Once in Full Supervision mode, if SSP and gradient are not known for the whole length 

--- Document Chunk 12315 ---
of the train, an indication “ENTRY IN FULL SUPERVISION” shall be clearly displayed 

--- Document Chunk 12316 ---
to the driver until SSP and gradient are known for the whole length of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 12317 ---
4.4.9.1.4.1 Note: this indication may also be displayed in case the train length has been increased, 

--- Document Chunk 12318 ---
see 3.18.3.8. 

--- Document Chunk 12319 ---
4.4.9.1.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 12320 ---
dynamic speed profile. 

--- Document Chunk 12321 ---
4.4.9.1.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed, the permitted 

--- Document Chunk 12322 ---
speed, the target distance and the target speed to the driver (this list is not exhaustive 

--- Document Chunk 12323 ---
– refer to chapter 4.7 “DMI depending on modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 12324 ---
4.4.9.1.7 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12325 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12326 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12327 ---
4.4.9.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12328 ---
4.4.9.2.1 Used in level 1, 2 and 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12329 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12330 ---
4.4.9.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12331 ---
4.4.9.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is fully re sponsible for the train protection 

--- Document Chunk 12332 ---
(except for the 2 situations described below). 

--- Document Chunk 12333 ---
4.4.9.3.2 The driver is responsible for respecting the EOA when approaching an EOA with a 

--- Document Chunk 12334 ---
release speed. 

--- Document Chunk 12335 ---
4.4.9.3.3 When “ENTRY IN FULL SUPERVISION” is displayed to the driver, the driver is 

--- Document Chunk 12336 ---
responsible for respecting speed restrictions that apply for the part of the train that is 

--- Document Chunk 12337 ---
not covered by SSP and gradient data. 

--- Document Chunk 12338 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12339 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12340 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12341 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12342 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12343 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12344 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12345 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12346 ---
Page 20/75 

--- Document Chunk 12347 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12348 ---
4.4.10 UNFITTED 

--- Document Chunk 12349 ---
4.4.10.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12350 ---
4.4.10.1.1 The Unfitted mode is used to allow train movements in either: 

--- Document Chunk 12351 ---
a) Areas that are equipped neither with ERTMS/ETCS track-side equipment nor with 

--- Document Chunk 12352 ---
national train control system 

--- Document Chunk 12353 ---
b) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 12354 ---
c) Areas that are equipped with ERTMS/ETCS trackside equipment and/or national 

--- Document Chunk 12355 ---
train control  system(s), but operation under their supervision is currently not 

--- Document Chunk 12356 ---
possible 

--- Document Chunk 12357 ---
4.4.10.1.2 The ERTM S/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 12358 ---
ceiling speed: the lowest of the maximum train speed and the Unfitted mode speed 

--- Document Chunk 12359 ---
limit for unfitted area (national value). 

--- Document Chunk 12360 ---
4.4.10.1.2.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12361 ---
4.4.10.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall al so supervise temporary speed 

--- Document Chunk 12362 ---
restrictions. 

--- Document Chunk 12363 ---
4.4.10.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the train speed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12364 ---
4.4.10.1.5 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12365 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12366 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12367 ---
4.4.10.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12368 ---
4.4.10.2.1 Used in level 0. 

--- Document Chunk 12369 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12370 ---
4.4.10.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12371 ---
4.4.10.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment supervises a ceiling speed and (if available) 

--- Document Chunk 12372 ---
temporary speed restrictions. 

--- Document Chunk 12373 ---
4.4.10.3.2 The driver must respect the existing line -side signals and is fully responsible for train 

--- Document Chunk 12374 ---
movements. 

--- Document Chunk 12375 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12385 ---
4.4.11 STAFF RESPONSIBLE 

--- Document Chunk 12386 ---
4.4.11.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12387 ---
4.4.11.1.1 The Staff Responsible mode allows the driver to move the train under his own 

--- Document Chunk 12388 ---
responsibility in an ERTMS/ETCS equipped area. 

--- Document Chunk 12389 ---
4.4.11.1.2 This mode is used when the system does not know the route. For example: 

--- Document Chunk 12390 ---
a) After the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment starts-up (awakening of the train). 

--- Document Chunk 12391 ---
b) To pass a signal at danger / override an EOA. 

--- Document Chunk 12392 ---
c) After a trackside failure (for example: loss of radio contact). 

--- Document Chunk 12393 ---
4.4.11.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall supervise train movements against: 

--- Document Chunk 12394 ---
a) a ceiling speed: the staff responsible mode speed limit  

--- Document Chunk 12395 ---
b) a given distance (regarding its origin location see 4.4.11.1.3.1) . The ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 12396 ---
on-board equipment shall supervise braking curves with a target speed of zero to 

--- Document Chunk 12397 ---
the end of this distance. If the train overpasses this distance (see next no te) the 

--- Document Chunk 12398 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall trip the train 

--- Document Chunk 12399 ---
c) a list of expected balise  groups, if this list has been sent by the RBC. The train 

--- Document Chunk 12400 ---
shall be tripped if over -passing a balise group that is not in the list. (When an 

--- Document Chunk 12401 ---
empty list is sent, no balise gr oup can be passed. When no list is sent, all balise 

--- Document Chunk 12402 ---
groups can be passed) 

--- Document Chunk 12403 ---
d) balise groups giving the order ‘stop if in SR’. This order shall immediately trip the 

--- Document Chunk 12404 ---
train, unless the over -passed balise group is included in a list of expected balises 

--- Document Chunk 12405 ---
as defined in item c) 

--- Document Chunk 12406 ---
e) running in the direction opposite to the train orientation (reverse movement 

--- Document Chunk 12407 ---
protection) 

--- Document Chunk 12408 ---
4.4.11.1.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall determine the start location of the SR distance 

--- Document Chunk 12409 ---
as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 12410 ---
a) If the National/Default value determines the max permitted distanc e to run in SR 

--- Document Chunk 12411 ---
mode, the starting point of this distance shall refer to the estimated position of the 

--- Document Chunk 12412 ---
train front when SR mode was entered, or, already in Staff Responsible mode, 

--- Document Chunk 12413 ---
when Override was activated. 

--- Document Chunk 12414 ---
b) If the max permitted distance to run in SR mode is determined by the value 

--- Document Chunk 12415 ---
transmitted by the RBC, or entered by the driver, the start location of the distance 

--- Document Chunk 12416 ---
shall refer to the estimated position of the train front when the distance information 

--- Document Chunk 12417 ---
is received or entered. 

--- Document Chunk 12418 ---
c) If the max permitted distance to run in SR mode is determined by the value 

--- Document Chunk 12419 ---
transmitted by EUROLOOP, the distance information transmitted by EUROLOOP 

--- Document Chunk 12420 ---
shall be referred to one or more reference balise groups. On -board shall evaluate 

--- Document Chunk 12421 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12422 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12423 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12424 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12425 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12426 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12427 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12428 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12429 ---
Page 22/75 

--- Document Chunk 12430 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12431 ---
the distance to run in SR mode by matching the reference balise groups given with 

--- Document Chunk 12432 ---
the LRBG. 

--- Document Chunk 12433 ---
In case the LRBG is, due to a change of orientation, in front of the train when the 

--- Document Chunk 12434 ---
distance to run in SR mode is to be determined from the EUROLOOP information, 

--- Document Chunk 12435 ---
the complete distance to run in SR mode shall be determined as the distance 

--- Document Chunk 12436 ---
given by EUROLOOP plus the distance between the estimated train front end and 

--- Document Chunk 12437 ---
the LRBG. 

--- Document Chunk 12438 ---
4.4.11.1.4 Note: Since the gradient is unknown, the supervision of the braking curves in Staff 

--- Document Chunk 12439 ---
Responsible mode does not ensure that the train will not pass the given distance. 

--- Document Chunk 12440 ---
4.4.11.1.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall give the possibility to the driver to modify 

--- Document Chunk 12441 ---
the value of the SR mode speed limit and of the given distance. This shall be possible 

--- Document Chunk 12442 ---
only at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 12443 ---
4.4.11.1.5.1 If a train movement is detected while the driver is entering the SR speed/distance 

--- Document Chunk 12444 ---
limits, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall trigger the brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 12445 ---
4.4.11.1.5.2 The unit, range and resolution of the SR mode speed limit and distance entered 

--- Document Chunk 12446 ---
by the driver shall be as specified in A.3.11. 

--- Document Chunk 12447 ---
4.4.11.1.6 If the  level is 2/3 and a communication session is open , the driver shall have the 

--- Document Chunk 12448 ---
possibility to request a new distance to run in Staff Responsible , by selecting "Start". 

--- Document Chunk 12449 ---
This triggers an MA request. 

--- Document Chunk 12450 ---
4.4.11.1.6.1 Note: Once the SR distance is covered, the driver may have to go further. 

--- Document Chunk 12451 ---
4.4.11.1.6.2 When entering SR mode , the value applicable for SR mode speed limit and the 

--- Document Chunk 12452 ---
value applicable for SR distance shall be the corresponding National/Default value s. 

--- Document Chunk 12453 ---
Exception for SR distance: SR mode is authorised by RBC giving an SR distance. 

--- Document Chunk 12454 ---
4.4.11.1.6.3 While in SR mode, t he value applicable for the SR mode speed limit shall be, if 

--- Document Chunk 12455 ---
available, the last value entered by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12456 ---
4.4.11.1.6.4 While in SR mode, the value applicable for the SR distance shall be, if available, 

--- Document Chunk 12457 ---
the last value received by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment amongst: 

--- Document Chunk 12458 ---
a) the distance to run in SR entered by the driver; 

--- Document Chunk 12459 ---
b) the distance to run in SR given by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 12460 ---
4.4.11.1.6.5 When "Override" is selected, the SR mode speed limit value and the SR distance 

--- Document Chunk 12461 ---
value previously entered by driver or given by trackside, if any, shall be deleted. The 

--- Document Chunk 12462 ---
corresponding National/Default values shall enter in force. 

--- Document Chunk 12463 ---
4.4.11.1.6.6 If the train is in SR and receives a new distance to run in SR mode from the 

--- Document Chunk 12464 ---
RBC, the stored list of expected balise groups, if any, shall be deleted or shall be 

--- Document Chunk 12465 ---
replaced by the list of expected balise groups sent together with the distance to run in 

--- Document Chunk 12466 ---
SR. 

--- Document Chunk 12467 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12468 ---

--- Document Chunk 12477 ---

--- Document Chunk 12478 ---
EUROLOOP max permitted distance to run in SR mode information, detects the main 

--- Document Chunk 12479 ---
signal balise group being par t of this information then it shall ignore any new max 

--- Document Chunk 12480 ---
permitted distance to run in SR mode information from that loop. 

--- Document Chunk 12481 ---
4.4.11.1.7 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed and the (when 

--- Document Chunk 12482 ---
active) override (permission to pass a signal at danger, t rip inhibited). The permitted 

--- Document Chunk 12483 ---
speed, target distance and the target speed shall be displayed only on driver request , 

--- Document Chunk 12484 ---
until the driver requests to stop their display. 

--- Document Chunk 12485 ---
4.4.11.1.8 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12486 ---
4.4.11.1.9 If receiving a "track ahead free" request from the RBC, the ERTMS/E TCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 12487 ---
equipment requests the driver to enter the "track ahead free" information. 

--- Document Chunk 12488 ---
4.4.11.1.10 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12489 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12490 ---
4.4.11.1.11 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12491 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12492 ---
4.4.11.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12493 ---
4.4.11.2.1 Level 1, 2 and 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12494 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12495 ---
4.4.11.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12496 ---
4.4.11.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment supervises a ceiling speed , a SR distance if 

--- Document Chunk 12497 ---
finite and, if available, a list of balises. 

--- Document Chunk 12498 ---
4.4.11.3.2 The driver must check if the track is free, if points are correctly positioned, and must 

--- Document Chunk 12499 ---
respect the existing line-side information (signals, speed boards etc.). 

--- Document Chunk 12500 ---
4.4.11.3.3 When using the possibility to modify the value of the SR mode speed limit and of the 

--- Document Chunk 12501 ---
given distance, the driver is responsible for entering reasonable values. 

--- Document Chunk 12502 ---

--- Document Chunk 12512 ---
4.4.12 ON SIGHT 

--- Document Chunk 12513 ---
4.4.12.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12514 ---
4.4.12.1.1 The On Sight mode enables the train to enter into a track section that could be already 

--- Document Chunk 12515 ---
occupied by another train, or obstructed by any kind of obstacle. 

--- Document Chunk 12516 ---
4.4.12.1.2 On Sight mode cannot be selected by the driver , but shall be entered automatically 

--- Document Chunk 12517 ---
when commanded by trackside and all necessary conditions are fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 12518 ---
4.4.12.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 12519 ---
dynamic speed profile. 

--- Document Chunk 12520 ---
4.4.12.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the train speed to the driver. The 

--- Document Chunk 12521 ---
permitted speed, target distance , target speed and release speed (if any) shall be 

--- Document Chunk 12522 ---
displayed only on driver request , until the driver requests to stop their display  (this list 

--- Document Chunk 12523 ---
is not exhaustive – refer to chapter 4.7 “DMI depending on modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 12524 ---
4.4.12.1.5 If receiving a "track ahead free" request from the RBC, the  ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 12525 ---
equipment requests the driver to enter the "track ahead free" information. 

--- Document Chunk 12526 ---
4.4.12.1.6 To be in On Sight mode, SSP and gradient are not required for the whole length of the 

--- Document Chunk 12527 ---
train, but must be available at least from the FRONT END of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 12528 ---
4.4.12.1.7 Once in On Sight mode, if SSP and gradient are not known for the whole length of the 

--- Document Chunk 12529 ---
train, an indication “ENTRY IN ON SIGHT” shall be clearly displayed to the driver until 

--- Document Chunk 12530 ---
SSP and gradient are known for the whole length of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 12531 ---
4.4.12.1.7.1 Note: this indication ma y also be displayed in case the train length has been 

--- Document Chunk 12532 ---
increased, see 3.18.3.8. 

--- Document Chunk 12533 ---
4.4.12.1.8 Deleted 

--- Document Chunk 12534 ---
4.4.12.1.9 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12535 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12536 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12537 ---
4.4.12.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12538 ---
4.4.12.2.1 Used in level 1, 2 and 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12539 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12540 ---
4.4.12.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12541 ---
4.4.12.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for the supervision of the train 

--- Document Chunk 12542 ---
movements. 

--- Document Chunk 12543 ---
4.4.12.3.2 The driver is responsible for checking the track occupancy when moving the train, 

--- Document Chunk 12544 ---
because the track may be occupied. 

--- Document Chunk 12545 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12555 ---
4.4.13 TRIP 

--- Document Chunk 12556 ---
4.4.13.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12557 ---
4.4.13.1.1 Deleted 

--- Document Chunk 12558 ---
4.4.13.1.1.1 Note: Application of emergency brakes and train trip are two different things. For 

--- Document Chunk 12559 ---
example, exceeding the permitted speed leads to application of the emergency brakes, 

--- Document Chunk 12560 ---
but as long as the train does not pass the EOA/LOA, it is not a train trip. 

--- Document Chunk 12561 ---
4.4.13.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equip ment shall command the emergency brakes (no 

--- Document Chunk 12562 ---
brake release is possible in Trip mode). 

--- Document Chunk 12563 ---
4.4.13.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall indicate to the driver the reason of the 

--- Document Chunk 12564 ---
train trip. 

--- Document Chunk 12565 ---
4.4.13.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 12566 ---
driver once train is at standstill (to allow the driver to acknowledge the train trip). 

--- Document Chunk 12567 ---
4.4.13.1.4.1 Note: This acknowledgement is mandatory to exit from Trip mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12568 ---
4.4.13.1.5 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12569 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12570 ---
4.4.13.1.6 Closing the desk while being in Trip mode will not cause a mode change but no 

--- Document Chunk 12571 ---
interaction with the driver shall be possible as long as the desk is closed, except 

--- Document Chunk 12572 ---
isolation of the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 12573 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12574 ---
4.4.13.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12575 ---
4.4.13.2.1 Used in level 0, NTC, 1, 2 and 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12576 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12577 ---
4.4.13.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12578 ---
4.4.13.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for stopping the train and for 

--- Document Chunk 12579 ---
maintaining the train at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 12580 ---
4.4.13.3.2 The driver has no responsibility for train movements. 

--- Document Chunk 12581 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12582 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12583 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12584 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12585 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12586 ---
13/05/2016

--- Document Chunk 12590 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12591 ---
4.4.14 POST TRIP 

--- Document Chunk 12592 ---
4.4.14.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12593 ---
4.4.14.1.1 The Post Trip mode shall be entered  immediately after the driver acknowledges the 

--- Document Chunk 12594 ---
trip. 

--- Document Chunk 12595 ---
4.4.14.1.2 Once in post trip mode, the onboard equipment shall release the Command of the 

--- Document Chunk 12596 ---
emergency brake. 

--- Document Chunk 12597 ---
4.4.14.1.2.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall keep on indicating to the driver the 

--- Document Chunk 12598 ---
reason of the train trip. 

--- Document Chunk 12599 ---
4.4.14.1.3 The train shall only be authorised to move backwards a given distance (national value). 

--- Document Chunk 12600 ---
The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise this national distance for 

--- Document Chunk 12601 ---
reverse movements, and shall command the service brakes if the distance is over -

--- Document Chunk 12602 ---
passed. The driver shall be informed about the reason for the brake application. 

--- Document Chunk 12603 ---
4.4.14.1.3.1 Note: The ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment performs the Reverse Movement 

--- Document Chunk 12604 ---
Protection (as in PT mode, the "normally allowed movement" is backwards, then the 

--- Document Chunk 12605 ---
Reverse Movement Protection avoids the train running in forward direction when in PT 

--- Document Chunk 12606 ---
mode). This implies that the given distance to run backwards in PT is considered as a 

--- Document Chunk 12607 ---
directional data, oriented backwards. 

--- Document Chunk 12608 ---
4.4.14.1.3.2 After the release of a brake command initiated due to an overpassed distance 

--- Document Chunk 12609 ---
allowed f or moving backwards in Post Trip mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12610 ---
equipment shall command the service brake for any further movement in the direction 

--- Document Chunk 12611 ---
opposite to the train orientation. 

--- Document Chunk 12612 ---
4.4.14.1.4 When moving backwards in Post Trip mode, the train trip shall be inhibited. 

--- Document Chunk 12613 ---
4.4.14.1.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12614 ---
4.4.14.1.6 When ERTMS/ETCS level is 1, if the driver selects “Start” the onboard equipment 

--- Document Chunk 12615 ---
proposes Staff Responsible. When ERTMS/ETCS level is 2 or 3, the selection of Start 

--- Document Chunk 12616 ---
leads to an MA Request to the RBC. It is the RBC responsibility to give an SR 

--- Document Chunk 12617 ---
authorisation, or a Full Supervision MA or an On Sight /Shunting MA to an 

--- Document Chunk 12618 ---
ERTMS/ETCS equipment that is in Post Trip mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12619 ---
4.4.14.1.7 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12620 ---
4.4.14.1.8 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12621 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12622 ---
4.4.14.1.9 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 12623 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 12624 ---
4.4.14.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12625 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12626 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12627 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12628 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12629 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12630 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12631 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12632 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12633 ---
Page 27/75 

--- Document Chunk 12634 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12635 ---
4.4.14.2.1 Used in level 1, 2 and 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12636 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12637 ---
4.4.14.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12638 ---
4.4.14.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equi pment is responsible for supervising that the train 

--- Document Chunk 12639 ---
moves only backwards and that the backward movement does not exceed the 

--- Document Chunk 12640 ---
maximum permitted distance (national value). 

--- Document Chunk 12641 ---
4.4.14.3.2 The driver is responsible if moving the train backwards. 

--- Document Chunk 12642 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12643 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12644 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12645 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12646 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12647 ---
13/05/2016

--- Document Chunk 12649 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12650 ---

--- Document Chunk 12651 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12652 ---
4.4.15 NON LEADING 

--- Document Chunk 12653 ---
4.4.15.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12654 ---
4.4.15.1.1 The Non-Leading mode is defined to manage the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 12655 ---
of a slave engine that is NOT electrically coupled to the leading engine (and so, not 

--- Document Chunk 12656 ---
remote controlled) but has its own driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12657 ---
4.4.15.1.1.1 Note: This operating situation is called Tandem. 

--- Document Chunk 12658 ---
4.4.15.1.1.2 The ERT MS/ETCS on-board equipment shall use, as a necessary condition to 

--- Document Chunk 12659 ---
enter in Non-Leading mode, a “non leading input signal" from the train interface. 

--- Document Chunk 12660 ---
4.4.15.1.1.3 If the “non leading input signal" is no longer present, the switch to Stand -By 

--- Document Chunk 12661 ---
mode shall be made only if the train is at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 12662 ---
4.4.15.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall not perform any train movement 

--- Document Chunk 12663 ---
supervision in Non-Leading mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12664 ---
4.4.15.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform the Train Position function; in 

--- Document Chunk 12665 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine ( i.e., not the train) shall be used to refer to 

--- Document Chunk 12666 ---
train front/rear end. 

--- Document Chunk 12667 ---
4.4.15.1.4 When level is 2 or 3, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall report its position to 

--- Document Chunk 12668 ---
the RBC, according to the previously received parameters. 

--- Document Chunk 12669 ---
4.4.15.1.5 If possible, the train must not be stopped d ue to a safety critical fault in a non -leading 

--- Document Chunk 12670 ---
engine. The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment sh ould therefore try to memorise the 

--- Document Chunk 12671 ---
occurrence of such fault(s), which sh ould be handled when the engine leaves Non 

--- Document Chunk 12672 ---
Leading mode. The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment sh ould also try to send an 

--- Document Chunk 12673 ---
error information to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 12674 ---
4.4.15.1.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the train speed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12675 ---
4.4.15.1.7 Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 12676 ---
4.4.15.1.8 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12677 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12678 ---
4.4.15.1.9 The supervision of linking consistency shall not be performed in Non Leading mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12679 ---
4.4.15.1.10 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 12680 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 12681 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12682 ---
4.4.15.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12683 ---
4.4.15.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2, level 3 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 12684 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12685 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12686 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12687 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12688 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12689 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12690 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12691 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12692 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12693 ---
Page 29/75 

--- Document Chunk 12694 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12695 ---
4.4.15.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12696 ---
4.4.15.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment perform s NO protection functions, except 

--- Document Chunk 12697 ---
forwarding track conditions associated orders through DMI or train interface. 

--- Document Chunk 12698 ---
4.4.15.3.2 The driver is responsible for obeying the orders associated to track conditions, when  

--- Document Chunk 12699 ---
they are displayed by the DMI. 

--- Document Chunk 12700 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12721 ---
4.4.17 National System (SN) mode 

--- Document Chunk 12722 ---
4.4.17.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12723 ---
4.4.17.1.1 In SN mode, according to the specific on -board implementation, the National Sys tem 

--- Document Chunk 12724 ---
may access the following resources via the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment: DMI, 

--- Document Chunk 12725 ---
Juridical Recording interface , odometer, train interface and brakes. This can be 

--- Document Chunk 12726 ---
achieved through the STM interface. 

--- Document Chunk 12727 ---
4.4.17.1.2 A limited set of data coming from balises shall be used by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 12728 ---
equipment, refer to SRS chapter 4.8 “Use of received information”. 

--- Document Chunk 12729 ---
4.4.17.1.3 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12730 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12731 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12732 ---
4.4.17.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12733 ---
4.4.17.2.1 Level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 12734 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12735 ---
4.4.17.3 Responsibilities of ERTMS/ETCS Onboard 

--- Document Chunk 12736 ---
4.4.17.3.1 No train supervision functionality is provided by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12737 ---
equipment. In case the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is interfaced to the National 

--- Document Chunk 12738 ---
System through a n STM, refer to the FFFIS STM (Subset 035)  for the functionality 

--- Document Chunk 12739 ---
provided by ERTMS/ETCS on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 12740 ---
4.4.17.3.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12741 ---
4.4.17.4 Responsibilities of the National System 

--- Document Chunk 12742 ---
4.4.17.4.1 The National System is responsible for all train supervision and protection functions. 

--- Document Chunk 12743 ---
4.4.17.4.2 The National System is responsible for issuing and revoking brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 12744 ---
4.4.17.4.3 The National System  is responsible for maintaining national system behaviour and 

--- Document Chunk 12745 ---
interact with national trackside equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 12746 ---
4.4.17.4.4 The National System is responsible for interaction with the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12747 ---
4.4.17.5 Responsibilities of the driver 

--- Document Chunk 12748 ---
4.4.17.5.1 The responsibility of the driver depends on the National System in use. 

--- Document Chunk 12749 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12750 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12751 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12752 ---

--- Document Chunk 12759 ---
4.4.18 REVERSING 

--- Document Chunk 12760 ---
4.4.18.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12761 ---
4.4.18.1.1 The Reversing mode allows the driver to change the direction of movement of the train 

--- Document Chunk 12762 ---
and drive from the same cab, i.e. the train orientation remains unchanged. This is 

--- Document Chunk 12763 ---
possible only in areas so marked by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 12764 ---
4.4.18.1.2 Note: This mode is used to allow the train to escape from a dangerous situation and to 

--- Document Chunk 12765 ---
reach as fast as possible a “safer” location. 

--- Document Chunk 12766 ---
4.4.18.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall supervise train movements against: 

--- Document Chunk 12767 ---
a) a ceiling speed: the Reversing mode speed limit given from trackside 

--- Document Chunk 12768 ---
b) a distance to run in the direction opposite to the train orientation , given from 

--- Document Chunk 12769 ---
trackside. The emergency brake shall be commanded if overpassing this distance 

--- Document Chunk 12770 ---
4.4.18.1.4 After the release of a brake command initiated due to an overpassed reversing 

--- Document Chunk 12771 ---
distance, and while the reversing distance is still overpassed, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 12772 ---
board equipment shall command the emergency brake for any further movement in the 

--- Document Chunk 12773 ---
direction opposite to the train orientation. 

--- Document Chunk 12774 ---
4.4.18.1.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed, the permitted 

--- Document Chunk 12775 ---
speed and the remaining distance to run. 

--- Document Chunk 12776 ---
4.4.18.1.6 In case the SBI supervision limit is exceeded (refer to chapter 3  table 5, triggering 

--- Document Chunk 12777 ---
condition t4), the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall command the eme rgency 

--- Document Chunk 12778 ---
brake instead of the service brake . For the revocation of the brake command, refer to 

--- Document Chunk 12779 ---
3.13.10.2.4. 

--- Document Chunk 12780 ---
4.4.18.1.7 The position reports sent when in reversing mode shall refer to the location of the 

--- Document Chunk 12781 ---
driving cab (as before reversing). 

--- Document Chunk 12782 ---
4.4.18.1.8 Note: The ERTMS/ETCS onboard eq uipment performs the Reverse Movement 

--- Document Chunk 12783 ---
Protection (as in RV mode, the "normally allowed movement" is backwards, then the 

--- Document Chunk 12784 ---
Reverse Movement Protection avoids the train running in forward direction when in RV 

--- Document Chunk 12785 ---
mode). This implies that the given distance to run in reversing is considered as a 

--- Document Chunk 12786 ---
directional data, oriented backwards. 

--- Document Chunk 12787 ---
4.4.18.1.9 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter  4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12788 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12789 ---
4.4.18.1.10 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and  3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 12790 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 12791 ---
4.4.18.1.11 In case there is an alarm reporting a malfunction for the onboard balise transmission 

--- Document Chunk 12792 ---
function, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall ignore this alarm. 

--- Document Chunk 12793 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12794 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12795 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12796 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12797 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12798 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12799 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12800 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12801 ---
Page 33/75 

--- Document Chunk 12802 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12803 ---
4.4.18.1.12 In case the ERTMS/ ETCS system version number X transmitted by any balise is 

--- Document Chunk 12804 ---
greater than the highest version X supported by the onboard equipment (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 12805 ---
3.17.3.5), the information from this balise shall be ignored, the train shall not be tripped 

--- Document Chunk 12806 ---
and the driver shall not be informed. 

--- Document Chunk 12807 ---
4.4.18.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12808 ---
4.4.18.2.1 Level 1, 2, 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12809 ---
4.4.18.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12810 ---
4.4.18.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment supervises a ceiling speed and a distance to 

--- Document Chunk 12811 ---
run in reverse direction. 

--- Document Chunk 12812 ---
4.4.18.3.2 The driver must keep the train movement inside the received distance to run. 

--- Document Chunk 12813 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12814 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12815 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12816 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12817 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12818 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12819 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12820 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12821 ---
Page 34/75 

--- Document Chunk 12822 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12823 ---
4.4.19 LIMITED SUPERVISION 

--- Document Chunk 12824 ---
4.4.19.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12825 ---
4.4.19.1.1 The Limited Supervision mode enables the train to be operated in areas where 

--- Document Chunk 12826 ---
trackside information can be supplied to realise background supervision of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 12827 ---
4.4.19.1.2 Limited supervision can not be selected by the driver, but shall be entere d 

--- Document Chunk 12828 ---
automatically when commanded by trackside and all necessary conditions are fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 12829 ---
4.4.19.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 12830 ---
dynamic speed profile. 

--- Document Chunk 12831 ---
4.4.19.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed  and the release 

--- Document Chunk 12832 ---
speed, if any (this list is not exhaustive – refer to chapter 4.7 “DMI depending on 

--- Document Chunk 12833 ---
modes”). Upon request by trackside (refer to clauses 4.4.19.1.4.2 to 4.4.19.1.4.6) if the 

--- Document Chunk 12834 ---
generic LS function marker is stored on -board or if the conditions in c lause 

--- Document Chunk 12835 ---
4.4.19.1.4.7 are fulfilled, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall also display the 

--- Document Chunk 12836 ---
lowest speed amongst: 

--- Document Chunk 12837 ---
a) the lowest MRSP element between the minimum safe front end of the train and the 

--- Document Chunk 12838 ---
EOA/LOA, AND 

--- Document Chunk 12839 ---
b) the target speed at the EOA/LOA 

--- Document Chunk 12840 ---
4.4.19.1.4.1 The speed resultin g from 4.4.19.1.4 a) and b) is called the Lowest Supervised 

--- Document Chunk 12841 ---
Speed within the Movement Authority (LSSMA) 

--- Document Chunk 12842 ---
4.4.19.1.4.2 Upon an order to toggle on the LSSMA display, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12843 ---
equipment shall start a delay timer: 

--- Document Chunk 12844 ---
a) For order received from RBC/RIU: at the value  of the time stamp of the message 

--- Document Chunk 12845 ---
including the order. 

--- Document Chunk 12846 ---
b) For order received from balise group: at the time of passage over the first 

--- Document Chunk 12847 ---
encountered balise of the balise group giving the order. 

--- Document Chunk 12848 ---
c) Exception to a) and b): for order that has been stored in the level transition buffer 

--- Document Chunk 12849 ---
(see section 4.8.3): at the time the level transition is performed. 

--- Document Chunk 12850 ---
4.4.19.1.4.3 When the delay timer value becomes greater than the time -out value given by 

--- Document Chunk 12851 ---
trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the LSSMA. 

--- Document Chunk 12852 ---
4.4.19.1.4.4 On reception of an order  to toggle (on or off) the LSSMA display, a toggle on 

--- Document Chunk 12853 ---
order which has not been executed yet (because the on -board delay timer has not 

--- Document Chunk 12854 ---
reached the delay time-out value) shall be deleted by the on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 12855 ---
4.4.19.1.4.5 If the LSSMA display is already toggled on, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12856 ---
equipment shall toggle off the LSSMA display in case: 

--- Document Chunk 12857 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12858 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12859 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12860 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12861 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12862 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12863 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12864 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12865 ---
Page 35/75 

--- Document Chunk 12866 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12867 ---
a) the clause 4.4.19.1.4.3 is not immediately fulfilled upon reception of a new order to 

--- Document Chunk 12868 ---
toggle on the LSSMA display 

--- Document Chunk 12869 ---
b) an order to toggle off the LSSMA display is received. 

--- Document Chunk 12870 ---
4.4.19.1.4.6 When enter ing the Limited Supervision mode, the LSSMA display shall be 

--- Document Chunk 12871 ---
toggled off by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, unless a toggle on order is 

--- Document Chunk 12872 ---
received and leads immediately to the display of the LSSMA as per clauses 

--- Document Chunk 12873 ---
4.4.19.1.4.2 and 4.4.19.1.4.3. 

--- Document Chunk 12874 ---
4.4.19.1.4.7 If the generic LS function marker is not stored on -board, the clauses 4.4.19.1.4.2 

--- Document Chunk 12875 ---
to 4.4.19.1.4.6 shall not apply and the LSSMA shall be displayed if: 

--- Document Chunk 12876 ---
a) the target speed at the EOA/LOA is lower than the Limited Supervision mode speed 

--- Document Chunk 12877 ---
limit, AND 

--- Document Chunk 12878 ---
b) the LSSMA is lower than the maximum train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 12879 ---
4.4.19.1.4.8 The generic LS function marker shall be deleted by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12880 ---
equipment as soon as a Limited Supervision mode profile is received without it in the 

--- Document Chunk 12881 ---
same balise group message. 

--- Document Chunk 12882 ---
4.4.19.1.5 If receiving a "track ahead free" request f rom the RBC, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12883 ---
equipment requests the driver to enter the "track ahead free" information. 

--- Document Chunk 12884 ---
4.4.19.1.6 To be in Limited Supervision mode, SSP and gradient are not required for the whole 

--- Document Chunk 12885 ---
length of the train, but shall be at least available from the FRONT END of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 12886 ---
4.4.19.1.7 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to 4.5 “Modes and on-

--- Document Chunk 12887 ---
board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12888 ---
4.4.19.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12889 ---
4.4.19.2.1 Used in levels 1, 2 and 3. 

--- Document Chunk 12890 ---
4.4.19.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12891 ---
4.4.19.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is responsible for the background supervision 

--- Document Chunk 12892 ---
of the train movement to the extent permitted by the information provided by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 12893 ---
4.4.19.3.1.1 Note: The Limited Supervision mode enables the train to be operated in areas 

--- Document Chunk 12894 ---
equipped with lineside signals where ETCS does not have information regarding t he 

--- Document Chunk 12895 ---
status of some signals, i.e. not all signals are fitted with LEUs or connected to an RBC 

--- Document Chunk 12896 ---
4.4.19.3.2 The driver must always observe the existing line -side information (signals, speed 

--- Document Chunk 12897 ---
boards etc.) and National operating rules. 

--- Document Chunk 12898 ---
4.4.19.3.2.1 Note: the indications given to the driv er by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12899 ---
equipment do not substitute the observance of the line -side information. In particular 

--- Document Chunk 12900 ---
the display of the LSSMA, if deemed necessary by the trackside, only complements 

--- Document Chunk 12901 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12902 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12903 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12904 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12905 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12906 ---
13/05/2016

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12908 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12909 ---
Page 36/75 

--- Document Chunk 12910 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12911 ---
the line-side information, e.g. in case there could be a d iscrepancy between this latter 

--- Document Chunk 12912 ---
and the background supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 12913 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12923 ---
4.4.20 PASSIVE SHUNTING 

--- Document Chunk 12924 ---
4.4.20.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 12925 ---
4.4.20.1.1 The Passive Shunting mode is defined to manage the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12926 ---
equipment of a slave engine (NOT remote controlled, but mechanically coupled to the 

--- Document Chunk 12927 ---
leading engine), being part of a shunting consist. This mode can also be used to carry 

--- Document Chunk 12928 ---
on a shunting movement with a s ingle engine fitted with one on -board equipment and 

--- Document Chunk 12929 ---
two cabs, when the driver has to change the driving cab. 

--- Document Chunk 12930 ---
4.4.20.1.2 The desk of a Passive Shunting engine  must be closed (since there is no driver, no 

--- Document Chunk 12931 ---
information shall be shown). 

--- Document Chunk 12932 ---
4.4.20.1.3 As the engine is coupled to a leading engine, its ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 12933 ---
shall not perform any train movement supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 12934 ---
4.4.20.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform Train Position function;  in 

--- Document Chunk 12935 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine (i.e., not the train) shall be used to refer to 

--- Document Chunk 12936 ---
train front/rear end. 

--- Document Chunk 12937 ---
4.4.20.1.5 It shall only be possible to enter in Passive Shunting mode from the Shunting mode; 

--- Document Chunk 12938 ---
while in Shunting mode, the driv er shall have the possibility to enable the function 

--- Document Chunk 12939 ---
“Continue Shunting on desk closure”. 

--- Document Chunk 12940 ---
4.4.20.1.6 When the active desk is closed, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch to 

--- Document Chunk 12941 ---
Passive Shunting mode  if the function “Continue Shunting on desk closure” is active 

--- Document Chunk 12942 ---
and the “passive shunting input signal” is received from the train interface. If the 

--- Document Chunk 12943 ---
function “Continue Shunting on desk closure” is not active or the “passive shunting 

--- Document Chunk 12944 ---
input signal” is not present, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch to 

--- Document Chunk 12945 ---
Stand-By mode instead. 

--- Document Chunk 12946 ---
4.4.20.1.7 The special function “Continue Shunting on desk closure” shall allow one and only one 

--- Document Chunk 12947 ---
transition from Shunting mode to Passive Shunting mode. The special function shall be 

--- Document Chunk 12948 ---
inactive once the Shunting mode is left. 

--- Document Chunk 12949 ---
4.4.20.1.8 If a desk of the Passive Sh unting engine is opened  and no “Stop Shunting on desk 

--- Document Chunk 12950 ---
opening” information previously received from balise group is stored onboard , the 

--- Document Chunk 12951 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall switch to Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12952 ---
4.4.20.1.9 If a desk of the Passive Shunting engine is opened and “Sto p Shunting on desk 

--- Document Chunk 12953 ---
opening” information previously received from balise group is stored onboard, the 

--- Document Chunk 12954 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall switch to Stand By mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12955 ---
4.4.20.1.10 If possible, the train must not be stopped due to a safety critical fault in a Passive 

--- Document Chunk 12956 ---
Shunting engine. The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment sh ould therefore try to 

--- Document Chunk 12957 ---
memorise the occurrence of such fault(s), which sh ould be handled when the engine 

--- Document Chunk 12958 ---
leaves the Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12959 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12960 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12961 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12962 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12963 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12964 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12965 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12966 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 12967 ---
Page 38/75 

--- Document Chunk 12968 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12969 ---
4.4.20.1.11 When in Passive Shunting mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall not manage level 

--- Document Chunk 12970 ---
transitions. However, an immediate level transition order or a conditional level 

--- Document Chunk 12971 ---
transition order shall be stored and shall be evaluated only when another mode than 

--- Document Chunk 12972 ---
Shunting or Passive Shunting has been entered  (i.e. when the Shunting movement is 

--- Document Chunk 12973 ---
terminated). 

--- Document Chunk 12974 ---
4.4.20.1.12 When receiving a communication session establishment order, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 12975 ---
board in Passive Shunting mode shall not establish the communication session, but 

--- Document Chunk 12976 ---
shall store the RBC ID/phone number information. 

--- Document Chunk 12977 ---
4.4.20.1.13 When in Passive Shunting mode, the ER TMS/ETCS on-board shall not manage RBC -

--- Document Chunk 12978 ---
RBC hand-over, except for storing the RBC ID/phone number information given at the 

--- Document Chunk 12979 ---
RBC/RBC border. 

--- Document Chunk 12980 ---
4.4.20.1.14 Note: for the list of main functions related to this mode, refer to chapter 4.5 “Modes 

--- Document Chunk 12981 ---
and on-board functions”. 

--- Document Chunk 12982 ---
4.4.20.1.15 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 12983 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 12984 ---
4.4.20.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 12985 ---
4.4.20.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2, level 3 and level NTC 

--- Document Chunk 12986 ---
4.4.20.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 12987 ---
4.4.20.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of an engine in Passive Shunting mode has 

--- Document Chunk 12988 ---
no responsibility for the train protection. 

--- Document Chunk 12989 ---
4.4.20.3.2 The notion of responsibility of the driver is not relevant for the Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12990 ---
4.4.20.3.3 Note: The leading engine is responsible for the m ovement of the train. It is then the 

--- Document Chunk 12991 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of the leading engine that is fully/partially/not 

--- Document Chunk 12992 ---
responsible for the train protection, with respect to its mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12993 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12994 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12995 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12996 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 12997 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 12998 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 12999 ---
System Requirements Specification

--- Document Chunk 13003 ---
4.5 Modes and on-board functions 

--- Document Chunk 13004 ---
4.5.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 13005 ---
4.5.1.1 The following table specifies in which modes the on -board functions are active or not. 

--- Document Chunk 13006 ---
The functions are described in the “Related SRS §” (second column of the table). 

--- Document Chunk 13007 ---
4.5.1.2 Note: Modes are not the only thing that can influence an onboard function. This is why 

--- Document Chunk 13008 ---
this Table is not enough in itself  to understand all the ERTMS/ETCS onboard 

--- Document Chunk 13009 ---
behaviour. It must be understood as a complement to all other SRS chapters 

--- Document Chunk 13010 ---
(especially §4.7, 4.8, 4.9 and 4.10). 

--- Document Chunk 13011 ---
4.5.1.3 Note: for DMI depending on modes, refer to §4.7. 

--- Document Chunk 13012 ---
4.5.2 Active Functions Table 

--- Document Chunk 13013 ---
4.5.2.1 X = functions shall be active 

--- Document Chunk 13014 ---
Empty case = function shall be inactive 

--- Document Chunk 13015 ---
O = Optional (function is not required for interoperability, but is not forbidden)

--- Document Chunk 13507 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13508 ---
4.6 Transitions between modes 

--- Document Chunk 13509 ---
4.6.1 Symbols 

--- Document Chunk 13510 ---
4.6.1.1 The indication “4>” means: The condition n°4 must be fulfilled to trigger the transition 

--- Document Chunk 13511 ---
4.6.1.2 From the mode located in the column 

--- Document Chunk 13512 ---
4.6.1.3 To the mode that is indicated by the arrow “>”. 

--- Document Chunk 13513 ---
4.6.1.4 Each transition from a given mode receives a priority order (indicated by “ -px-”, x is the 

--- Document Chunk 13514 ---
priority order) to avoid a conflict between the different transitions when they  occur at 

--- Document Chunk 13515 ---
the same time (i.e. in the same clock cycle). P1 has a higher priority than P2. 

--- Document Chunk 13516 ---
4.6.1.5 Some transitions have received the same priority order. This has been decided when it 

--- Document Chunk 13517 ---
is obvious that these transitions cannot occur at the same time, and so can neve r lead 

--- Document Chunk 13518 ---
to a conflicting situation (for example, the RBC cannot give in the same time a MA for 

--- Document Chunk 13519 ---
FS and a MA for OS to a given engine, this is why the transition “from SR to FS” and 

--- Document Chunk 13520 ---
the transition “from SR to OS” have the same priority order). 

--- Document Chunk 13521 ---
4.6.1.6 "16, 17, 18" means "16 or 17 or 18". 

--- Document Chunk 13522 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13523 ---

--- Document Chunk 14004 ---

--- Document Chunk 14092 ---
{1} The request to acknowledge On Sight  is displayed to the driver only if certain conditions are 

--- Document Chunk 14093 ---
fulfilled. These conditions are not specified here. See the “On Sight” procedure” in 5.9. 

--- Document Chunk 14094 ---
{2} This transition to the Unfitted mode is also a transition of level. For further information, See the 

--- Document Chunk 14095 ---
“Level Transition” procedure in 5.10 and the “Start Of Mission” procedure in 5.4. 

--- Document Chunk 14096 ---
{3} See the “Override” procedure” of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 14097 ---
{4} The Staff Responsible mode is proposed to the driver only if certain conditions are fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 14098 ---
These conditions are not specifi ed here. See the “Start Of Mission” procedure and the "Train Trip" 

--- Document Chunk 14099 ---
procedure of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 14100 ---
{5} The request to acknowledge Shunting is displayed to the driver only if certain conditions are 

--- Document Chunk 14101 ---
fulfilled. These conditions are not specified here. See the “Entry in Shunting” procedure and the 

--- Document Chunk 14102 ---
“Start Of Mission” procedure of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 14103 ---
{6} The request to acknowledge Reversing is displayed to the driver when certain conditions are 

--- Document Chunk 14104 ---
fulfilled. These conditions are not specified here. See the “reversing” procedure of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 14105 ---
{7} The request to acknowledge Limited Supervision is displayed to the driver only if certain 

--- Document Chunk 14106 ---
conditions are fulfilled. These conditions are not specified here. See the “Limited Supervision” 

--- Document Chunk 14107 ---
procedure” of SRS-§5 (for transitions from FS/OS/UN to LS) and t he "Start of mission" procedure 

--- Document Chunk 14108 ---
(for transition from SB to LS). 

--- Document Chunk 14109 ---
{8} Refer to Subset-035 for details. 

--- Document Chunk 14110 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 14120 ---
4.7 DMI depending on modes 

--- Document Chunk 14121 ---
4.7.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 14122 ---
4.7.1.1 The DMI is an interface  that allows the direct exchange of information between the 

--- Document Chunk 14123 ---
driver and the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment. The indirect exchange of information 

--- Document Chunk 14124 ---
done via the train interface (e.g. a driver’s action on the service brake used for the 

--- Document Chunk 14125 ---
service brake feedback, opening/closing the desk) is not part of the DMI. 

--- Document Chunk 14126 ---
4.7.1.2 The device(s) used to select “ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment powered/unpowered” 

--- Document Chunk 14127 ---
is (are) not part of the DMI. 

--- Document Chunk 14128 ---
4.7.1.3 The device(s) used to select /indicate “ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment isolated/not 

--- Document Chunk 14129 ---
isolated” is (are) part of the DMI. 

--- Document Chunk 14130 ---
4.7.1.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 14131 ---
4.7.1.5 Information (input or output) only relevant for National System and not originated by 

--- Document Chunk 14132 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board is not included in the following section. 

--- Document Chunk 14133 ---
4.7.2 DMI versus Mode Table 

--- Document Chunk 14134 ---
4.7.2.1.1 X = active: For a  DMI output, this means that the output information shall be shown to 

--- Document Chunk 14135 ---
the driver when the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment is in the mode indicated in the 

--- Document Chunk 14136 ---
column. For a DMI input, this means that it shall be possible for the driver to enter this 

--- Document Chunk 14137 ---
information when the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment is in the mode indicated in the 

--- Document Chunk 14138 ---
column). 

--- Document Chunk 14139 ---
4.7.2.1.2 A = available: This means that the input/outp ut shall become active ONLY if another 

--- Document Chunk 14140 ---
condition(s) is (are) fulfilled. This condition(s) are not described here. 

--- Document Chunk 14141 ---
4.7.2.1.3 Grey cells: availability and meaning defined by national system. 

--- Document Chunk 14142 ---
4.7.2.1.4 NA = Not Applicable: This concerns the modes SF and IS in which the DMI input s and 

--- Document Chunk 14143 ---
outputs cannot be determined. 

--- Document Chunk 14144 ---
