--- Document Chunk 14541 ---
4.8 Acceptance of received information 

--- Document Chunk 14542 ---
4.8.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 14543 ---
4.8.1.1 The aim of this chapter is to give an overview o f which information is accepted  or 

--- Document Chunk 14544 ---
rejected depending on the state of the on -board (level, mode) and the nature of the 

--- Document Chunk 14545 ---
received information (transmission medium, type of information: infill or non-infill). 

--- Document Chunk 14546 ---
4.8.1.2 The following sections have to be interpreted by applying the filters as shown in Figure 

--- Document Chunk 14547 ---
3. The first filter is detailed in section 4.8.3 “Accepted information depending on the 

--- Document Chunk 14548 ---
level and transmission media”, the third filter in section 4.8.4 “Accepted information 

--- Document Chunk 14549 ---
depending on the modes”. 

--- Document Chunk 14550 ---
4.8.1.3 If a message contains level transition information, any other information in that 

--- Document Chunk 14551 ---
message shall be evaluated considering the level transition information. 

--- Document Chunk 14552 ---
4.8.1.3.1 Information received in the same message as an immediate level transition order or a 

--- Document Chunk 14553 ---
conditional level transition order that causes a level transition  shall be evaluated first 

--- Document Chunk 14554 ---
considering the on -board currently operated level, as if a level transiti on order for 

--- Document Chunk 14555 ---
further location had been received (i.e. conditions [1] , [2] or [6] of Figure 3, if applied, 

--- Document Chunk 14556 ---
shall be automatically fulfilled). Then, if relevant, it shall be immediately extracted from 

--- Document Chunk 14557 ---
the buffer and re-evaluated according to the new selected level. 

--- Document Chunk 14558 ---
4.8.1.4 Note: As shown in Figure 3, information stored following an announcement of a 

--- Document Chunk 14559 ---
change of level, is re -checked for acceptance when the level has changed. This 

--- Document Chunk 14560 ---
implies that, when the level changes, the mode is - for a short moment – still 

--- Document Chunk 14561 ---
unchanged, until the stored information has been processed. The consequence for the 

--- Document Chunk 14562 ---
Third Filter is that information needs to be accepted for this short period also in modes 

--- Document Chunk 14563 ---
in which this information is otherwise useless. 

--- Document Chunk 14564 ---
4.8.1.5 If a message contains infill information, this  latter shall be evaluated considering all 

--- Document Chunk 14565 ---
other non-infill information in that message. 

--- Document Chunk 14566 ---
4.8.1.6 When evaluating trackside information received by radio or when re -evaluating a set of 

--- Document Chunk 14567 ---
information released from the transition buffer, linking information, if any, sh all be 

--- Document Chunk 14568 ---
evaluated prior to any other location related information. 

--- Document Chunk 14569 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14570 ---

--- Document Chunk 14614 ---

--- Document Chunk 14619 ---
[1] exception: stored onboard if an order to switch to L1 at a further location has been  received. 

--- Document Chunk 14620 ---
[2] exception: stored onboard if an order to switch to L2/3 at a further location has been received. 

--- Document Chunk 14621 ---
[3] exception: rejected if train data has been sent to the RBC and the “Acknowledgement of train data” has not been received yet. 

--- Document Chunk 14622 ---
[4] exception: rejected if the SSP and gradient already available on-board or given together with the MA do not cover the full length of the MA. 

--- Document Chunk 14623 ---
[5] exception: rejected if emergency stop(s) have been accepted and are not yet revoked or deleted onboard (see mode transitions) 

--- Document Chunk 14624 ---
[6] exception: stored onboard if an order to switch to level NTC X at a further location has been received 

--- Document Chunk 14625 ---
[7] exception: rejected if no order to switch to level NTC X at a further location has been received 

--- Document Chunk 14626 ---
[8] exception: revocable TSRs shall be rejected if information “inhibition of revocable TSRs from balises in L2/3” is stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 14627 ---
[9] exception: rejected if no level 2/3 transition order is stored onboard 

--- Document Chunk 14628 ---
[10] exception: rejected if the referred LRBG is memorised to have been reported with different “previous LRBG” 

--- Document Chunk 14629 ---
[11] exception: rejected if a level transition order is received in the same message, or if a previous level transition order has announced a level 

--- Document Chunk 14630 ---
transition still to be executed 

--- Document Chunk 14631 ---
[12] exception: rejected if the text message is sent with a request for report of driver acknowledgement with the same text message identifier as a 

--- Document Chunk 14632 ---
previously received text message, which the driver has not yet acknowledged 

--- Document Chunk 14633 ---
[13] exception: rejected if not received together with an immediate level transition order to L1/2/3 

--- Document Chunk 14634 ---
[14] exception: rejected if it relates to an order to establish a communication session with an RBC referred to in an RBC transition order currently 

--- Document Chunk 14635 ---
stored or received in the same message 

--- Document Chunk 14636 ---

--- Document Chunk 14688 ---
4.8.2 Assumptions 

--- Document Chunk 14689 ---
4.8.2.1 The following tables shall be applied assuming that: 

--- Document Chunk 14690 ---
a) the information complies with the system version checks (see section 3.17.3) and 

--- Document Chunk 14691 ---
with the data consistency checks.(see section 3.16) 

--- Document Chunk 14692 ---
b) the direction for which the information is valid matches the current train orientation, 

--- Document Chunk 14693 ---
or the balise group crossing d irection (for SL , PS  and SH engines).(see section 

--- Document Chunk 14694 ---
3.6.3) 

--- Document Chunk 14695 ---
c) In levels 2/3, it is assumed that the “RBC” information which is marked “A” 

--- Document Chunk 14696 ---
(Accepted) comes from the supervising RBC (see RBC/RBC handover). If this 

--- Document Chunk 14697 ---
information is received from the “Accepting” RBC while the “Handing Over” RBC is 

--- Document Chunk 14698 ---
still responsible, it is stored onboard until the RBC transition is performed  

--- Document Chunk 14699 ---
Exception 1: The information “Acknowledgement of Train Data”, “ Trackside 

--- Document Chunk 14700 ---
constituent system version ”, "Session Management" and “Acknowledgement of  

--- Document Chunk 14701 ---
Session Termination" shall be immediately accepted.  

--- Document Chunk 14702 ---
Exception 2: The information “Co -operative shortening of MA” , “Revocation of 

--- Document Chunk 14703 ---
Emergency Stop” and “LSSMA display toggle on/off order” shall be rejected. 

--- Document Chunk 14704 ---
d) to check exception [4] in 4.8.3, the track descript ion is referred to the LRBG  (i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 14705 ---
relocation has been performed see 3.6.4.3). 

--- Document Chunk 14706 ---
e) the information from balise is received while no reverse movement is performed 

--- Document Chunk 14707 ---
(see clause 3.14.3.6) 

--- Document Chunk 14708 ---
4.8.2.2 Regarding 4.8.2.1 a): In case a balise is missed or a balise telegram cannot be 

--- Document Chunk 14709 ---
decoded, the information “Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction”  is 

--- Document Chunk 14710 ---
only used by the on -board equipment to inhibit the service brake reaction, while the 

--- Document Chunk 14711 ---
balise group message is rejected. If all the telegrams from a balise group are cor rectly 

--- Document Chunk 14712 ---
read, the information “ Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction” , if 

--- Document Chunk 14713 ---
received, shall be ignored by the on -board equipment. Therefore this information need 

--- Document Chunk 14714 ---
not to be referred to in the following tables. 

--- Document Chunk 14715 ---
4.8.2.3 In case a balise telegram contains the information VBC marker and a country/region 

--- Document Chunk 14716 ---
identity that both match a stored VBC, the whole balise telegram is ignored and any 

--- Document Chunk 14717 ---
further check in relation to this balise telegram is irrelevant (refer to 3.15.9. 3 b) ). 

--- Document Chunk 14718 ---
Otherwise the information VBC mar ker, if included in a consistent balise group 

--- Document Chunk 14719 ---
message, shall always be ignored by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment and need 

--- Document Chunk 14720 ---
not to be referred to in the following tables. 

--- Document Chunk 14721 ---
4.8.2.4 Note: with the exception of the data that is forwarded to a National System through the 

--- Document Chunk 14722 ---
STM interface (see 3.15.6 and SUBSET -035), what will happen to the data to be used 

--- Document Chunk 14723 ---
by applications outside ERTMS/ETCS  (e.g. whether it is discarded, forwarded to an 

--- Document Chunk 14724 ---
external application, processed by a national function…) is outside the scope of this 

--- Document Chunk 14725 ---
specification and is assumed as not being part of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 14726 ---
functionality. 

--- Document Chunk 14727 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 14965 ---
[1] exception: stored onboard if an order to switch to L1 at a further location has been received. 

--- Document Chunk 14966 ---
[2] exception: stored onboard if an order to switch to L2/3 at a further location has been received. 

--- Document Chunk 14967 ---
[3] exception: rejected if Train Data has been sent to th e RBC and the “Acknowledgement of Train Data” has 

--- Document Chunk 14968 ---
not been received yet. 

--- Document Chunk 14969 ---
[4] exception: rejected if the SSP and gradient already available on -board or given together with the MA do 

--- Document Chunk 14970 ---
not cover the full length of the MA. 

--- Document Chunk 14971 ---
[5] exception: rejected if emergency s top(s) have been accepted and are not yet revoked or deleted onboard 

--- Document Chunk 14972 ---
(see mode transitions). 

--- Document Chunk 14973 ---
[8] exception: revocable TSRs shall be rejected if information “inhibition of revocable TSRs from balises in 

--- Document Chunk 14974 ---
L2/3” is stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 14975 ---
[9] exception: rejected if no level 2/3 transition order is stored onboard. 

--- Document Chunk 14976 ---
[10] exception: rejected if the referred LRBG is memorised to have been reported with different “previous 

--- Document Chunk 14977 ---
LRBG” 

--- Document Chunk 14978 ---
[11] exception: rejected if a level transition order is received in the same message, or if a previous level 

--- Document Chunk 14979 ---
transition order has announced a level transition still to be executed 

--- Document Chunk 14980 ---
[12] exception: rejected if the text message is sent with a request for report of driver acknowledgement with 

--- Document Chunk 14981 ---
the same text message identifier as a previously received text message, which the driver has not yet 

--- Document Chunk 14982 ---
acknowledged 

--- Document Chunk 14983 ---
[13] exception: rejected if not received together with an immediate level transition order to L1/2/3 

--- Document Chunk 14984 ---
[14] exception: rejected if it relates to an order to establish a communication session with an RBC referred to 

--- Document Chunk 14985 ---
in an RBC transition order currently stored or received in the same message

--- Document Chunk 15362 ---
4.8.5 Handling of transition buffer in case of level transition announcement or 

--- Document Chunk 15363 ---
RBC/RBC handover 

--- Document Chunk 15364 ---
4.8.5.1 If an order to switch to level NTC, 1, 2 or 3 at a further location has been received , the 

--- Document Chunk 15365 ---
ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall be able to store in a transition buffer (see 

--- Document Chunk 15366 ---
figure 3, first filter) three sets of information obtained from three filtered messages. 

--- Document Chunk 15367 ---
4.8.5.2 If a RBC transition order has been received and the Handing Over RBC is still the 

--- Document Chunk 15368 ---
supervising one, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall be  able to store in a 

--- Document Chunk 15369 ---
transition buffer (see figure 3, second filter) three sets of information obtained from 

--- Document Chunk 15370 ---
three filtered messages from the Accepting RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 15371 ---
4.8.5.2.1 Note: the term “set of information” refers to the part of a message being stored in the 

--- Document Chunk 15372 ---
transition b uffer (i.e. information which is neither accepted nor rejected immediately) 

--- Document Chunk 15373 ---
according to the conditions stated in 4.8.3.1 [1] and [2] (for level transition) or 

--- Document Chunk 15374 ---
according to 4.8.2.1c (for RBC/RBC handover). 

--- Document Chunk 15375 ---
4.8.5.3 In case three sets of information are already stored in the transition buffer, any new set 

--- Document Chunk 15376 ---
to be stored shall replace the oldest one currently stored. 

--- Document Chunk 15377 ---
4.8.5.4 The sets of information stored in the transition buffer shall be deleted: 

--- Document Chunk 15378 ---
a) in case the level transition order is deleted or overwritten by another level tra nsition 

--- Document Chunk 15379 ---
order for a different level, OR 

--- Document Chunk 15380 ---
b) in case the RBC transition order is deleted or overwritten by an order to switch to 

--- Document Chunk 15381 ---
another Accepting RBC, OR 

--- Document Chunk 15382 ---
c) in case the communication session with the RBC that provided the stored 

--- Document Chunk 15383 ---
information is terminated 

--- Document Chunk 15384 ---
4.8.5.5 At the s ame time the level transition is performed or at the same time the Accepting 

--- Document Chunk 15385 ---
RBC becomes the supervising one, the sets of information stored in the transition 

--- Document Chunk 15386 ---
buffer shall be released and re-evaluated in the sequence they have been received. 

--- Document Chunk 15387 ---
4.8.5.6 This sequential re-evaluation of all the released information shall be a prerequisite to 

--- Document Chunk 15388 ---
any use by the on -board equipment (e.g. it will lead neither to an intermediate change 

--- Document Chunk 15389 ---
of mode nor to a change of information displayed to the driver) and shall obey the 

--- Document Chunk 15390 ---
following principles: 

--- Document Chunk 15391 ---
a) Starting from the information currently used by on -board at the moment the 

--- Document Chunk 15392 ---
level/RBC transition is effective, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 15393 ---
determine the new information for train supervision, by performing sequential 

--- Document Chunk 15394 ---
updates from the information released from the transition buffer, if accepted. 

--- Document Chunk 15395 ---
b) For each information update related to a re -evaluated set of information, the same 

--- Document Chunk 15396 ---
rules shall apply as to information update related to new information accepted 

--- Document Chunk 15397 ---
outside a level/RBC transition context. 

--- Document Chunk 15398 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15399 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15400 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15401 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 15402 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 15403 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 15404 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15405 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15406 ---
Page 69/75 

--- Document Chunk 15407 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15408 ---
c) The information resulting from this sequential update shall then be used by the 

--- Document Chunk 15409 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 15410 ---
4.8.5.7 Accepting re -evaluated Conditional Emergency Stop information according to table 

--- Document Chunk 15411 ---
4.8.3 implies that the accepted Conditional Emergency St op information may be 

--- Document Chunk 15412 ---
accepted or rejected in a further step (see clause 3.10.2.2) depending on the given 

--- Document Chunk 15413 ---
stop location. This decision , based on the comparison between the min safe front end 

--- Document Chunk 15414 ---
position of the train at the time the message was received and th e given stop location, 

--- Document Chunk 15415 ---
shall be considered part of the evaluation process as it affects the further re -evaluation 

--- Document Chunk 15416 ---
of information stored in the transition buffer (see clause 3.10.2.4). 

--- Document Chunk 15417 ---
4.8.5.7.1 Note: For the case of the Unconditional Emergency Stop information accep ting the 

--- Document Chunk 15418 ---
information according to table 4.8.3 will always lead to the train being tripped (see 

--- Document Chunk 15419 ---
clause 3.10.2.3) when re -evaluation of the transition buffer is completed . Information 

--- Document Chunk 15420 ---
accepted during re-evaluation of information stored in the transition buff er can then be 

--- Document Chunk 15421 ---
affected on transition to TR mode according to conditions in Table 4.10. 

--- Document Chunk 15422 ---
4.8.5.8 Note: The requirement to acknowledge an Emergency Stop information according to 

--- Document Chunk 15423 ---
clause 3.10.1.4, i.e., communicating to the RBC if the information has been accepted 

--- Document Chunk 15424 ---
(Conditional or Unconditional Emergency Stop) or rejected because the train has 

--- Document Chunk 15425 ---
passed the stop location (Conditional Emergency Stop only), applies to the time when 

--- Document Chunk 15426 ---
the information is used, immediately after the sequential update has been completed. 

--- Document Chunk 15427 ---
Regards acknowledging the reception of an emergency stop message, as for any 

--- Document Chunk 15428 ---
other information received from trackside, see clause 3.16.3.5. 

--- Document Chunk 15429 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 15439 ---
4.9 What happens to accepted and stored information when 

--- Document Chunk 15440 ---
entering a given level 

--- Document Chunk 15441 ---
4.9.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 15442 ---
4.9.1.1 Every data that can be stored onboa rd after being accepted may be influenced by a 

--- Document Chunk 15443 ---
level transition. 

--- Document Chunk 15444 ---
4.9.1.2 A level transition acts on the “status” of stored information. 

--- Document Chunk 15445 ---
4.9.1.3 In case of entering level 1, MA Request Parameters, Position Report Parameters and 

--- Document Chunk 15446 ---
Track Ahead Free Request shall be deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15447 ---
4.9.1.3.1 In case of entering level 0, NTC or 1, the information “Inhibition of revocable TSRs 

--- Document Chunk 15448 ---
from balises in L2/3” shall be deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15449 ---
4.9.1.4 For all other stored data, a level transition has no effect (void). 

--- Document Chunk 15450 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15451 ---

--- Document Chunk 15460 ---
4.10 What happens to accepted and stored information when 

--- Document Chunk 15461 ---
entering a given mode 

--- Document Chunk 15462 ---
4.10.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 15463 ---
4.10.1.1 Every data that can be stored onboard after being accepted may be influenced by a 

--- Document Chunk 15464 ---
mode transition. 

--- Document Chunk 15465 ---
4.10.1.2 A mode transition acts on the “status” of stored information. 

--- Document Chunk 15466 ---
4.10.1.3 Depending on which mode is entered, the action shall be one of the following: 

--- Document Chunk 15467 ---
a) data is deleted, 

--- Document Chunk 15468 ---
b) data is to be revalidated, 

--- Document Chunk 15469 ---
c) data is reset (set to default values) 

--- Document Chunk 15470 ---
d) data status is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 15471 ---
e) not relevant (the action on the data cannot be determined. This concerns the entry 

--- Document Chunk 15472 ---
in SF and IS modes) 

--- Document Chunk 15473 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15474 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15475 ---
D = Deleted TBR = To Be Revalidated U = Unchanged NR = Not relevant R = Reset 

--- Document Chunk 15476 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15477 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15478 ---

--- Document Chunk 15614 ---
order to establish a communication session, is stored on-board)

--- Document Chunk 15689 ---
No Cold movement 

--- Document Chunk 15690 ---
occurred 

--- Document Chunk 15691 ---
               

--- Document Chunk 15692 ---
Cold movement detected or 

--- Document Chunk 15693 ---
Cold movement information 

--- Document Chunk 15694 ---
not available 

--- Document Chunk 15695 ---
               

--- Document Chunk 15696 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15697 ---
4.11.1.2 Note: Status of stored in formation, which remains valid after NP mode has been 

--- Document Chunk 15698 ---
entered, is not affected by information from the Cold Movement Detection function.  

--- Document Chunk 15699 ---
4.11.1.3 If a cold movement has been detected, or the Cold Movement Detection function is not 

--- Document Chunk 15700 ---
able to confirm that no cold move ment has taken place, no change of status of 

--- Document Chunk 15701 ---
information to “valid” shall be made until it has been validated by a different means 

--- Document Chunk 15702 ---
than cold movement detection. 

--- Document Chunk 15703 ---

--- Document Chunk 16088 ---
5.3 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 16089 ---
5.3.1 Scope and Purpose 

--- Document Chunk 16090 ---
5.3.1.1 This document defines the procedures that are necessary for interoperability within the 

--- Document Chunk 16091 ---
scope of ERTMS/ETCS. 

--- Document Chunk 16092 ---
5.3.1.2 Each procedure is defined by a set of mandatory requirements and , where convenient, 

--- Document Chunk 16093 ---
is illustrated by a flowchart. 

--- Document Chunk 16094 ---
5.3.1.3 In case the condition(s) in chapter 4 triggering a mode transition is(are) fulfilled, this 

--- Document Chunk 16095 ---
transition shall be executed even if not shown in the chapter 5 procedures. 

--- Document Chunk 16096 ---
5.3.1.3.1 Note: Such a mode transition could lead to exit ing a procedure immediately (e. g. cut 

--- Document Chunk 16097 ---
off power of on-board equipment, isolation of on-board equipment). 

--- Document Chunk 16098 ---
5.3.1.4 National operation rules (outside of ERTMS/ETCS) are also excluded, but may be 

--- Document Chunk 16099 ---
applied by the railways in addition to the procedures as long as interoperability is 

--- Document Chunk 16100 ---
retained. 

--- Document Chunk 16101 ---
5.3.2 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 16102 ---
5.3.2.1 Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 16103 ---
A procedure defines the required reaction of the ERTMS/ETCS entities (subsystems 

--- Document Chunk 16104 ---
and components) to either information exchanged between ERTMS/ETCS entities or 

--- Document Chunk 16105 ---
events (triggered by external entities or internal events). The procedures focus on the 

--- Document Chunk 16106 ---
required change in status and mode of the described ERTMS/ETCS entities. 

--- Document Chunk 16107 ---
5.3.2.2 Entities 

--- Document Chunk 16108 ---
The procedures define the required system behaviour on a context level, i. e. the 

--- Document Chunk 16109 ---
entities that are used to define the procedures are for example: the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 16110 ---
equipment, the trackside equipment (RBC/Balise), the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 16111 ---
5.3.2.3 States 

--- Document Chunk 16112 ---
States are situations of an ETCS subsystem with a specific set of available functions 

--- Document Chunk 16113 ---
and a specific set of events that may start or terminate the state. A state remains 

--- Document Chunk 16114 ---
active as long as the conditions to trigger the transition to a succeeding state are not 

--- Document Chunk 16115 ---
completely satisfied.  

--- Document Chunk 16116 ---
Note 1: one mode of operation may include several states for the on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 16117 ---
Note 2: A new state is only created, if the behaviour of the system differs from another 

--- Document Chunk 16118 ---
one. P ossession of information (e. g. location information) or not does not force 

--- Document Chunk 16119 ---
branching in states. 

--- Document Chunk 16120 ---
5.3.2.4 Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 16121 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16122 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16123 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16124 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 16125 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 16126 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 16127 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 16128 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 16129 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 16130 ---
Page 9/100 

--- Document Chunk 16131 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16132 ---
Transitions define the rules for passing from one state to another. A transition is 

--- Document Chunk 16133 ---
triggered by a set of conditions which has to be fulfilled in a  defined order or at the 

--- Document Chunk 16134 ---
same time. When a transition refers to a driver’s selection, it means that the conditions 

--- Document Chunk 16135 ---
to enable the corresponding button on the DMI were fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 16136 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16137 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16138 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16139 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 16140 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 16141 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 16142 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 16143 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 16144 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 16145 ---
Page 10/100 

--- Document Chunk 16146 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16147 ---
5.4 Procedure Start of mission 

--- Document Chunk 16148 ---
5.4.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 16149 ---
5.4.1.1 The driver may have to start a mission: 

--- Document Chunk 16150 ---
a) Once the train is awake, OR 

--- Document Chunk 16151 ---
b) Once shunting movements are finished, OR 

--- Document Chunk 16152 ---
c) Once a mission is ended, OR 

--- Document Chunk 16153 ---
d) Once a slave engine becomes a leading engine. 

--- Document Chunk 16154 ---
5.4.1.2 The common point of all these situations is that the ERTMS/ETCS on -board is in 

--- Document Chunk 16155 ---
Stand-By mode, but the Start of Mission will be different, since some data may be 

--- Document Chunk 16156 ---
already stored on-board, depending on the previous situation. 

--- Document Chunk 16157 ---
5.4.1.3 Once the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in Stand-By mode, the start of mission 

--- Document Chunk 16158 ---
is not the only possibility, the engine may be come remote controlled (i.e. the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 16159 ---
switches to Sleeping mode). 

--- Document Chunk 16160 ---
5.4.2 Status of data stored in the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 16161 ---
5.4.2.1 At the beginning of the Start of Mission procedure, the data required may be in one of 

--- Document Chunk 16162 ---
three states:  

--- Document Chunk 16163 ---
a) “valid” (the stored value is known to be correct) 

--- Document Chunk 16164 ---
b) “Invalid” (the stored value may be wrong) 

--- Document Chunk 16165 ---
c) “Unknown” (no stored value available) 

--- Document Chunk 16166 ---
5.4.2.2 This refers to the following data: Driver ID, ERTMS/ETCS level, RBC ID/phone 

--- Document Chunk 16167 ---
number, Train Data, Train Running Number, Train Position (see 3.6.1.3). 

--- Document Chunk 16168 ---
5.4.2.3 Note 1:  The status of data in relation to the previous and the actual mode is described 

--- Document Chunk 16169 ---
in chapter 4, section "What happens to stored information when entering a mode". 

--- Document Chunk 16170 ---
5.4.2.4 Note 2: The change of status of data in course of the procedure is shown in the table 

--- Document Chunk 16171 ---
in section 5.4.3.3. 

--- Document Chunk 16172 ---
5.4.3 Table of requirements for “Start of Mission” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 16173 ---
5.4.3.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 16174 ---
a flow chart in section 5.4.4.  

--- Document Chunk 16175 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16176 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16177 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16178 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 16179 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 16180 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 16181 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 16182 ---

Procedures

--- Document Chunk 16185 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16186 ---
5.4.3.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 16187 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 16188 ---
S0 The Start of Mission procedure shall be engaged when the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 16189 ---
equipment is in Stand -By mode with a desk open and no communication session is 

--- Document Chunk 16190 ---
established or is being established. 

--- Document Chunk 16191 ---
S1 Depending on the status of the Driver-ID, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 16192 ---
request the driver to enter the Driver -ID (if the Driver -ID is unknown) or shall request 

--- Document Chunk 16193 ---
the driver to revalidate or re-enter the Driver-ID (if the Driver-ID is invalid). 

--- Document Chunk 16194 ---
The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall offer the d river the possibility to 

--- Document Chunk 16195 ---
enter/re-validate (depending on the status) the Train running number. 

--- Document Chunk 16196 ---
The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall also offer the driver the possibility to 

--- Document Chunk 16197 ---
set/remove a Virtual Balise Cover. 

--- Document Chunk 16198 ---
Once the Driver-ID is entered or revalidated (E1) (possibly further to the Train running 

--- Document Chunk 16199 ---
number entry/revalidation and/or to Virtual Balise Cover setting/removal ), the process 

--- Document Chunk 16200 ---
shall go to D2 

--- Document Chunk 16201 ---
D2 If both the stored position and the stored level are valid, the process shall go to D3 

--- Document Chunk 16202 ---
If the stored posit ion or the stored level is “invalid” or “unknown”, the process shall go 

--- Document Chunk 16203 ---
to S2 

--- Document Chunk 16204 ---
D3 If the stored level is 2 or 3, the process shall go to D7 

--- Document Chunk 16205 ---
If the stored level is 0,1 or NTC, the process shall go to S10 

--- Document Chunk 16206 ---
D7 If at least one Mobile Terminal is registered to a Radio Network, the process shall go 

--- Document Chunk 16207 ---
to A31 

--- Document Chunk 16208 ---
If no Mobile Terminal is registered to a Radio Network, the process shall go to S4 

--- Document Chunk 16209 ---
S2 If the status of the Level data is "unknown", the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 16210 ---
shall request the driver to enter it. 

--- Document Chunk 16211 ---
If the status of the Level data is "invalid", the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 16212 ---
request the driver to re-validate or re-enter the ERTMS/ETCS level. 

--- Document Chunk 16213 ---
If the entered / re-validated level is 2 or 3, the process shall go to S3 

--- Document Chunk 16214 ---
If the entered / re-validated level is 0, 1 or one of proposed NTC level(s) (see 3.18.4.2 

--- Document Chunk 16215 ---
for the levels the driver is allowed to select), the process shall go to S10 

--- Document Chunk 16216 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16217 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16218 ---

ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 16229 ---
S3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver to re -

--- Document Chunk 16230 ---
enter the Radio Network ID. If the driver elects to do so, the on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 16231 ---
terminate the ongoing communication session, if any. As soon as the related safe 

--- Document Chunk 16232 ---
connection is released, the on -board equipment shall acquire an alphanumeric list of 

--- Document Chunk 16233 ---
available and allowed networks, based on a request to the Mobile Terminal(s): 

--- Document Chunk 16234 ---
 If this list is empty (E3) the process shall go to A29 

--- Document Chunk 16235 ---
 If the driver selects a new Radio Network ID  from the proposed list, the 

--- Document Chunk 16236 ---
registration of the Mobile Terminal(s) to this new Radio Network shall be 

--- Document Chunk 16237 ---
ordered and if not “unknown” the status of the RBC -ID/phone number shall be 

--- Document Chunk 16238 ---
immediately set to “invalid”. 

--- Document Chunk 16239 ---
If at least one Mobile Terminal is registered to a Radio Network , the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 16240 ---
on-board equipment shall offer the following options to the driver  for the RBC -

--- Document Chunk 16241 ---
ID/phone number: 

--- Document Chunk 16242 ---
 Only if the status of the RBC -ID/phone number is “invalid ” or “valid”: order the 

--- Document Chunk 16243 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment to use the last stored RBC -ID/phone 

--- Document Chunk 16244 ---
number 

--- Document Chunk 16245 ---
 Order the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment to use the EIRENE short 

--- Document Chunk 16246 ---
number (trackside call routing function) 

--- Document Chunk 16247 ---
 Enter the RBC -ID/phone number (if its status is "unknown"), or revalidate/re -

--- Document Chunk 16248 ---
enter it (if its status is “invalid” or “valid”). 

--- Document Chunk 16249 ---
Once the driver has selected the first or second option or once data is validated ( E5), 

--- Document Chunk 16250 ---
the process shall go to A31 

--- Document Chunk 16251 ---
S4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall wait until: 

--- Document Chunk 16252 ---
 at least one Mobile Terminal is registered to a Radio Network ( E6); in such 

--- Document Chunk 16253 ---
case the process shall go to A31, OR 

--- Document Chunk 16254 ---
 a sufficient time (refer to Appendix A .3.1) is elapsed since it has sent the latest 

--- Document Chunk 16255 ---
Radio Network registration order to a Mobile Terminal ( E7); in such case the 

--- Document Chunk 16256 ---
process shall go to A29 

--- Document Chunk 16257 ---
A29 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall inform the driver that the Radio Network 

--- Document Chunk 16258 ---
registration has failed 

--- Document Chunk 16259 ---
This condition leads to S10 (the driver has t o unlock the situation to continue e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 16260 ---
selection of new level) 

--- Document Chunk 16261 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 16273 ---
S10 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver to select 

--- Document Chunk 16274 ---
SH, NL, or to select Train Data Entry. 

--- Document Chunk 16275 ---
 If the driver selects SH ( E12), the process shall continue in the same way as the 

--- Document Chunk 16276 ---
procedure “Shunting initiated by the driver”.  

--- Document Chunk 16277 ---
If, in level 2 or 3, the RBC rejects the request for Shunting ( E13), the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 16278 ---
go back to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 16279 ---
 If the driver selects NL ( E10) then the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 16280 ---
immediately switch to Non Leading mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transition 

--- Document Chunk 16281 ---
between modes: transition [46]). The mission starts in NL mode (if level is 2 or 3, 

--- Document Chunk 16282 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment also reports the change of mode to the 

--- Document Chunk 16283 ---
RBC).   

--- Document Chunk 16284 ---
 If the driver selects Train Data Entry (E11), the process shall go to S12   

--- Document Chunk 16285 ---
 Following E10, E12,  if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall 

--- Document Chunk 16286 ---
delete the train position data (new status: “unknown”) 

--- Document Chunk 16287 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16288 ---
S12 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request the driver to enter/revalidate the 

--- Document Chunk 16289 ---
Train Data that requires driver validation. 

--- Document Chunk 16290 ---
Once Train Data is stored and validated (E16), the process shall go to D12 

--- Document Chunk 16291 ---
D12 If Train running number is valid, the process shall go to D10 

--- Document Chunk 16292 ---
If Train running number is “unknown” or “invalid”, the process shall go to S13 

--- Document Chunk 16293 ---
S13 If the status of the Train running number is  "unknown" or “invalid”, the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 16294 ---
on-board equipment shall request the driver to enter /re-validate the Train running 

--- Document Chunk 16295 ---
number now. 

--- Document Chunk 16296 ---
Once Train running number is entered/re-validated (E18), the process shall go to D10. 

--- Document Chunk 16297 ---
D10 When the validated level is 2/3, the process shall go to D11 

--- Document Chunk 16298 ---
When the validated level is 0,1 or NTC, the process shall go to S20 

--- Document Chunk 16299 ---
D11 When the session is open, the process shall go to S11, otherwise it shall go to S10 

--- Document Chunk 16300 ---
S11 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall send Train Data to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 16301 ---
When the RBC acknowledges Train Data ( E14), then the ERTMS/ETCS onboard 

--- Document Chunk 16302 ---
equipment shall go to the step S20. 

--- Document Chunk 16303 ---

--- Document Chunk 16315 ---
S20 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver to select 

--- Document Chunk 16316 ---
“Start” 

--- Document Chunk 16317 ---
a) When the validated level is NTC and the driver selects "start" ( E20), the 

--- Document Chunk 16318 ---
process shall go to S22 

--- Document Chunk 16319 ---
b) When the validated level is 0 and the driver selects "start" ( E21), the process 

--- Document Chunk 16320 ---
shall go to S23 

--- Document Chunk 16321 ---
c) When the validated level is 1 and the driver selects "start" ( E22), the process 

--- Document Chunk 16322 ---
shall go to S24 

--- Document Chunk 16323 ---
d) When the validated level is 2 or 3 and the driver selects "start" ( E24), the 

--- Document Chunk 16324 ---
process shall go to S21 

--- Document Chunk 16325 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16326 ---
S21 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall send an MA request to the RBC and 

--- Document Chunk 16327 ---
wait. 

--- Document Chunk 16328 ---
If an SR authorisation is received from RBC (E26), the process shall go to S24 

--- Document Chunk 16329 ---
If an MA allowing OS/LS/SH is received from RBC (E27), the process shall go to S25 

--- Document Chunk 16330 ---
If an MA allowing FS is received from RBC ( E29), the mission starts in Full 

--- Document Chunk 16331 ---
Supervision mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition from 

--- Document Chunk 16332 ---
SB to FS) 

--- Document Chunk 16333 ---
S22 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 16334 ---
driver for running under supervision of the selected National System. When the driver 

--- Document Chunk 16335 ---
acknowledges ( E30) , the mission starts in S N mode  (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 16336 ---
transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 16337 ---
Following E30, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall delete 

--- Document Chunk 16338 ---
the train position data (new status: “unknown”) 

--- Document Chunk 16339 ---
S23 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall require an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 16340 ---
driver for running in Unfitted mode. When the driver acknowledges ( E31), the mission 

--- Document Chunk 16341 ---
starts in Unfitted mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition 

--- Document Chunk 16342 ---
from SB to UN) 

--- Document Chunk 16343 ---
Following E31, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall delete 

--- Document Chunk 16344 ---
the train position data (new status: “unknown”)” 

--- Document Chunk 16345 ---
S24 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall require an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 16346 ---
driver for running in Staff Responsible mode. When the driver acknowledges ( E32), 

--- Document Chunk 16347 ---
the mission starts in SR mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: 

--- Document Chunk 16348 ---
transition from SB to SR) 

--- Document Chunk 16349 ---
Following E32, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall delete 

--- Document Chunk 16350 ---
the train position data (new status: “unknown”)” 

--- Document Chunk 16351 ---

--- Document Chunk 16363 ---
S25 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall require an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 16364 ---
driver for running in On Sight/Limited Supervision/Shunting mode. When the driver 

--- Document Chunk 16365 ---
acknowledges ( E33), the mission starts in On Sight/Limited Supervision/Shunting  

--- Document Chunk 16366 ---
mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition from SB to OS , 

--- Document Chunk 16367 ---
LS or SH) 

--- Document Chunk 16368 ---
A31 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall open the session with the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 16369 ---
D31 If the opening of the session is successful, the process shall go to D32 

--- Document Chunk 16370 ---
If the opening of the session has failed, the process shall go to A32 

--- Document Chunk 16371 ---
A32 The driver shall be informed when the on -board equipment fails to open a radio 

--- Document Chunk 16372 ---
session. 

--- Document Chunk 16373 ---
Opening  of a radio session has failed if 

--- Document Chunk 16374 ---
 No connection to the RBC can be established (see section 3.5.3.7) OR 

--- Document Chunk 16375 ---
 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, based on the system configuration 

--- Document Chunk 16376 ---
reported by the RBC, decides that compatibility is not ensured and terminates the 

--- Document Chunk 16377 ---
communication session 

--- Document Chunk 16378 ---
This condition leads to  S10 (The driver has to unlock the situation to c ontinue e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 16379 ---
selection of new level). 

--- Document Chunk 16380 ---
D32 If the stored position is valid, the process shall go to A33 

--- Document Chunk 16381 ---
If the stored position is invalid or unknown, the process shall go to A34 

--- Document Chunk 16382 ---
A33 If the train position data stored in the on -board equipment is of status “valid”, the train 

--- Document Chunk 16383 ---
position, marked as “valid” shall be transmitted to the RBC via the "SoM position 

--- Document Chunk 16384 ---
report" message. 

--- Document Chunk 16385 ---
This condition leads to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 16386 ---
A34 If the train position data stored in the on -board equipment is of status “invalid” or 

--- Document Chunk 16387 ---
"unknown", the train position, marked as “invalid” or "unknown" shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 16388 ---
the RBC via the "SoM position report" message. 

--- Document Chunk 16389 ---
The process shall then go to D33 

--- Document Chunk 16390 ---
D33 When the position report marked as "invalid" is received by the RBC, this latter shall 

--- Document Chunk 16391 ---
check whether it can validate this position report. 

--- Document Chunk 16392 ---
If the position report can be validated by the RBC, the process shall go to A35 

--- Document Chunk 16393 ---
Otherwise, if the position report was marked "unknown", or the "invalid" position report 

--- Document Chunk 16394 ---
cannot be validated by the RBC, the process shall go to D22 

--- Document Chunk 16395 ---
Note: How the RBC is able to validate the position report  is a national issue, out of 

--- Document Chunk 16396 ---
the scope for this specification 

--- Document Chunk 16397 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 16404 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 16405 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 16406 ---

--- Document Chunk 16407 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16408 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 16409 ---
A35 The RBC shall inform the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment that the reported position 

--- Document Chunk 16410 ---
is valid. 

--- Document Chunk 16411 ---
When this message is received  by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment, the status  

--- Document Chunk 16412 ---
of the position shall be set to "valid" 

--- Document Chunk 16413 ---
The process shall go to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 16414 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16415 ---
D22 If the reported train position is "unknown", or the RBC is not able to confirm a reported 

--- Document Chunk 16416 ---
"invalid" position, the RBC shall nevert heless decide whether it accepts the train or 

--- Document Chunk 16417 ---
not. 

--- Document Chunk 16418 ---
If yes, the process shall go to A23 

--- Document Chunk 16419 ---
If no, the process shall go to A38 

--- Document Chunk 16420 ---
Note: How the RBC assumes responsibility for the train is a national issue, out of the 

--- Document Chunk 16421 ---
scope for this specification 

--- Document Chunk 16422 ---
A23 The RBC shall inform the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment that it accepts the train 

--- Document Chunk 16423 ---
although the on-board has no "valid" position information. 

--- Document Chunk 16424 ---
A24 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is informed that the train is accepted 

--- Document Chunk 16425 ---
without valid position data, it shall delete t he train position data (new status: 

--- Document Chunk 16426 ---
“unknown”) 

--- Document Chunk 16427 ---
This condition leads to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 16428 ---
A38 The RBC shall inform the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment that it rejects the train 

--- Document Chunk 16429 ---
A39 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is informed that the train is rejected, it 

--- Document Chunk 16430 ---
shall d elete the train position data (new status: “unknown”) and shall terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 16431 ---
session with the RBC.  

--- Document Chunk 16432 ---
The process shall then go to A40 

--- Document Chunk 16433 ---
A40 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall inform the driver that the train is 

--- Document Chunk 16434 ---
rejected 

--- Document Chunk 16435 ---
This condition leads to S10 (the driver has to unlock the situation to continue e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 16436 ---
selection of new level). 

--- Document Chunk 16437 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16438 ---
5.4.3.2.1 The SoM procedure shall end as soon as at least one of the following conditions is 

--- Document Chunk 16439 ---
fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 16440 ---
 Transition to any mode other than SB 

--- Document Chunk 16441 ---
 The desk is closed 

--- Document Chunk 16442 ---
5.4.3.2.2 When the driver closes the  desk, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 16443 ---
terminate the communication session with the RBC, if any. 

--- Document Chunk 16444 ---

--- Document Chunk 16828 ---
5.4.5 Degraded Situations 

--- Document Chunk 16829 ---
5.4.5.1 Nominally, accidental loss of an already open session (that can occur at any step) has 

--- Document Chunk 16830 ---
not been taken into account for the design of the SoM flowchart. However, should such 

--- Document Chunk 16831 ---
a fault occur above D11 the nominal procedure applies (refer to D11 in flowchart). On 

--- Document Chunk 16832 ---
the other hand, if it occurs in any step further than D11, the process shall go to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 16833 ---
5.4.5.2 The SoM flowchart described in section 5.4.3 only includes the main paths and does 

--- Document Chunk 16834 ---
not exhaustively cover the various operational situations, which could occur while 

--- Document Chunk 16835 ---
performing the SoM procedure (e.g. when revised instructions are given to the driver or 

--- Document Chunk 16836 ---
when the driver needs to re-enter already captured data). 

--- Document Chunk 16837 ---
5.4.5.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall also offer the driver the following 

--- Document Chunk 16838 ---
possibilities, in addition to the ones that are described in section 5.4.3: 

--- Document Chunk 16839 ---
a) only at S10 and S20 and if the conditions defined in 5.8.2.1 for Stand By are 

--- Document Chunk 16840 ---
fulfilled, to select “Override”. If the driver chooses to do so, then the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 16841 ---
go to the procedure “Override” and, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 16842 ---
on-board shall delete the train position data (new status: “unknown”) 

--- Document Chunk 16843 ---
b) only at S10 and S20, to re-enter the Driver-ID 

--- Document Chunk 16844 ---
c) only at S10 and S20,to re-enter the “Train running number” 

--- Document Chunk 16845 ---
d) only at S20,  to re-enter the Train data . If the driver chooses to do so , then the 

--- Document Chunk 16846 ---
process shall go to S12. 

--- Document Chunk 16847 ---
e) only at S10 and S20, to re -enter the Level. If the driver chooses to do so, t hen the 

--- Document Chunk 16848 ---
process shall go to S2 

--- Document Chunk 16849 ---
f) only at S20, to select “Non Leading”. If the driver chooses to do so, then the 

--- Document Chunk 16850 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall immediately switch to Non Leading mode 

--- Document Chunk 16851 ---
and, if the position i s still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall delete the train 

--- Document Chunk 16852 ---
position data (new status: “unknown”). 

--- Document Chunk 16853 ---
g) only at S20, to select “Shunting”. If the driver chooses to do so, then the process 

--- Document Chunk 16854 ---
shall go to the procedure “Shunting initiated by driver” and, if the position is still 

--- Document Chunk 16855 ---
invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall delete the train position data (new status: 

--- Document Chunk 16856 ---
“unknown”). If, in level 2 or 3, the RBC rejects the request for Shunting, the process 

--- Document Chunk 16857 ---
shall go back to S20. 

--- Document Chunk 16858 ---
h) only at S10, if valid Train Data is available,  to select “Start”. If the driver chooses to 

--- Document Chunk 16859 ---
do so: 

--- Document Chunk 16860 ---
 if the level is 0, then the process shall go to S23. 

--- Document Chunk 16861 ---
 if the level is NTC, then the process shall go to S22. 

--- Document Chunk 16862 ---
 if the level is 1, then the process shall go to S24. 

--- Document Chunk 16863 ---
 if the level is 2/3 and a session is open, then the process shall go to S21. 

--- Document Chunk 16864 ---
 if the level is 2/3 and no session is open, then the process shall go to S24. 

--- Document Chunk 16865 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16866 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16867 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16868 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 16869 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 16870 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 16871 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 16872 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 16873 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 16874 ---
Page 21/100 

--- Document Chunk 16875 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16876 ---
i) only at S10 and S20, to set/remove a Virtual Balise Cover. 

--- Document Chunk 16877 ---
j) only at S10 and S20, to re-enter the Radio data. If the driver chooses to do so: 

--- Document Chunk 16878 ---
 If the level is 2/3, then the process shall go to S3. 

--- Document Chunk 16879 ---
 If the level is 0/1/NTC, then the driver shall only have the possibility to modify 

--- Document Chunk 16880 ---
the Radio Network ID. 

--- Document Chunk 16881 ---
5.4.6 Entry to Mode Considered as a Mission 

--- Document Chunk 16882 ---
5.4.6.1 A mission is considered as started as soon as the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 16883 ---
enters FS, LS, SR, OS, NL, UN, or SN mode. 

--- Document Chunk 16884 ---
5.4.6.2 Entry in all other modes, from SB mode, is not considered as a mission. 

--- Document Chunk 16885 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16886 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16887 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16888 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 16889 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 16890 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 16891 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 16892 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 16893 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 16894 ---
Page 22/100 

--- Document Chunk 16895 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16896 ---
5.5 Procedure End of Mission 

--- Document Chunk 16897 ---
5.5.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 16898 ---
5.5.1.1 End of mission refers to the situation where the trackside stops to authorise the 

--- Document Chunk 16899 ---
movement of a unit. End of mission is initiated by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 16900 ---
equipment when entering specific modes (see below). 

--- Document Chunk 16901 ---
5.5.2 Entry to Mode Considered as an End of Mission: 

--- Document Chunk 16902 ---
5.5.2.1 Stand-By mode 

--- Document Chunk 16903 ---
5.5.2.1.1 From FS, LS, OS, UN, NL,  SR, PT, RV or SN mode, the entry of the ERTMS/ ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 16904 ---
on-board equipment into the Stand-by mode is considered as an End of Mission 

--- Document Chunk 16905 ---
5.5.2.1.2 Note: While in SN mode (level  NTC), some other conditions to end the mission may 

--- Document Chunk 16906 ---
depend on the National System. 

--- Document Chunk 16907 ---
5.5.2.1.3 The entry of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment into the S tand-by mode, from PT 

--- Document Chunk 16908 ---
mode, is only considered as an End of Mission if there was an ongoing mission. 

--- Document Chunk 16909 ---
5.5.2.2 Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 16910 ---
5.5.2.3 Shunting mode 

--- Document Chunk 16911 ---
5.5.2.3.1 The entry of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment into the Shunting mode, from FS, 

--- Document Chunk 16912 ---
LS, OS, SR, SN or UN mode, is considered as an End of Mission. 

--- Document Chunk 16913 ---
5.5.2.3.2 The entry of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment into the Shunting mode, from PT 

--- Document Chunk 16914 ---
mode, is only considered as an End of Mission if there was an ongoing mission. 

--- Document Chunk 16915 ---
5.5.2.3.3 Note: While in SN mode (level  NTC), some other conditions to end the mission ma y 

--- Document Chunk 16916 ---
depend on the National System. 

--- Document Chunk 16917 ---
5.5.3 End of Mission Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 16918 ---
5.5.3.1 The procedure comprises the following steps 

--- Document Chunk 16919 ---
5.5.3.1.1 Step 1 - MA, Track Description Data and Train Data may be deleted (mode 

--- Document Chunk 16920 ---
dependent, see Chapter 4, section "What happens to accepted and stored information 

--- Document Chunk 16921 ---
when Entering a Mode"). 

--- Document Chunk 16922 ---
End of Procedure, if there is no existing communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 16923 ---
5.5.3.1.2 If a communication session with an RIU exists: 

--- Document Chunk 16924 ---
Step 2 - The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 16925 ---
session 

--- Document Chunk 16926 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16927 ---

--- Document Chunk 16936 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16937 ---
End of procedure 

--- Document Chunk 16938 ---
5.5.3.1.3 If a communication session with an RBC exists: 

--- Document Chunk 16939 ---
Step 2 - The end of mission shall be reported to the RBC by means of the message 

--- Document Chunk 16940 ---
“End of Mission”. 

--- Document Chunk 16941 ---
Step 3 -  The RBC shall request to terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 16942 ---
Step 4 - The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 16943 ---
session 

--- Document Chunk 16944 ---
End of procedure 

--- Document Chunk 16945 ---
5.5.3.1.3.1 Note: For the termination of the communication session refer to chapter 3, 

--- Document Chunk 16946 ---
Management of Radio Communication. 

--- Document Chunk 16947 ---
5.5.3.1.3.2 Note: The “End of Mission” message contains a position report. 

--- Document Chunk 16948 ---
5.5.3.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 16949 ---
5.5.4 Degraded Situation 

--- Document Chunk 16950 ---
5.5.4.1.1 Level 2,3 : In case a communication session is established and no request to terminate 

--- Document Chunk 16951 ---
the communication session is received from the RBC  within a fixed waiting time (see 

--- Document Chunk 16952 ---
appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) after sending the “End of Miss ion” 

--- Document Chunk 16953 ---
message, the message shall be repeated with the fixed waiting tim e after each 

--- Document Chunk 16954 ---
repetition. 

--- Document Chunk 16955 ---
5.5.4.1.1.1 After a defined number of repetitions (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value 

--- Document Chunk 16956 ---
Data), and if no reply is received within the fixed waiting time from the t ime of the last 

--- Document Chunk 16957 ---
sending of “End of Mission” , the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 16958 ---
communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 16959 ---
5.5.4.1.2 Level 2,3 : In case no communication session is open, no communication session shall 

--- Document Chunk 16960 ---
be established to report the end of mission.

5.6 Shunting Initiated by Driver 

--- Document Chunk 16973 ---
5.6.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 16974 ---
5.6.1.1 The procedure describes the selection of shunting by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 16975 ---
5.6.1.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 16976 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16977 ---
5.6.2 Table of requirements for “Shunting Initiated by Driver” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 16978 ---
5.6.2.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of  the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 16979 ---
a flowchart in section 5.6.3. 

--- Document Chunk 16980 ---
5.6.2.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 16981 ---
ID # Requirements  

--- Document Chunk 16982 ---
E015 The train is at standstill and the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in FS, 

--- Document Chunk 16983 ---
LS, OS, SR, SN, UN or PT mode or is in SB mode with necessary 

--- Document Chunk 16984 ---
preconditions fulfilled (Driver ID known, Level known, ... see procedure "Start of 

--- Document Chunk 16985 ---
mission"). 

--- Document Chunk 16986 ---
When the driver selects Shunting (E015) the process shall go to D020. 

--- Document Chunk 16987 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16988 ---
D020 If the current ETCS Level of operation is 0 or 1, the process shall go to A050. 

--- Document Chunk 16989 ---
If the current ETCS Level of operation is 2 or 3, the process shall go to A045. 

--- Document Chunk 16990 ---
If the current ETCS Level of operation is NTC, the process shall go to D030 

--- Document Chunk 16991 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16992 ---
D030 If there is an ongoing National Trip procedure reported by the STM, the process 

--- Document Chunk 16993 ---
shall go to A030 

--- Document Chunk 16994 ---
Otherwise the process shall go to A050 

--- Document Chunk 16995 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16996 ---
A030 The process shall go to the “Train trip" procedure  

--- Document Chunk 16997 ---
A045 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall send the “Request for Shunting” 

--- Document Chunk 16998 ---
message to the RBC together with a position report (with special value “position 

--- Document Chunk 16999 ---
unknown” if the position is not known) 

--- Document Chunk 17000 ---
The process shall go to S050. 

--- Document Chunk 17001 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17002 ---
S050 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awaits the reply to the SH request. 

--- Document Chunk 17003 ---
If SH authorised is received from the RBC (optionally with a list of balise groups 

--- Document Chunk 17004 ---
for SH area, which the train can pass when the ERTMS/ETCS onboard 

--- Document Chunk 17005 ---
equipment is in shunting mode) (E090), the process shall go to A050. 

--- Document Chunk 17006 ---
If “SH refused” is received from the RBC (E215), the process shall go to A220. 

--- Document Chunk 17007 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17008 ---

--- Document Chunk 17035 ---
communication session.

--- Document Chunk 17037 ---
the process shall go to A115. 

--- Document Chunk 17038 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17039 ---

--- Document Chunk 17040 ---
session. 

--- Document Chunk 17041 ---
The process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 17042 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17043 ---
A220 An indication shall be given to the driver that SH was refused by the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 17044 ---
The process shall END.

--- Document Chunk 17151 ---
5.7 Entry in Shunting with Order from Trackside 

--- Document Chunk 17152 ---
5.7.1 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 17153 ---
5.7.1.1 This procedure is used to allow the entry of a train into a shunting area.  

--- Document Chunk 17154 ---
5.7.1.2 Note: The shunting area, possibly including a “safety envelope”, can be already 

--- Document Chunk 17155 ---
occupied by shunting units, not controlled by the trackside. It is therefore possible that 

--- Document Chunk 17156 ---
the train shall enter into the shunting area in OS mode. The switch to OS is performed 

--- Document Chunk 17157 ---
according to the relevant procedure.   

--- Document Chunk 17158 ---
5.7.1.3 The order to switch to SH mode shall be given by means of a mode p rofile, optionally 

--- Document Chunk 17159 ---
with a list of balises  groups, which the train can pass when the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 17160 ---
board equipment is in shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17161 ---
5.7.1.4 The switch to shunting, if the transition to shunting was ordered by trackside, requires 

--- Document Chunk 17162 ---
a driver acknowledgement, according to the specifications below. 

--- Document Chunk 17163 ---
5.7.1.5 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has switched to Shunting mode, End of 

--- Document Chunk 17164 ---
Mission, according to chapter 5.5.2.3, is performed. 

--- Document Chunk 17165 ---
5.7.2 Shunting is requested for the current location (from modes different from 

--- Document Chunk 17166 ---
Stand By and Post Trip) 

--- Document Chunk 17167 ---
5.7.2.1 In a level 1 area, or at the border from a level 0 to a level 1 area, the beginning of the 

--- Document Chunk 17168 ---
shunting area can be the location where a balise group is installed. In level 2/3 it is 

--- Document Chunk 17169 ---
possible to send an ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment the order to switch to shunting 

--- Document Chunk 17170 ---
at the current location. 

--- Document Chunk 17171 ---
5.7.2.2 Shunting is requested for the current location means that, according to the mode 

--- Document Chunk 17172 ---
profile received the max safe front end of the train is at or in advance of the location for 

--- Document Chunk 17173 ---
which switching to SH mode is requested. 

--- Document Chunk 17174 ---
5.7.2.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch immediately to SH mode and a 

--- Document Chunk 17175 ---
request for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 17176 ---
transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17177 ---
5.7.2.4 If the driver does not acknowledge within t he driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 17178 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the change to SH mode, the service brake command shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17179 ---
triggered. The command shall be released as soon as the driver acknowledges (unless 

--- Document Chunk 17180 ---
the command was triggered also for other reasons). 

--- Document Chunk 17181 ---
5.7.3 Shunting is requested for a further location 

--- Document Chunk 17182 ---
5.7.3.1 An order to switch to SH at a further location can be sent 

--- Document Chunk 17183 ---
a) in a level 1 area by a balise group, 

--- Document Chunk 17184 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17185 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17186 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17187 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17188 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17189 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 17190 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17191 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17192 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17193 ---
Page 29/100 

--- Document Chunk 17194 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17195 ---
b) in a level 2 or 3 area by the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 17196 ---
5.7.3.2 A request for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver, when the following two 

--- Document Chunk 17197 ---
conditions are fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 17198 ---
a) the distance between the estimated front end of the train and the beginning of 

--- Document Chunk 17199 ---
shunting area is shorter than a value, contained in the mode profile 

--- Document Chunk 17200 ---
b) the speed is lower than the Shunting mode speed limit (National Value, or v alue 

--- Document Chunk 17201 ---
given in the mode profile) 

--- Document Chunk 17202 ---
5.7.3.3 Once the request for acknowledgement is displayed, it shall not be taken back, even if 

--- Document Chunk 17203 ---
the above conditions are no more fulfilled (e.g., the train accelerates). 

--- Document Chunk 17204 ---
5.7.3.4 Until the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment has switched to SH mode , the beginning 

--- Document Chunk 17205 ---
of the shunting area shall be considered as the EOA (instead of the EOA/LOA derived 

--- Document Chunk 17206 ---
from the MA) and the SvL (with no release speed) shall be determined according to the 

--- Document Chunk 17207 ---
mode profile either: 

--- Document Chunk 17208 ---
a) as the SvL derived from the MA. In case the MA de fines an LOA, the SvL shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17209 ---
derived as if no LOA had been given. 

--- Document Chunk 17210 ---
OR 

--- Document Chunk 17211 ---
b) as the beginning of the shunting area. 

--- Document Chunk 17212 ---
5.7.3.5 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 17213 ---
immediately switch to SH mode (refer to chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17214 ---
5.7.3.6 If the max safe front end of the train reaches the beginning of the shunting area 

--- Document Chunk 17215 ---
according the mode profile and the driver has not yet acknowledged, the 

--- Document Chunk 17216 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch immediately to SH mode and a 

--- Document Chunk 17217 ---
request for acknowledgement  shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 17218 ---
transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17219 ---
5.7.3.7 If, in this case, the driver does not acknowledge within the driver acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 17220 ---
time (refer to Appendix A .3.1) after the change to SH mode, the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 17221 ---
command shall be triggered. The command shall be released as soon as the driver 

--- Document Chunk 17222 ---
acknowledges (unless the command was triggered also for other reasons). 

--- Document Chunk 17223 ---
5.7.4 Shunting from Stand By or Post Trip mode 

--- Document Chunk 17224 ---
5.7.4.1 When performing a SoM or a Train Trip procedure and when the current l evel is 2 or 3, 

--- Document Chunk 17225 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment can receive a mode profile giving an Shunting 

--- Document Chunk 17226 ---
area which the train has already entered with its max safe front end. In this case, the 

--- Document Chunk 17227 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall first require an acknowledgement fro m the 

--- Document Chunk 17228 ---
driver. 

--- Document Chunk 17229 ---
5.7.4.2 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perfo rm 

--- Document Chunk 17230 ---
transition to Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17231 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17232 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17233 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17234 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17235 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17236 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 17237 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17238 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17239 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17240 ---
Page 30/100 

--- Document Chunk 17241 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17242 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17243 ---

--- Document Chunk 17300 ---
5.8 Procedure Override 

--- Document Chunk 17301 ---
5.8.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 17302 ---
5.8.1.1 In specific degraded situations (for example in the case of a failed signal, failed track 

--- Document Chunk 17303 ---
circuit, failed point…), railways allow a train to pass its End of Movement Authority. 

--- Document Chunk 17304 ---
5.8.1.2 For ERTMS/ETCS, passing an End of Movement Authority can be required in 

--- Document Chunk 17305 ---
degraded situations, e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 17306 ---
 In level 2/3, if a train is stopped without MA in a location where radio is unavailable 

--- Document Chunk 17307 ---
(e.g. after having received an emergency message, or after a train trip). 

--- Document Chunk 17308 ---
 In level 2/3, if a train is stopped at the  border between two adjacent RBCs (e.g. the 

--- Document Chunk 17309 ---
interface between RBCs is unavailable). 

--- Document Chunk 17310 ---
 In level 2/3, if a train is stopped after having passed the border between two 

--- Document Chunk 17311 ---
adjacent RBCs (e.g. the connection to the Accepting RBC cannot be established). 

--- Document Chunk 17312 ---
 In level 2/3,  if the RBC is unable to give a permission to run (e.g. lost connection 

--- Document Chunk 17313 ---
with the interlocking) 

--- Document Chunk 17314 ---
 In level 1, if a signal cannot show a proceed aspect (e.g., signal failure, route 

--- Document Chunk 17315 ---
cannot be set) 

--- Document Chunk 17316 ---
 In level 1, if a train is stopped without MA (e.g. after the MA has been shortened 

--- Document Chunk 17317 ---
due to a time-out). 

--- Document Chunk 17318 ---
5.8.1.3 In level 0 /NTC areas, passing a signal at danger is only a national procedure. The 

--- Document Chunk 17319 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is not involved in this procedure, since it does not 

--- Document Chunk 17320 ---
supervise the train movements. 

--- Document Chunk 17321 ---
5.8.1.4 In ERTMS equipped ar eas (level 1, 2 or 3), locations where the train shall stop are 

--- Document Chunk 17322 ---
supervised by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment. Receiving an order from the 

--- Document Chunk 17323 ---
signalman to pass the End of Movement Authority, the driver must then be able to 

--- Document Chunk 17324 ---
inhibit this supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 17325 ---
5.8.1.4.1 Note: The driver must not use the “Override” procedure unless authorised by trackside 

--- Document Chunk 17326 ---
personnel. This authorisation is covered by operational procedures. 

--- Document Chunk 17327 ---
5.8.1.5 If a signal at danger  must be passed between announcement and execution of the 

--- Document Chunk 17328 ---
level transition from an unfitt ed area (level 0) or from an area fitted with a National 

--- Document Chunk 17329 ---
System (level NTC) to an ERTMS equipped area (level 1, 2, 3), the signalman gives 

--- Document Chunk 17330 ---
the order to the driver to select “override”. 

--- Document Chunk 17331 ---
5.8.1.6 Note: By using this procedure the driver is fully responsible for the t rain driving. 

--- Document Chunk 17332 ---
Therefore Staff Responsible mode is entered when the driver selects “override”. 

--- Document Chunk 17333 ---
5.8.1.7 In addition the procedure allows to avoid a train trip when passing a balise group:  

--- Document Chunk 17334 ---
a) transmitting "stop if in SR mode" 

--- Document Chunk 17335 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17336 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17337 ---
