--- Document Chunk 17345 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17346 ---
b) not contained in the list of expected balises in SR mode 

--- Document Chunk 17347 ---
c) transmitting "stop if in SH mode" 

--- Document Chunk 17348 ---
d) not contained in the list of expected balises in SH mode" 

--- Document Chunk 17349 ---
e) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 17350 ---
5.8.1.8 Further, the Override procedure allows a train in SR mode reaching the end of the SR 

--- Document Chunk 17351 ---
distance to proceed (see also 4.4.11.1.4) 

--- Document Chunk 17352 ---
5.8.2 Selection of “Override” 

--- Document Chunk 17353 ---
5.8.2.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall allow the driver to select “Override” only 

--- Document Chunk 17354 ---
when: 

--- Document Chunk 17355 ---
a) The train speed is under or equal to the speed limit for triggering the “override” 

--- Document Chunk 17356 ---
function (national value) AND 

--- Document Chunk 17357 ---
b) The current mode is Full Superv ision, Limited Supervision, On Sight, Staff 

--- Document Chunk 17358 ---
Responsible, Shunting, Unfitted, Post Trip, Stand By (in level 2/3 only)  or S N 

--- Document Chunk 17359 ---
(National System) AND 

--- Document Chunk 17360 ---
c) Validated Train Data and Train running number are  available (except when already 

--- Document Chunk 17361 ---
in Shunting mode). 

--- Document Chunk 17362 ---
5.8.2.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17363 ---
5.8.2.3 The “Override” procedure shall be triggered when selected by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 17364 ---
5.8.3 Once the “Override” procedure has been triggered 

--- Document Chunk 17365 ---
5.8.3.1 The mode shall change as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 17366 ---
a) If the current mode is Full Supervision, Limited Supervision, On Sight, Stand -By or 

--- Document Chunk 17367 ---
Post Trip, the mode shall immediately switch to the Staff Responsible (SR) mode (if 

--- Document Chunk 17368 ---
the mode is already SR it remains unchanged) 

--- Document Chunk 17369 ---
b) If the current mode is Shunting the mode shall remain unchanged 

--- Document Chunk 17370 ---
c) If the current mode is Unfitted (level 0 area) or S N (level NTC area) the mode shall 

--- Document Chunk 17371 ---
only change to Staff Responsible when the level changes to 1,2 or 3 (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 17372 ---
chapter 4, transitions between modes) 

--- Document Chunk 17373 ---
5.8.3.1.1 If the mode, when activating Override, is OS , LS or FS, the former EOA/LOA shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17374 ---
retained. If the mode is SB or PT,  the current position of the train front shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17375 ---
considered as the former EOA/LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 17376 ---
5.8.3.1.2 Note: This former EOA/LOA will be used as a Trip condition if the Override function is 

--- Document Chunk 17377 ---
no longer active. Any further activation of the Override in SR mode has no effect on 

--- Document Chunk 17378 ---
the former EOA/LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 17379 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17380 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17381 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17382 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17383 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17384 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 17385 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17386 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17387 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17388 ---
Page 33/100 

--- Document Chunk 17389 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17390 ---
5.8.3.1.3 The former EOA/LOA shall be deleted if: 

--- Document Chunk 17391 ---
a) the train reads the information “stop if in SR mode” from a balise group OR 

--- Document Chunk 17392 ---
b) SR mode is left. 

--- Document Chunk 17393 ---
5.8.3.2 Note 1: In level 2, 3, if radio communication is available, the RBC is only informed that 

--- Document Chunk 17394 ---
the Override has been triggered by means of the reported mode change (if there is 

--- Document Chunk 17395 ---
any) 

--- Document Chunk 17396 ---
5.8.3.3 Note 2: In level 2,3, if the ERTMS/ETCS - onboard equipment is able to report the 

--- Document Chunk 17397 ---
mode change to the RBC, the RBC may transmit limits for the distance to run in SR 

--- Document Chunk 17398 ---
mode (overriding the national value), a  list of balises to be passed in SR mode (refer 

--- Document Chunk 17399 ---
to chapter 4, Staff Responsible mode) 

--- Document Chunk 17400 ---
5.8.3.4 Note 3: In level 2,3, the transition to SR mode triggered by selecting Override revokes 

--- Document Chunk 17401 ---
all emergency stop orders previously received. 

--- Document Chunk 17402 ---
5.8.3.5 In SR mode the  driver may modify the value of the SR mode speed limit and of the 

--- Document Chunk 17403 ---
distance to run in SR mode (refer to chapter 4, Staff Responsible mode) 

--- Document Chunk 17404 ---
5.8.3.6  The train trip shall be inhibited (suppression of the transition to the Trip mode), and 

--- Document Chunk 17405 ---
only in level 0, 1, 2, 3, the MRSP shall include the Override function related Speed 

--- Document Chunk 17406 ---
Restriction (see 3.11.10) as long as the Override function is active. 

--- Document Chunk 17407 ---
5.8.3.7 The status “override active” shall be indicated to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 17408 ---
5.8.3.7.1 Exception 1: In case the Override function has been activated by a n STM (see 

--- Document Chunk 17409 ---
SUBSET-035), the status “override active” shall not be indicated to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 17410 ---
5.8.3.7.2 Exception 2: In case the Override function has been activated by selection of 

--- Document Chunk 17411 ---
“Override” while being in level 0, 1, 2 or 3, the status “override active” shall stop t o be 

--- Document Chunk 17412 ---
indicated to the driver on executing a transition to level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 17413 ---
5.8.3.8 As long as the Override function is active, new SR distance information received from 

--- Document Chunk 17414 ---
EUROLOOP shall be rejected. 

--- Document Chunk 17415 ---
5.8.3.9 When “Override” is selected and Override is already active, the supervision of the time 

--- Document Chunk 17416 ---
and distance (see 5.8.4.1 a) and b)) for train trip suppression shall be re-started. 

--- Document Chunk 17417 ---
5.8.4 End of Override procedure 

--- Document Chunk 17418 ---
5.8.4.1 The Override procedure  shall end when at least one of the following conditions is 

--- Document Chunk 17419 ---
fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 17420 ---
a) The "max. time for train trip suppres sion when Override function is triggered" 

--- Document Chunk 17421 ---
(national value) elapses after Override has been selected, OR 

--- Document Chunk 17422 ---
b) The train has run more than the "distance for train trip suppression when Override 

--- Document Chunk 17423 ---
function is triggered" (national value) after Override has been selected, OR 

--- Document Chunk 17424 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17425 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17426 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17427 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17428 ---

--- Document Chunk 17434 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17435 ---
c) The former EOA/LOA has been passed with the min safe  antenna position 

--- Document Chunk 17436 ---
(calculated by subtracting distance between active EUROBALISE antenna and the 

--- Document Chunk 17437 ---
front end of the train from the min safe front end position), OR  

--- Document Chunk 17438 ---
d) The train passes a balise group gi ving “stop if in SR mode” or “stop if in SH mode” 

--- Document Chunk 17439 ---
information, OR 

--- Document Chunk 17440 ---
e) The train passes a balise group giving proceed information (i.e., MA with no 

--- Document Chunk 17441 ---
signalling related speed restriction of value zero) 

--- Document Chunk 17442 ---
f) In level 2,3, an MA is received from the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 17443 ---
g) The train passes a balise group not in the list of expected balises in SR mode or the 

--- Document Chunk 17444 ---
list of expected balises in SH mode 

--- Document Chunk 17445 ---
h) The train overpasses the SR distance supervised before overriding with its 

--- Document Chunk 17446 ---
estimated front end 

--- Document Chunk 17447 ---
i) The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment switches to TR, LS, OS or SH mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17448 ---
5.8.4.1.1 Note: For modes UN and SN, only end conditions a) and b) are supervised. 

--- Document Chunk 17449 ---
5.8.4.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17450 ---
5.8.4.3 Intentionally deleted.

--- Document Chunk 17463 ---
5.9 Procedure On-Sight 

--- Document Chunk 17464 ---
5.9.1 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 17465 ---
5.9.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall be in On Sight mode before the train 

--- Document Chunk 17466 ---
reaches the beginning of the On Sight area or, at the latest, when the train reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 17467 ---
beginning of the On Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 17468 ---
5.9.1.2 An acknowledgement for running in On Sight mode is requested from the driver. The 

--- Document Chunk 17469 ---
conditions of the acknowledgement are specified below. 

--- Document Chunk 17470 ---
5.9.2 On Sight is requested for current location (from modes different from 

--- Document Chunk 17471 ---
Stand By and Post Trip) 

--- Document Chunk 17472 ---
5.9.2.1 In a level 1 area, the beginning of the On Sight area can be the balise (group) that 

--- Document Chunk 17473 ---
gives the Mode Profile. When the train passes the balise group and receives thi s 

--- Document Chunk 17474 ---
information, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall immediately switch to On 

--- Document Chunk 17475 ---
Sight mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17476 ---
5.9.2.2 In a level 2 or 3 area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment can receive a mode 

--- Document Chunk 17477 ---
profile giving an On Sight area which the train has already entered with its max safe 

--- Document Chunk 17478 ---
front end. In this case, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall immediately switch 

--- Document Chunk 17479 ---
to On Sight mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17480 ---
5.9.2.3 The driver must acknowledge the On Sight mode. A request of acknowledgement shall 

--- Document Chunk 17481 ---
be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 17482 ---
5.9.2.4 If the driver has not acknowledged after the driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 17483 ---
Appendix A.3.1), the service brake command shall be triggered. The brake command 

--- Document Chunk 17484 ---
is released when the driver acknowledges, except if brakes are also applied for 

--- Document Chunk 17485 ---
another reason(s). 

--- Document Chunk 17486 ---
5.9.2.5 Note: Once in On Sight mode, the speed  supervision is such that the train speed 

--- Document Chunk 17487 ---
cannot exceed the OS mode speed limit. If, when entering the On Sight mode, the 

--- Document Chunk 17488 ---
train speed was higher than the OS mode speed limit (because a higher speed was 

--- Document Chunk 17489 ---
allowed in Full Supervision mode, in Limited Supervision mode or in Staff Responsible 

--- Document Chunk 17490 ---
mode) then a service/emergency brake command could be immediately triggered, 

--- Document Chunk 17491 ---
independently of the acknowledgement of the driver, but because of the On Sight 

--- Document Chunk 17492 ---
supervision (see Figure 4). 

--- Document Chunk 17493 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17494 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17495 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17496 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17497 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17498 ---
13/05/2016

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17500 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17501 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17502 ---
Page 36/100 

--- Document Chunk 17503 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17504 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17505 ---
location 

--- Document Chunk 17506 ---
speed 

--- Document Chunk 17507 ---
permitted speed in OS 

--- Document Chunk 17508 ---
mode 

--- Document Chunk 17509 ---
permitted speed 

--- Document Chunk 17510 ---
in previous mode 

--- Document Chunk 17511 ---
 Location of: OS request for  

--- Document Chunk 17512 ---
current location 

--- Document Chunk 17513 ---
Transition to OS mode triggers 

--- Document Chunk 17514 ---
SB/EB command  

--- Document Chunk 17515 ---
(even if driver acknowledges 

--- Document Chunk 17516 ---
within 5s)  

--- Document Chunk 17517 ---
train speed 

--- Document Chunk 17518 ---
Brake command revoked 

--- Document Chunk 17519 ---
(conditions see SRS chapter 3, 

--- Document Chunk 17520 ---
Dynamic Speed Monitoring) 

--- Document Chunk 17521 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17522 ---
Figure 4: Train enters OS area with too high speed 

--- Document Chunk 17523 ---
5.9.2.6 Note: This sharp brake reaction can be avoided in Full Supervision or Limited 

--- Document Chunk 17524 ---
Supervision mode by giving with the previous MA an EOA (or a LOA = OS mode speed 

--- Document Chunk 17525 ---
limit) at the location of transition to On Sight mode. In Staff Responsible mode, lateral 

--- Document Chunk 17526 ---
signals (if available) can also order the driver to decrease the train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 17527 ---
5.9.2.7 If the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is already in OS mode when receiving the 

--- Document Chunk 17528 ---
OS mode profile, no further acknowledgement shall be requested from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 17529 ---
5.9.3 On Sight is requested for a further location 

--- Document Chunk 17530 ---
5.9.3.1 The beginning of the On Sight area can be a location that the train has not reached 

--- Document Chunk 17531 ---
yet. This occurs when: 

--- Document Chunk 17532 ---
a) In a level 1 area, a balise group gives a Mode Profile with an On Sight area that is 

--- Document Chunk 17533 ---
located at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 17534 ---
b) In a level 2 or 3 area, the RBC gives a Mode Profile with an On Sight area that is 

--- Document Chunk 17535 ---
located at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 17536 ---
5.9.3.2 A request for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver whe n the following 

--- Document Chunk 17537 ---
conditions are fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 17538 ---
a)  The distance between the estimated front end of the train and the beginning of On 

--- Document Chunk 17539 ---
Sight area is shorter than a value, contained in the mode profile.   

--- Document Chunk 17540 ---
b) The speed is lower than the On Sight mode speed limit (national value, or value 

--- Document Chunk 17541 ---
given in the mode profile). 

--- Document Chunk 17542 ---
c) The current mode is not On Sight 

--- Document Chunk 17543 ---
5.9.3.3 The conditions 5.9.3.2 a) and b) define the “rectangle of acknowledgement”. 

--- Document Chunk 17544 ---
5.9.3.4 Once the acknowledgement request is displayed, it shall not be taken back if the train 

--- Document Chunk 17545 ---
leaves the “re ctangle of acknowledgement” (for example: because the train 

--- Document Chunk 17546 ---
accelerates). 

--- Document Chunk 17547 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17548 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17549 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17550 ---

--- Document Chunk 17557 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17558 ---
5.9.3.5 Until the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment has switched to OS mode , the beginning 

--- Document Chunk 17559 ---
of the On Sight area shall be temporarily considered as the E OA (instead of the 

--- Document Chunk 17560 ---
EOA/LOA derived from th e MA)  and the SvL (with no release speed) shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17561 ---
determined according to the mode profile either: 

--- Document Chunk 17562 ---
a) as the SvL derived from the MA. In case the MA defines an LOA, the SvL shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17563 ---
derived as if no LOA had been given. 

--- Document Chunk 17564 ---
OR 

--- Document Chunk 17565 ---
b) as the beginning of the On Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 17566 ---
5.9.3.6 When the driver acknowledges the On Sight mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 17567 ---
equipment shall immediately switch to the On Sight mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17568 ---

5.9.3.7 If the max safe front end of the train reaches the beginning of the On Sight area 

--- Document Chunk 17589 ---
according to the mode profile and the driver has not yet acknowledged, the 

--- Document Chunk 17590 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch immediately to OS mode and a 

--- Document Chunk 17591 ---
request for acknowledgeme nt shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 17592 ---
transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17593 ---
5.9.3.8 If, in this case, the driver does not acknowledge within the driver acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 17594 ---
time (refer to Appendix A .3.1) after the change to OS mode, the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 17595 ---
command shall be triggered. The command shall be released as soon as the driver 

--- Document Chunk 17596 ---
acknowledges (unless the command was triggered also for other reasons). 

--- Document Chunk 17597 ---

--- Document Chunk 17608 ---
5.9.4 On Sight from Unfitted or SN mode 

--- Document Chunk 17609 ---
5.9.4.1 The mode profile with regards to an OS area is only evaluated in levels 1,2 ,3, although 

--- Document Chunk 17610 ---
the mode profile may have been received in level 0 (Unfitted mode) or NTC (SN 

--- Document Chunk 17611 ---
mode). A transition to On Sight mode can therefore earliest occur at a transition of 

--- Document Chunk 17612 ---
level: from level 0 or NTC to level 1 or 2 or 3. 

--- Document Chunk 17613 ---
5.9.4.2 Requirements about the acknowledgement in section 5.9.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 17614 ---
5.9.5 On Sight from Stand By or Post Trip mode 

--- Document Chunk 17615 ---
5.9.5.1 When performing a SoM or a Train Trip procedure and when the current level is 2 or 3, 

--- Document Chunk 17616 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment can receive a mode profile giving an On Sight 

--- Document Chunk 17617 ---
area which the train has already entered with its max safe front end. In this case, the 

--- Document Chunk 17618 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall first require an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 17619 ---
driver. 

--- Document Chunk 17620 ---
5.9.5.2 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform 

--- Document Chunk 17621 ---
the transition to On Sight mode.” 

--- Document Chunk 17622 ---
5.9.6 Exit of On Sight mode 

--- Document Chunk 17623 ---
5.9.6.1 General rule 

--- Document Chunk 17624 ---
5.9.6.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall exit the On Sight mode when the min 

--- Document Chunk 17625 ---
safe front end of the train passes the end of the On Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 17626 ---
5.9.6.2 First case: The On Sight area ends at the EOA/LOA of the current MA 

--- Document Chunk 17627 ---
5.9.6.2.1 This occurs when the end of the On Sight area that is given by the Mode Profile has 

--- Document Chunk 17628 ---
the same location as the EOA/LOA of the related MA. 

--- Document Chunk 17629 ---
5.9.6.2.2 In this case, the train must receive a new Movement Authority to be able to exit the On 

--- Document Chunk 17630 ---
Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 17631 ---
5.9.6.2.3 Note: In an O n Sight area there is no guarantee for the RBC that the track in front of 

--- Document Chunk 17632 ---
the supervised train is free. Therefore, if the next block section is free, the RBC has 

--- Document Chunk 17633 ---
nevertheless to ensure that there is no train/vehicle between the train and the end of 

--- Document Chunk 17634 ---
the On Sight area. This information  

--- Document Chunk 17635 ---
 can be given to the RBC by the signalman or any other trackside means  (outside 

--- Document Chunk 17636 ---
scope of  ERTMS/ETCS), or 

--- Document Chunk 17637 ---
 can be inquired by the RBC by means of the following mechanism: the RBC sends 

--- Document Chunk 17638 ---
a “track ahead free” request which the ERTM S/ ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 17639 ---
displays to the driver. If the driver confirms that the track is free up to the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 17640 ---
current section, the ERTMS/ ETCS on -board equipment will transmit this 

--- Document Chunk 17641 ---
information to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 17642 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17643 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17644 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17645 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17646 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17647 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 17648 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17649 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17650 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17651 ---
Page 39/100 

--- Document Chunk 17652 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17653 ---
5.9.6.2.4 Note: Receiving the “track ahead free” info rmation, the RBC may be able to transmit 

--- Document Chunk 17654 ---
an MA from the current position of the train, e.g., for Full Supervision (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 17655 ---
chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17656 ---
5.9.6.3 Second case: The On Sight area ends before the EOA/LOA of the current MA 

--- Document Chunk 17657 ---
5.9.6.3.1 In this case, th e current Movement Authority already allows the train to exit the On 

--- Document Chunk 17658 ---
Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 17659 ---
5.9.6.3.2 When exiting the On Sight area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment switches 

--- Document Chunk 17660 ---
either to Full Supervision , to Limited Supervision  or to Shunting mode (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 17661 ---
chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17662 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 17674 ---

--- Document Chunk 17728 ---
5.10 Level Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 17729 ---
5.10.1 General requirements 

--- Document Chunk 17730 ---
5.10.1.1 Every level transition border to an area where operation in level 2, 3 or NTC is 

--- Document Chunk 17731 ---
supported shall be announced to the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment via balise 

--- Document Chunk 17732 ---
group or via the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 17733 ---
5.10.1.2 A level transition announcement to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 17734 ---
consist of an order to execute the level transition at a further location corresponding to 

--- Document Chunk 17735 ---
the border. 

--- Document Chunk 17736 ---
5.10.1.3 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment receives a level transition 

--- Document Chunk 17737 ---
announcement, and if this announcement will result in a change of the on -board level, 

--- Document Chunk 17738 ---
it shall immediately inform the driver about the announced level transition. 

--- Document Chunk 17739 ---
5.10.1.3.1 Note: In a mixed level area the actual level of the on -board equipment may remain 

--- Document Chunk 17740 ---
unchanged even though a level transition boundary is passed. 

--- Document Chunk 17741 ---
5.10.1.4 At the level transition border a balise group shall be placed with an immediate level 

--- Document Chunk 17742 ---
transition order or a conditional level transition order. 

--- Document Chunk 17743 ---
5.10.1.4.1 Note: Balise groups are read in all levels and level transition orders and conditional 

--- Document Chunk 17744 ---
level transition orders from balises are accepted independent of the level of operation. 

--- Document Chunk 17745 ---
Also sleeping units read balise groups. 

--- Document Chunk 17746 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17747 ---
Level  

--- Document Chunk 17748 ---
transition  

--- Document Chunk 17749 ---
location 

--- Document Chunk 17750 ---
Level X area Level Y area 

--- Document Chunk 17751 ---
Announcement by 

--- Document Chunk 17752 ---
balise group 

--- Document Chunk 17753 ---
Announcement by RBC 

--- Document Chunk 17754 ---
possible if communication 

--- Document Chunk 17755 ---
session exists 

--- Document Chunk 17756 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17757 ---
Figure 7: Transition from level X area to level Y area 

--- Document Chunk 17758 ---
5.10.1.5 If the message from the border balise group is not received, the level transition shall 

--- Document Chunk 17759 ---
still be executed when the estimated front end passes the location given in the 

--- Document Chunk 17760 ---
announcement. 

--- Document Chunk 17761 ---
5.10.1.6 The on -board equipment shall manage only one level transition order at a time. 

--- Document Chunk 17762 ---
Therefore a new level transition order shall replace a previously received order, i.e. if a 

--- Document Chunk 17763 ---
new order to switch to a different level or to the same level but at a different  location is 

--- Document Chunk 17764 ---
received, before the action from the first order has been performed, only the last order 

--- Document Chunk 17765 ---
shall be executed. 

--- Document Chunk 17766 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17767 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17768 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17769 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17770 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17771 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 17772 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17773 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17774 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17775 ---
Page 42/100 

--- Document Chunk 17776 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17777 ---
5.10.1.6.1 In Shunting and Passive Shunting modes only one set of Level Transition Information 

--- Document Chunk 17778 ---
shall be stored at a time. Therefore a set of Level  Transition Information received shall 

--- Document Chunk 17779 ---
replace any Level Transition Information already stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 17780 ---
5.10.1.7 As soon as the announcement of the level transition has been received, some data 

--- Document Chunk 17781 ---
(mainly movement authority and track description data) from the transmission media of 

--- Document Chunk 17782 ---
the new level shall be accepted, but shall not be used until the level transition is 

--- Document Chunk 17783 ---
effective. 

--- Document Chunk 17784 ---
5.10.1.7.1 Note: for the exhaustive list of accepted/rejected information, please refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 17785 ---
chapter 4.8. 

--- Document Chunk 17786 ---
5.10.1.7.2 Note: if only track description has been receiv ed from the new media without any 

--- Document Chunk 17787 ---
movement authority, this track description still replaces the one previously received 

--- Document Chunk 17788 ---
from the current media when the transition is performed. 

--- Document Chunk 17789 ---
5.10.1.8 When the onboard has performed the level transition, further data (mainly movement 

--- Document Chunk 17790 ---
authority and track description data) received from the transmission media of the level 

--- Document Chunk 17791 ---
being left shall be rejected.  

--- Document Chunk 17792 ---
5.10.1.8.1 Note: for the exhaustive list of accepted/rejected information, please refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 17793 ---
chapter 4.8. 

--- Document Chunk 17794 ---
5.10.1.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17795 ---
5.10.2 Table of priority of trackside supported levels 

--- Document Chunk 17796 ---
5.10.2.1 Any combination of ERTMS/ETCS levels 0, NTC, 1, 2, and 3 on a given area shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17797 ---
possible. 

--- Document Chunk 17798 ---
5.10.2.2 The level transition announcement and the immediate or conditional level transition 

--- Document Chunk 17799 ---
order at the border shall contain all the sup ported ERTMS/ETCS levels with a table of 

--- Document Chunk 17800 ---
priority. Even if only one level is permitted this is considered as a table of priority. 

--- Document Chunk 17801 ---
5.10.2.2.1 Note: Level 0 is considered in the same way as the other levels. This means that, for 

--- Document Chunk 17802 ---
example, when an area permits ERTMS/ETCS level 0, and is fitted with ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 17803 ---
level 1 and 2, the track-side includes levels 0, 1 and 2 in a table of priority of supported 

--- Document Chunk 17804 ---
levels in all level transition orders and conditional level transition orders applying to that 

--- Document Chunk 17805 ---
area. 

--- Document Chunk 17806 ---
5.10.2.3 The table of priority shall list all the supported levels from the highest priority level to 

--- Document Chunk 17807 ---
the lowest one. 

--- Document Chunk 17808 ---
5.10.2.3.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17809 ---
5.10.2.4 When receiving the information about all ERTMS/ETCS levels that are supported by 

--- Document Chunk 17810 ---
trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall select from the table the level 

--- Document Chunk 17811 ---
with the highest priority, which is available for use by the onboard equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 17812 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17813 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17814 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17815 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17816 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17817 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 17818 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17819 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17820 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17821 ---
Page 43/100 

--- Document Chunk 17822 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17823 ---
5.10.2.4.1 The on-board equipment shall consider an ERTMS/ETCS level as “Available for use” 

--- Document Chunk 17824 ---
as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 17825 ---
a) Level 2 or 3: the level is configured on -board and at least one M obile Terminal is 

--- Document Chunk 17826 ---
available on -board, i.e. the ETCS onboard has detected at least one Mobile 

--- Document Chunk 17827 ---
Terminal in working condition, independently whether it is registered to a network or 

--- Document Chunk 17828 ---
not. 

--- Document Chunk 17829 ---
b) Level NTC: the concerned National System  is available on -board ( if an ST M is 

--- Document Chunk 17830 ---
used, refer to SUBSET-035 for further details). 

--- Document Chunk 17831 ---
c) Level 0 or 1: always. 

--- Document Chunk 17832 ---
5.10.2.4.1.1 Note regarding a) and b): how the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment checks the 

--- Document Chunk 17833 ---
availability of the Mobile Terminals or of the National System (in case no STM is used) 

--- Document Chunk 17834 ---
is an implementation issue. 

--- Document Chunk 17835 ---
5.10.2.4.2 Examples: The table of trackside supported levels gives 2, NTC X, 1, NTC Y. If level 1, 

--- Document Chunk 17836 ---
0 and NTC X are “Available for use”, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board will select NTC X 

--- Document Chunk 17837 ---
level. If level 1 , 0 and NTC Y are “Available for use”, it will select level 1.  If level 2 , 1 

--- Document Chunk 17838 ---
and 0 are “Available for use”, it will select level 2. 

--- Document Chunk 17839 ---
5.10.2.5 When the onboard has selected the level it will switch to, it shall carry out the level 

--- Document Chunk 17840 ---
transition as if it has received a level transition order to this level only i.e. it shall ignore 

--- Document Chunk 17841 ---
the requirements related to transitions to the other levels. 

--- Document Chunk 17842 ---
5.10.2.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall inform the driver about the selected level 

--- Document Chunk 17843 ---
transition only. 

--- Document Chunk 17844 ---
5.10.2.7 If none of the ordered level(s) is available for use by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 17845 ---
equipment, it s hall nevertheless make the transition, to the ordered level with the 

--- Document Chunk 17846 ---
lowest priority. 

--- Document Chunk 17847 ---
5.10.2.7.1 Justification: The On -board equipment will then indicate the trackside level to the 

--- Document Chunk 17848 ---
driver to allow him to select the correct procedures for degraded situations. 

--- Document Chunk 17849 ---
5.10.2.8 The ERTM S/ETCS on -board equipment shall store the table of priority of trackside 

--- Document Chunk 17850 ---
supported ERTMS/ETCS levels. 

--- Document Chunk 17851 ---
5.10.2.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17852 ---
5.10.2.10 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17853 ---
5.10.2.10.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17854 ---
5.10.3 Specific Additional Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 17855 ---
5.10.3.1 Transition from Level 1 to Level 2/3 area 

--- Document Chunk 17856 ---
5.10.3.1.1 An order t o connect to the RBC with a given id and telephone number shall be given 

--- Document Chunk 17857 ---
via balise group in rear of the border location. 

--- Document Chunk 17858 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17859 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17860 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17861 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 17862 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 17863 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 17864 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17865 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 17866 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 17867 ---
Page 44/100 

--- Document Chunk 17868 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17869 ---
5.10.3.1.2 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 17870 ---
about at least the first section of the new area . The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 17871 ---
the train either: 

--- Document Chunk 17872 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 17873 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 17874 ---
5.10.3.1.3 When the ERTMS/ETCS communication session is open, Train Data shall be sen t to 

--- Document Chunk 17875 ---
the RBC (which acknowledges the data) unless the onboard equipment is in SL or NL 

--- Document Chunk 17876 ---
mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17877 ---
5.10.3.1.4 If no Level 2/3 MA and track description has been received when entering the new 

--- Document Chunk 17878 ---
area, the train shall still be supervised according to the level 1 MA previously received. 

--- Document Chunk 17879 ---
5.10.3.1.5 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has switched to the new level, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 17880 ---
report the new on-board level, including a position report. 

--- Document Chunk 17881 ---
5.10.3.1.6 If an order to connect to an RBC has been received and the train will not enter the 

--- Document Chunk 17882 ---
announced RBC area, an o rder to terminate the session shall be sent either from 

--- Document Chunk 17883 ---
balises or from the RBC for any route not leading to the RBC area. This is the case 

--- Document Chunk 17884 ---
both if the train turns back and if the train continues in the same direction, but on 

--- Document Chunk 17885 ---
another route. 

--- Document Chunk 17886 ---
5.10.3.2 Transition from Level 0 (Unfitted) to Level 2/3 area 

--- Document Chunk 17887 ---
5.10.3.2.1 An order to connect to the RBC with a given id and telephone number shall be given 

--- Document Chunk 17888 ---
via balise group in rear of the border location. 

--- Document Chunk 17889 ---
5.10.3.2.2 When the ERTMS/ETCS communication session is open, Train Data shall be sent to 

--- Document Chunk 17890 ---
the RBC (which acknowledges the data) unless the onboard equipment is in SL or NL 

--- Document Chunk 17891 ---
mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17892 ---
5.10.3.2.3 A level 2/3 MA and track description information shall be received from the RBC before 

--- Document Chunk 17893 ---
the level transition border. If not, the train will be tripped at passage of the border,  i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 17894 ---
after switching to level 2 or 3, movement is not allowed without a movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 17895 ---
(refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17896 ---
5.10.3.2.4 The driver is responsible for entering the level 2/3 area at a speed not exceeding the 

--- Document Chunk 17897 ---
speed limits of the unequipped line.  

--- Document Chunk 17898 ---
5.10.3.2.5 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has switched to the new level, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 17899 ---
report the new on-board level, including a position report. 

--- Document Chunk 17900 ---
5.10.3.2.6 If an order to connect to an RBC has been received and the train will not enter the 

--- Document Chunk 17901 ---
announced RBC area,  an order to terminate the session shall be sent either from 

--- Document Chunk 17902 ---
balises or from the RBC for any route not leading to the RBC area. This is the case 

--- Document Chunk 17903 ---
both if the train turns back and if the train continues in the same direction, but on 

--- Document Chunk 17904 ---
another route. 

--- Document Chunk 17905 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17906 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17907 ---

--- Document Chunk 17916 ---
5.10.3.3 Transition from Level 2/3 to Level 1 area 

--- Document Chunk 17917 ---
5.10.3.3.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 17918 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 17919 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 17920 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 17921 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 17922 ---
5.10.3.3.2 If no Level 1 MA and track description has been received when entering the new area, 

--- Document Chunk 17923 ---
the train shall still be supervised according to the level 2/3 MA previously received from 

--- Document Chunk 17924 ---
the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 17925 ---
5.10.3.3.3 When the train has passed the level transition border with its min safe rear end, i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 17926 ---
when the whole train has left the level 2/3 area, the onboard equipment of the leading 

--- Document Chunk 17927 ---
engine shall send a position report to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 17928 ---
5.10.3.3.4 After receiving this exit position report, the RBC can order the train to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 17929 ---
session (leading and non-leading engines). 

--- Document Chunk 17930 ---
5.10.3.3.5 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has reported that the train has passed 

--- Document Chunk 17931 ---
with its min safe rear end the level transition border and  no order to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 17932 ---
session is received within a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) from the time the 

--- Document Chunk 17933 ---
position report was sent, it shall repeatedly send a position report with the fixed waiting 

--- Document Chunk 17934 ---
time after each repetition, until the order to ter minate the session is received, or the 

--- Document Chunk 17935 ---
defined number of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1) has been reached. If no reply is 

--- Document Chunk 17936 ---
received within the fixed waiting time  after the last repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 17937 ---
board equipment shall terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 17938 ---
5.10.3.4 Transition from Level 0 (Unfitted) to Level 1 area 

--- Document Chunk 17939 ---
5.10.3.4.1 A level 1 MA and track description information shall be received before or at the level 

--- Document Chunk 17940 ---
transition border. If not, when the level transition is performed, the train will be tripped, 

--- Document Chunk 17941 ---
i.e. after sw itching to level 1, movement is not allowed without a movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 17942 ---
(refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17943 ---
5.10.3.4.2 The driver is responsible for entering the level 1 area at a speed not exceeding the 

--- Document Chunk 17944 ---
speed limits of the unequipped line.  

--- Document Chunk 17945 ---
5.10.3.5 Transition from Level 1 to Level 0 (Unfitted) area 

--- Document Chunk 17946 ---
5.10.3.5.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 17947 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 17948 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 17949 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 17950 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 17951 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

5.10.3.6 Transition from Level 2/3 to Level 0 (Unfitted) area 

--- Document Chunk 17965 ---
5.10.3.6.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 17966 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 17967 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 17968 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 17969 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 17970 ---
5.10.3.6.2 When the train has passed the level transition border with its min safe rear end, i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 17971 ---
when the whole train has left the level 2/3 area, the onboard  equipment of the leading 

--- Document Chunk 17972 ---
engine shall send a position report to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 17973 ---
5.10.3.6.3 After receiving this exit position report, the RBC can order the train to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 17974 ---
session (leading and non-leading engines).  

--- Document Chunk 17975 ---
5.10.3.6.4 Note: When entering UN mode, all MA and track desc ription data is deleted (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 17976 ---
SRS Chapter 4, What happens to stored data when entering a mode) 

--- Document Chunk 17977 ---
5.10.3.6.5 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has reported that the train has passed 

--- Document Chunk 17978 ---
with its min safe rear end the level transition border and no order to termi nate the 

--- Document Chunk 17979 ---
session is received within a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) from the time the 

--- Document Chunk 17980 ---
position report was sent, it shall repeatedly send a position report with the fixed waiting 

--- Document Chunk 17981 ---
time after each repetition, until the order to terminate the session  is received, or the 

--- Document Chunk 17982 ---
defined number of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1) has been reached. If no reply is 

--- Document Chunk 17983 ---
received within the fixed waiting time  after the last repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 17984 ---
board equipment shall terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 17985 ---
5.10.3.7 Transition from Level NTC to Level 2/3 area 

--- Document Chunk 17986 ---
5.10.3.7.1 An order to connect to the RBC with a given id and telephone number shall be given 

--- Document Chunk 17987 ---
via balise group in rear of the border location. 

--- Document Chunk 17988 ---
5.10.3.7.2 When the ERTMS/ETCS communication session is open, Train Data shall be sent to 

--- Document Chunk 17989 ---
the RBC (which acknowledges the data) unless the onboard equipment is in SL  or NL 

--- Document Chunk 17990 ---
mode. 

--- Document Chunk 17991 ---
5.10.3.7.3 A level 2/3 MA and track description information shall be received from the RBC before 

--- Document Chunk 17992 ---
the level transition border. If not, the train will be tripped at passage of the border, i .e. 

--- Document Chunk 17993 ---
after switching to level 2 or 3, movement is not allowed without a movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 17994 ---
(refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 17995 ---
5.10.3.7.4 The driver is responsible for entering the level 2/3 area at a speed not exceeding the 

--- Document Chunk 17996 ---
speed limits of the level NTC line.  

--- Document Chunk 17997 ---

--- Document Chunk 18007 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18008 ---
5.10.3.7.5 When the level transition location is passed with the estimated front end a position 

--- Document Chunk 18009 ---
report shall be sent to the RBC . In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is 

--- Document Chunk 18010 ---
interfaced to the National System through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for 

--- Document Chunk 18011 ---
the STM state transition order. 

--- Document Chunk 18012 ---
5.10.3.7.6 If an order to connect to an RBC has been received and the train will not enter the 

--- Document Chunk 18013 ---
announced RBC area, an order to disconnect shall be sent either from balises or from 

--- Document Chunk 18014 ---
the RBC for any route not leading to the RBC area. This is the case both if the train 

--- Document Chunk 18015 ---
turns back and if the train continues in the same direction, but on another route. 

--- Document Chunk 18016 ---
5.10.3.8 Transition from Level NTC to Level 1 area 

--- Document Chunk 18017 ---
5.10.3.8.1 A level 1 MA and track description information shall be received before or at the level 

--- Document Chunk 18018 ---
transition border. If not, when the level transition is performed, the train will be tripped, 

--- Document Chunk 18019 ---
i.e. after switching to level 1, movement is not allowed without a movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 18020 ---
(refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 18021 ---
5.10.3.8.2 The driver is responsible for enteri ng the level 1 area at a speed not exceeding the 

--- Document Chunk 18022 ---
speed limits of the Level NTC line.  

--- Document Chunk 18023 ---
5.10.3.8.3 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced to the National System 

--- Document Chunk 18024 ---
through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for the STM state transition orders in 

--- Document Chunk 18025 ---
relation to the level transition announcement and border.  

--- Document Chunk 18026 ---
5.10.3.9 Transition from Level 1 to Level NTC area 

--- Document Chunk 18027 ---
5.10.3.9.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 18028 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 18029 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 18030 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 18031 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 18032 ---
5.10.3.9.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 18033 ---
5.10.3.9.3 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced to the National System 

--- Document Chunk 18034 ---
through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for the STM state transition orders in 

--- Document Chunk 18035 ---
relation to the level transition announcement and border. 

--- Document Chunk 18036 ---
5.10.3.10 Transition from Level 2/3 to Level NTC area 

--- Document Chunk 18037 ---
5.10.3.10.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess i nformation 

--- Document Chunk 18038 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 18039 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 18040 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 18041 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 18042 ---
5.10.3.10.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 18043 ---

--- Document Chunk 18054 ---
5.10.3.10.3 When the train has passed the level transition border with its min safe rear end, i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 18055 ---
when the whole train has left the level 2/3 area, the onboard equipment of the leading 

--- Document Chunk 18056 ---
engine shall send a position report to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18057 ---
5.10.3.10.4 After receiving this exit p osition report, the RBC can order the train to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 18058 ---
session (leading and non-leading engines). 

--- Document Chunk 18059 ---
5.10.3.10.5 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced to the National System 

--- Document Chunk 18060 ---
through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for the STM state transition o rders in 

--- Document Chunk 18061 ---
relation to the level transition announcement and border. 

--- Document Chunk 18062 ---
5.10.3.10.6 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has reported that the train has passed 

--- Document Chunk 18063 ---
with its min safe rear end the level transition border and no order to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 18064 ---
session is received wit hin a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) from the time the 

--- Document Chunk 18065 ---
position report was sent, it shall repeatedly send a position report with the fixed waiting 

--- Document Chunk 18066 ---
time after each repetition, until the order to terminate the session is received, or the 

--- Document Chunk 18067 ---
defined num ber of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1) has been reached. If no reply is 

--- Document Chunk 18068 ---
received within the fixed waiting time  after the last repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 18069 ---
board equipment shall terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 18070 ---
5.10.3.11 Transition from Level NTC (National System X) to Level NTC (National System Y) 

--- Document Chunk 18071 ---
5.10.3.11.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 18072 ---

--- Document Chunk 18073 ---

--- Document Chunk 18074 ---
relation to the level transition announcement and border. 

--- Document Chunk 18075 ---

--- Document Chunk 18076 ---
5.10.3.12 Transition from Level NTC to Level 0 

--- Document Chunk 18077 ---
5.10.3.12.1 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced to the National System 

--- Document Chunk 18078 ---
through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for the STM state transition orders in 

--- Document Chunk 18079 ---
relation to the level transition announcement and border. 

--- Document Chunk 18080 ---
5.10.3.12.2 The driver is responsible for entering the level 0 area at a speed not exceeding the 

--- Document Chunk 18081 ---
maximum speed of the Level NTC line.  

--- Document Chunk 18082 ---

--- Document Chunk 18099 ---
5.10.3.13.3 The driver is responsible for entering  the level NTC area at a speed not exceeding the 

--- Document Chunk 18100 ---
speed limits of the unequipped line. 

--- Document Chunk 18101 ---
5.10.3.14 Conditional level transition order 

--- Document Chunk 18102 ---
5.10.3.14.1 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment accepts a conditional level transition 

--- Document Chunk 18103 ---
order the onboard shall check whether the current level i s contained in the priority list 

--- Document Chunk 18104 ---
of the conditional level transition order. 

--- Document Chunk 18105 ---
5.10.3.14.2 If the current level is contained in the priority list of the conditional level transition order, 

--- Document Chunk 18106 ---
the onboard shall not change the level. 

--- Document Chunk 18107 ---
5.10.3.14.3 If the current level is not contained in t he priority list of the conditional level transition 

--- Document Chunk 18108 ---
order, the onboard shall evaluate the conditional level transition order in the same way 

--- Document Chunk 18109 ---
as an immediate level transition order (see section 5.10.2). 

--- Document Chunk 18110 ---
5.10.3.14.4 In the same way as for a level transition order, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 18111 ---
shall store the table of ERTMS/ETCS levels supported by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 18112 ---
5.10.3.14.5 Note: The conditional level transition order allows to check, whether a train operates in 

--- Document Chunk 18113 ---
a permitted level e.g. following a start of mission after a cold move ment. The level of a 

--- Document Chunk 18114 ---
train driving in a permitted level will not be changed, regardless of the priority of the 

--- Document Chunk 18115 ---
current level operated by the train.  

--- Document Chunk 18116 ---
5.10.3.15 Transition initiated by driver 

--- Document Chunk 18117 ---
5.10.3.15.1 In addition to the level transitions ordered by trackside, it is also possib le, at standstill, 

--- Document Chunk 18118 ---
for the driver to change the ERTMS/ETCS level (refer to section 3.18.4.2). 

--- Document Chunk 18119 ---
5.10.3.15.2 If the driver changes the level to 2 or 3, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 18120 ---
establish a communication session with the RBC: 

--- Document Chunk 18121 ---
a) immediately if at least one Mob ile Terminal is registered to a Radio Network and  a 

--- Document Chunk 18122 ---
valid RBC ID/ phone number is available, OR 

--- Document Chunk 18123 ---
b) once the driver has selected the R adio data (by the same means as for Start of 

--- Document Chunk 18124 ---
Mission), if either no Mobile Terminal is registered to a Radio Network or  no valid 

--- Document Chunk 18125 ---
RBC ID/phone number is available. 

--- Document Chunk 18126 ---
5.10.3.15.2.1 Note regarding b): If the level transition leads to TR mode, the request for RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18127 ---
contact information is only displayed once the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is in 

--- Document Chunk 18128 ---
PT mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18129 ---
5.10.3.15.3 If the driver changes the level from 2 or 3 to  any other, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 18130 ---
equipment shall report the new level to the RBC if a communication session is 

--- Document Chunk 18131 ---
established. When receiving the level change report, the RBC shall order the 

--- Document Chunk 18132 ---
communication session to be terminated. 

--- Document Chunk 18133 ---
5.10.3.15.4 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has reported having changed from 

--- Document Chunk 18134 ---
level 2/3 to any other and no order to terminate the session is received within a fixed 

--- Document Chunk 18135 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 18146 ---
waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) from the ti me the position report was sent , it shall

--- Document Chunk 18152 ---
5.10.4 Acknowledgement of the level transition 

--- Document Chunk 18153 ---
5.10.4.1 If defined so for the level transition (see table below), the driver shall be requested to 

--- Document Chunk 18154 ---
acknowledge the transition 

--- Document Chunk 18155 ---
a) when the max safe front end of the train has passed a trackside defined location in 

--- Document Chunk 18156 ---
rear of the level transition border 

--- Document Chunk 18157 ---
b) upon receipt of the order to switch to the new level immediately 

--- Document Chunk 18158 ---
5.10.4.1.1 Exception: An ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment in NL mode shall not require an 

--- Document Chunk 18159 ---
acknowledgement from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 18160 ---
5.10.4.1.2 Exception to 5.10.4.1.a): in SB mode, the driver shall be requested to acknowledge the 

--- Document Chunk 18161 ---
level transition only when the level changes. 

--- Document Chunk 18162 ---
5.10.4.2 If the driver has not yet acknowledged within the driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 18163 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the level transition, a service brake command shall be initiated. 

--- Document Chunk 18164 ---
5.10.4.3 The service brake command shall then be released when the driver acknowledges the 

--- Document Chunk 18165 ---
level transition. 

--- Document Chunk 18166 ---
5.10.4.4 For the following transitions marked as “YES”, an acknowledgement shall be required: 

--- Document Chunk 18167 ---
  Acknowledgement when entering 

--- Document Chunk 18168 ---
  L 0 L 1 L 2 L 3 L NTC 

--- Document Chunk 18169 ---
Coming from  ... L 0 - No No No Yes 

--- Document Chunk 18170 ---
L 1 Yes - No No Yes 

--- Document Chunk 18171 ---
L 2 Yes No - No Yes 

--- Document Chunk 18172 ---
L 3 Yes No No - Yes 

--- Document Chunk 18173 ---
L NTC Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes

--- Document Chunk 18185 ---
5.11 Procedure Train Trip 

--- Document Chunk 18186 ---
5.11.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 18187 ---
5.11.1.1 A train can be tripped f or various reasons: refer to SRS chapter 4, mode transition 

--- Document Chunk 18188 ---
table. 

--- Document Chunk 18189 ---
5.11.2 Table of requirements for “Train Trip” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 18190 ---
5.11.2.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 18191 ---
a flowchart in section 5.11.3. 

--- Document Chunk 18192 ---
5.11.2.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 18193 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 18194 ---
S010 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in one of the following  

--- Document Chunk 18195 ---
modes: FS, LS, OS, SR, SB, SH, SN or UN 

--- Document Chunk 18196 ---
When an event occurs, which leads to train trip reaction (E015 – refer 

--- Document Chunk 18197 ---
to chapter 4, transitions between modes), the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 18198 ---
A025. 

--- Document Chunk 18199 ---
A025 The mode shall change to TR. 

--- Document Chunk 18200 ---
The process shall go to D020. 

--- Document Chunk 18201 ---
D020 If the level is 1, the process shall go to A035. 

--- Document Chunk 18202 ---
If the level is 2/3, the process shall go to A030. 

--- Document Chunk 18203 ---
If the level is 0/NTC, the process shall go to S050. 

--- Document Chunk 18204 ---
A030 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall report the mode 

--- Document Chunk 18205 ---
change to the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18206 ---
The process shall go to A035. 

--- Document Chunk 18207 ---
A035 All current MA and track description data (if any), except track 

--- Document Chunk 18208 ---
conditions, shall be deleted and new ones shall not be accepted 

--- Document Chunk 18209 ---
The process shall go to S050. 

--- Document Chunk 18210 ---
S050 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awaits standstill. While 

--- Document Chunk 18211 ---
braking a border to a level 0 or NTC area may be passed. 

--- Document Chunk 18212 ---
When the train has come to standstill (E055), the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 18213 ---
S060. 

--- Document Chunk 18214 ---
S060 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the "Request 

--- Document Chunk 18215 ---
for driver acknowledgement to Train Trip" to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 18216 ---
When the driver acknowledges the Train Trip (E065), the process 

--- Document Chunk 18217 ---
shall go to D080. 

--- Document Chunk 18218 ---

--- Document Chunk 18229 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 18230 ---
D80 If the level is 1, 2 or 3 the process shall go to A105. 

--- Document Chunk 18231 ---
If the level is 0 or NTC, the process shall go to D085 

--- Document Chunk 18232 ---
A105 The mode shall change to PT and the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 18233 ---
equipment revokes the emergency brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 18234 ---
For the supervision provided by the PT mode refer to SRS chapter 4. 

--- Document Chunk 18235 ---
The process shall go to D110. 

--- Document Chunk 18236 ---
D085 If no valid Train Data is stored on-board, the process shall go to A140 

--- Document Chunk 18237 ---
If valid Train Data is stored on-board, the process shall go to D090 

--- Document Chunk 18238 ---
A140 The mode shall change to SH and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 18239 ---
D090 If the level is 0, the process shall go to A145. 

--- Document Chunk 18240 ---
If the level is NTC, the process shall go to A150. 

--- Document Chunk 18241 ---
A145 The mode shall change to UN and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 18242 ---
A150 The mode shall change to SN and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 18243 ---
D110 If the level is 1, the process shall go to S140. 

--- Document Chunk 18244 ---
If the level is 2 or 3, the process shall go to A115. 

--- Document Chunk 18245 ---
A115 The mode change to PT shall be reported to the RBC which shall 

--- Document Chunk 18246 ---
acknowledge the mode report (Recognition of exit from TR). 

--- Document Chunk 18247 ---
The process shall go to S120. 

--- Document Chunk 18248 ---
S120 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment waits for the RBC to 

--- Document Chunk 18249 ---
acknowledge the transition to PT. 

--- Document Chunk 18250 ---
When the acknowledgement is received from the RBC (E125), the 

--- Document Chunk 18251 ---
process shall go to D130. 

--- Document Chunk 18252 ---
Note: See 5.11.4 for degraded situation (no response received). 

--- Document Chunk 18253 ---
D130 If there is at least one pending emergency stop, the process shall go 

--- Document Chunk 18254 ---
to S130. 

--- Document Chunk 18255 ---
If there are no pending emergency stops the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 18256 ---
S140. 

--- Document Chunk 18257 ---
S130 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment waits for the RBC to revoke 

--- Document Chunk 18258 ---
ALL pending emergency stops. 

--- Document Chunk 18259 ---
When all emergency stops are revoked (E135) the process shall go 

--- Document Chunk 18260 ---
to S140. 

--- Document Chunk 18261 ---

--- Document Chunk 18272 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 18273 ---
S140 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to 

--- Document Chunk 18274 ---
the driver to select "start" (only if train data has been previously 

--- Document Chunk 18275 ---
entered), or to select SH 

--- Document Chunk 18276 ---
a) If the driver selects "start" and the level is 1 ( E150), the 

--- Document Chunk 18277 ---
process shall go to S160 

--- Document Chunk 18278 ---
b) If the driver selects "start" and the level is 2 or 3 ( E155), the 

--- Document Chunk 18279 ---
process shall go to S150 

--- Document Chunk 18280 ---
c) If the driver selects SH (E145), the process shall continue in 

--- Document Chunk 18281 ---
the same ways as the procedure “Shunting initiated by the 

--- Document Chunk 18282 ---
driver”. If the SH request is refused by the RBC ( E165) the 

--- Document Chunk 18283 ---
process shall return to S140. 

--- Document Chunk 18284 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18285 ---
S150 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall send an MA request to 

--- Document Chunk 18286 ---
the RBC and wait. 

--- Document Chunk 18287 ---
a) If an SR authorisation is received from RBC ( E26), the 

--- Document Chunk 18288 ---
process shall go to S160 

--- Document Chunk 18289 ---
b) If an MA allowing OS/LS/SH is received from RBC ( E175), 

--- Document Chunk 18290 ---
the process shall go to S170 

--- Document Chunk 18291 ---
c) If an MA allowing FS is received from RBC ( E170), the 

--- Document Chunk 18292 ---
mode shall change to FS (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 18293 ---
transitions between modes: transition from PT to FS) and 

--- Document Chunk 18294 ---
the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 18295 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18296 ---
S160 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request an 

--- Document Chunk 18297 ---
acknowledgement from the driver for running in SR mode. When the 

--- Document Chunk 18298 ---
driver acknowledges (E180), the mode shall change to SR (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 18299 ---
SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition from PT to SR) 

--- Document Chunk 18300 ---
and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 18301 ---
S170 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request an 

--- Document Chunk 18302 ---
acknowledgement from the driver for running in OS/LS/SH mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18303 ---
When the driver acknowledges (E185), the mode shall change to 

--- Document Chunk 18304 ---
OS/LS/SH (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: 

--- Document Chunk 18305 ---
transition from PT to OS/LS/SH) and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 18306 ---

--- Document Chunk 18455 ---
5.11.4 Degraded Situations 

--- Document Chunk 18456 ---
5.11.4.1 ERTMS/ETCS level 2 or 3: no acknowledge for PT mode is received from the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18457 ---
5.11.4.1.1 In case a communication session is established and no reply is received from the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18458 ---
within a fixed waiting time (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) after 

--- Document Chunk 18459 ---
reporting the mode change,  the report shall be repeated with the fixe d waiting time 

--- Document Chunk 18460 ---
after each repetition. 

--- Document Chunk 18461 ---
5.11.4.1.2 After a defined number of repetitions(see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value 

--- Document Chunk 18462 ---
Data) and if no reply is received within the fixed waiting time from the last sending of 

--- Document Chunk 18463 ---
the mode change report,  the ERTMS/ETCS onboa rd equipment shall terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 18464 ---
communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 18465 ---
5.11.4.2 Nominally, accidental loss of an already open session (that can occur at any step) has 

--- Document Chunk 18466 ---
not been taken into account for the design of the flowchart. However, should such a 

--- Document Chunk 18467 ---
fault occur in any step while  ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in level 2/3 and in 

--- Document Chunk 18468 ---
PT mode, the driver shall have the possibility to select "Override" if the conditions 

--- Document Chunk 18469 ---
defined in 5.8.2.1 are fulfilled and the process shall go to the procedure "Override". 

--- Document Chunk 18470 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 18481 ---
5.12 Change of Train Orientation 

--- Document Chunk 18482 ---
5.12.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 18483 ---
5.12.1.1 The scope of this procedure is the supervision of a train where the driver controls the 

--- Document Chunk 18484 ---
train from the cab in the front of the train with the direction controller in FORWARD 

--- Document Chunk 18485 ---
position. 

--- Document Chunk 18486 ---
5.12.1.2 This implies that when the driver has to change the orienta tion of the train, he has to 

--- Document Chunk 18487 ---
change the driving cab. 

--- Document Chunk 18488 ---
5.12.1.3 The scope of this procedure is NOT shunting movements, during which the driver 

--- Document Chunk 18489 ---
changes the running direction of the train without leaving the cab, by changing the 

--- Document Chunk 18490 ---
position of the direction controller from FORWARD to REVERSE. 

--- Document Chunk 18491 ---
5.12.1.4 The scope of this procedure is NOT the backwards movement that is allowed in Post 

--- Document Chunk 18492 ---
Trip or in Reversing mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18493 ---
5.12.2 The driver uses the same engine (a mission is ongoing) 

--- Document Chunk 18494 ---
5.12.2.1 The situation is the following: The driver closes the desk A and leaves the cab A of the 

--- Document Chunk 18495 ---
leading engine of the train, to go to cab B and open desk B of this same engine. 

--- Document Chunk 18496 ---
5.12.2.2 Desk A and desk B are connected to the same ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 18497 ---
5.12.2.3 When the driver closes the desk A, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 18498 ---
immediately goes to Stand-By mode, which is considered as an end of mission (see 

--- Document Chunk 18499 ---
“End of Mission” procedure). 

--- Document Chunk 18500 ---
5.12.2.4 When the driver opens the desk B, the “Start of Mission” procedure is triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 18501 ---
5.12.2.5 When the driver closes a desk and opens the other one of the same engine, the  

--- Document Chunk 18502 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall be able to calculate the new train position 

--- Document Chunk 18503 ---
data (train front position, train orientation), by use of the previous data. 

--- Document Chunk 18504 ---
5.12.3 The driver leaves the engine to go to another one 

--- Document Chunk 18505 ---
5.12.3.1 The described situation is the following : The tr ain has two engines (engine A and 

--- Document Chunk 18506 ---
engine B). The engine A is the leading engine. The engine B is a slave engine. Each 

--- Document Chunk 18507 ---
engine has its own ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment.  

--- Document Chunk 18508 ---
a) If engine B is remote controlled, its ETCS on -board equipment is in Sleeping mode.  

--- Document Chunk 18509 ---
Note: The mode is entered when on -board equipment detects the presence of the 

--- Document Chunk 18510 ---
"remote control" signal. 

--- Document Chunk 18511 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18512 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18513 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18514 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 18515 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 18516 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 18517 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18518 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 18519 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 18520 ---
Page 58/100 

--- Document Chunk 18521 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18522 ---
b) If the slave engine is not remote controlled (Tandem operation) by the leading 

--- Document Chunk 18523 ---
engine but there is a driver who controls the engine, then the on -board equipment is 

--- Document Chunk 18524 ---
in Non leading mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18525 ---
c) If the engine B is not remote controlled (Tandem Shunting operation) by the leading 

--- Document Chunk 18526 ---
engine and there is no driver who controls the engine, then the on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 18527 ---
is in Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18528 ---
5.12.3.2 Assumption: The train configuration does not change. 

--- Document Chunk 18529 ---
a) When changing the train orientation, the leading engine A will become the slave 

--- Document Chunk 18530 ---
engine, and the slave engine B will become the leading engine. 

--- Document Chunk 18531 ---
b) If before the change of train orientation engine B was in SL, afterwards engine A will 

--- Document Chunk 18532 ---
be in  SL mode; If before the change of train orientation engine B was in NL, 

--- Document Chunk 18533 ---
afterwards engine A will be in NL mode ; If before the change of train orientation 

--- Document Chunk 18534 ---
engine B was in PS, afterwards engine A will be in PS mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18535 ---
5.12.3.3 Case "Engine B was in SL mode" 

--- Document Chunk 18536 ---
5.12.3.3.1 The driver of engine A closes the desk, then the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of 

--- Document Chunk 18537 ---
engine A switches to Stand-By mode. If the train has a mission, this is a end of mission 

--- Document Chunk 18538 ---
(see “End of Mission” procedure) 

--- Document Chunk 18539 ---
5.12.3.3.2 As soon as the remote control signal disappears, the ERTMS/ETCS  on-board 

--- Document Chunk 18540 ---
equipment of engine B switches to Stand-By mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18541 ---
5.12.3.3.3 Level 2,3: The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of engine B opens a communication 

--- Document Chunk 18542 ---
session (if possible) and reports the mode change to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18543 ---
5.12.3.3.4 When the driver opens a desk of engine B he triggers the "Start of Mission" procedure. 

--- Document Chunk 18544 ---
5.12.3.4 Case "Engine B was in NL mode" 

--- Document Chunk 18545 ---
5.12.3.4.1 The driver of engine A selects "Non Leading". The ERTMS/ETCS equipment switches 

--- Document Chunk 18546 ---
to Non Leading mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18547 ---
5.12.3.4.2 Once the non leading input signal is not received any more , the ERTMS/ETCS on-

--- Document Chunk 18548 ---
board equipment  of engine B will switch to Stand -By mode ( refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 18549 ---
transitions between modes and chapter 5, “End of Mission” procedure). 

--- Document Chunk 18550 ---
5.12.3.4.3 Because the desk is open, when the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment enters Stand-

--- Document Chunk 18551 ---
By mode, the “Start of Mission” procedure is triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 18552 ---
5.12.3.5 Case "Engine B was in PS mode" 

--- Document Chunk 18553 ---
5.12.3.5.1 The driver of engine A selects "Continue Shunting on desk closure". The 

--- Document Chunk 18554 ---
ERTMS/ETCS equipment switches to Passive Shunting mode once the driver closes 

--- Document Chunk 18555 ---
the desk of engine A. 

--- Document Chunk 18556 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18557 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18558 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18559 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 18560 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 18561 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 18562 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18563 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 18564 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 18565 ---
Page 59/100 

--- Document Chunk 18566 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18567 ---
5.12.3.5.2 The driver opens a desk in engine B, a nd ERTMS/ETCS equipment switches to 

--- Document Chunk 18568 ---
Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18569 ---
5.12.4 The driver uses the same engine (a Shunting movement is ongoing) 

--- Document Chunk 18570 ---
5.12.4.1 The situation is the following : while the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is in 

--- Document Chunk 18571 ---
Shunting mode, the driver closes the desk A and leaves the cab  A of the Shunting 

--- Document Chunk 18572 ---
engine, to go to cab B and open desk B of this same engine. 

--- Document Chunk 18573 ---
5.12.4.2 Desk A and desk B are connected to the same ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 18574 ---
5.12.4.2.1 Before closing the desk A, the driver enables the function “Continue Shunting on desk 

--- Document Chunk 18575 ---
closure”. When t he driver closes the desk A, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 18576 ---
shall immediately go to Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18577 ---
5.12.4.2.2 When the driver opens the desk B, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 18578 ---
immediately switch back to Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18579 ---
5.12.4.3 When the driver closes a desk and opens the other one of the same engine, the 

--- Document Chunk 18580 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall be able to calculate the new train position 

--- Document Chunk 18581 ---
data (train front position, train orientation), by use of the previous data. 

--- Document Chunk 18582 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18583 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18584 ---

--- Document Chunk 18593 ---
5.13 Train Reversing 

--- Document Chunk 18594 ---
5.13.1.1 This procedure is intended to allo w the fast reversal of movement of a train, to run 

--- Document Chunk 18595 ---
away from a danger up to a “safe” location. 

--- Document Chunk 18596 ---
5.13.1.2 The area where initiation of reversing will be possible is announced to the 

--- Document Chunk 18597 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment by trackside (refer to 3.15.4.2 for details).  

--- Document Chunk 18598 ---
5.13.1.3 While th e train is at standstill inside the reversing permitted area, the driver shall be 

--- Document Chunk 18599 ---
informed that reversing is possible 

--- Document Chunk 18600 ---
5.13.1.4 If the ERTMS/ETCS onboard detects the driver’s intention to reverse (e.g. from a 

--- Document Chunk 18601 ---
direction controller in reverse position) , the ERTMS/ETCS  on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 18602 ---
ask the driver to acknowledge transition to RV mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18603 ---
5.13.1.5 If the driver acknowledges, the on-board equipment shall switch to RV mode 

--- Document Chunk 18604 ---
5.13.1.6 Once in RV mode,  it shall be possible for the trackside to send a new permitted 

--- Document Chunk 18605 ---
distance to run and a new maximum speed. 

--- Document Chunk 18606 ---
5.13.1.7 Once in RV mode, it shall also be possible for the trackside to send, together with the 

--- Document Chunk 18607 ---
new permitted distance to run and the maximum speed, a new reference location for 

--- Document Chunk 18608 ---
the new permitted distance to run. 

--- Document Chunk 18609 ---
5.13.1.8 Note: this new reference location is the end of a new reversing area given by trackside 

--- Document Chunk 18610 ---
that the onboard will use only for the purpose of distance referencing. 

--- Document Chunk 18611 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18612 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP
