--- Document Chunk 18623 ---
5.14 Joining / Splitting 

--- Document Chunk 18624 ---
5.14.1 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 18625 ---
5.14.1.1 Definition for splitting: The “train to be split” is the train at standstill, waiting for bein g 

--- Document Chunk 18626 ---
split. The “front train after splitting” refers to the front part of the train before splitting, 

--- Document Chunk 18627 ---
the “new train after splitting”, refers to the other part. 

--- Document Chunk 18628 ---
5.14.1.2 Definitions for joining: The “train to be joined” is the train at standstill, waiting for being 

--- Document Chunk 18629 ---
joined. The “joining train” is the train performing the joining operation. 

--- Document Chunk 18630 ---
5.14.2 Procedure “Splitting” 

--- Document Chunk 18631 ---
5.14.2.1 Step 1 - The electrical and mechanical links between the two trains must be removed 

--- Document Chunk 18632 ---
(this is a national operational procedure, out of the scope of the SRS). 

--- Document Chunk 18633 ---
5.14.2.1.1 Note: If splitting require s moving the two train parts apart from each other for a small 

--- Document Chunk 18634 ---
distance, this can be done even in SB mode 

--- Document Chunk 18635 ---
5.14.2.2 Step 2a - If the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment which was supervising the train 

--- Document Chunk 18636 ---
before splitting has not performed an end of missi on for splitting, the driver must 

--- Document Chunk 18637 ---
modify the Train Data such that it fits with the new train composition after splitting.  

--- Document Chunk 18638 ---
For level 2 or 3, the new train data is sent to the RBC (see SRS chapter 3 – Data Entry 

--- Document Chunk 18639 ---
/ Modification Process) 

--- Document Chunk 18640 ---
5.14.2.3 Step 2b - If an ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of the "new train after splitting" was 

--- Document Chunk 18641 ---
in SL mode before, it will switch to SB mode once the remote control signal is not 

--- Document Chunk 18642 ---
received any more (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes).  

--- Document Chunk 18643 ---
For Level 2 or 3: The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment open s a communication 

--- Document Chunk 18644 ---
session (if possible) and reports the mode change to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18645 ---
5.14.2.4 Step 2c - If an ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of the "new train after splitting" was 

--- Document Chunk 18646 ---
in NL mode before, it will switch to SB mode once the non leading input signal is not 

--- Document Chunk 18647 ---
received any more (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes and chapter 5, 

--- Document Chunk 18648 ---
“end of mission” procedure).  

--- Document Chunk 18649 ---
5.14.2.5 The driver can then start a new mission with this “new train after splitting” (refer to the 

--- Document Chunk 18650 ---
“Start of Mission” procedure). In al l cases, to start a mission is not the only possibility. 

--- Document Chunk 18651 ---
Shunting movements, or not moving the new train at all, are also possible. 

--- Document Chunk 18652 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18653 ---
5.14.3 Procedure “Joining” 

--- Document Chunk 18654 ---
5.14.3.1 Step 1 - The “joining train” must approach the “train to be joined”. This can be 

--- Document Chunk 18655 ---
performed in SR, OS or  SH mode (depending on the information available, and on the 

--- Document Chunk 18656 ---
national procedure for joining). 

--- Document Chunk 18657 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18658 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18659 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18660 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 18661 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 18662 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 18663 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18664 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 18665 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 18666 ---
Page 62/100 

--- Document Chunk 18667 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18668 ---
5.14.3.2 Step 2 - The electrical and mechanical links between the two trains must be closed 

--- Document Chunk 18669 ---
(vehicle dependent, outside the scope of the ETCS). 

--- Document Chunk 18670 ---
5.14.3.3 Step 3a - If a former leadi ng ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment remains leading and 

--- Document Chunk 18671 ---
there was no end of mission, the driver must modify the Train Data such that it fits with 

--- Document Chunk 18672 ---
the new train composition. For level 2 or 3, the new train data is sent to the RBC (see 

--- Document Chunk 18673 ---
SRS chapter 3 – Data Entry / Modification Process) 

--- Document Chunk 18674 ---
5.14.3.4 Step 3b - If a former leading ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is to become slave 

--- Document Chunk 18675 ---
equipment in SL mode, when closing the desk, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 18676 ---
will switch to SB mode (see SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes) and the end of 

--- Document Chunk 18677 ---
mission procedure is executed (see “End of Mission” procedure). Transition to SL 

--- Document Chunk 18678 ---
mode is from SB mode. 

--- Document Chunk 18679 ---
5.14.3.5 Step 3c - If a former leading ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is to become slave 

--- Document Chunk 18680 ---
equipment in NL mode, the driver selects NL mode (see SRS cha pter 4, transitions 

--- Document Chunk 18681 ---
between modes).  

--- Document Chunk 18682 ---
5.14.3.6 For further steps after joining refer to procedures “Start of Mission” and “Change of 

--- Document Chunk 18683 ---
Train Orientation”. 

--- Document Chunk 18684 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18685 ---

--- Document Chunk 18695 ---
5.15 RBC/RBC Handover 

--- Document Chunk 18696 ---
5.15.1 Principles 

--- Document Chunk 18697 ---
5.15.1.1 Every RBC/RBC handover shall be announced to the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 18698 ---
equipment via a balise group or via the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18699 ---
5.15.1.2 The handover announcement (i.e. RBC transition order) to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 18700 ---
equipment shall consist of an order to contact the Accepting RBC (see 3.5.3.5.3) and 

--- Document Chunk 18701 ---
to execute the handover at a further location corresponding to the border. 

--- Document Chunk 18702 ---
5.15.1.2.1 In case of RBC/RBC handover including Radio Network change, ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 18703 ---
trackside is responsible for the sequence of orders to register to the new Radio 

--- Document Chunk 18704 ---
Network and to contact the "Accepting" RBC, according to the Radio Network ’s 

--- Document Chunk 18705 ---
configuration. 

--- Document Chunk 18706 ---
5.15.1.2.2 In the following sections, "first" Mobile Terminal refers to the one used for 

--- Document Chunk 18707 ---
communication session with “Handing Over” RBC and "second" Mobile Terminal to the 

--- Document Chunk 18708 ---
one used for communication session with “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18709 ---
5.15.1.2.3 Note: In the following sections, Radio Networks are supposed to be overlapped. 

--- Document Chunk 18710 ---
5.15.1.3 At the RBC/RBC border a balise group with an order to execute the handover 

--- Document Chunk 18711 ---
immediately shall be placed. 

--- Document Chunk 18712 ---
5.15.1.3.1 Note: Balise groups are read in all levels and orders from balise groups are accepted 

--- Document Chunk 18713 ---
independent of the level of operation. Also sleeping units read balise groups. 

--- Document Chunk 18714 ---
5.15.1.4 If the message from the border balise group is not (yet) received, the handover shall 

--- Document Chunk 18715 ---
still be executed when the train with its max safe front end passes the border location 

--- Document Chunk 18716 ---
according to the announcement information. 

--- Document Chunk 18717 ---
5.15.1.5 The on -board equipment shall manage only one RBC/RBC transition at a time, 

--- Document Chunk 18718 ---
therefore a new transition order shall replace a previously received order. 

--- Document Chunk 18719 ---
5.15.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 18720 ---
5.15.2.1 Overview 

--- Document Chunk 18721 ---
5.15.2.1.1 In the normal operation, the main functional steps needed for running  from one RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18722 ---
area to another one are the following: 

--- Document Chunk 18723 ---
a) Pre-announcement of the transition by the “Handing Over” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 18724 ---
b) Registration to the new Radio Network of second Mobile Terminal (optional) & 

--- Document Chunk 18725 ---
Establishment of the radio communication session with the “Accepting” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 18726 ---
c) Generation of movement authorities including the border; 

--- Document Chunk 18727 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18728 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18729 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18730 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 18731 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 18732 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 18733 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18734 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 18735 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 18736 ---
Page 64/100 

--- Document Chunk 18737 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18738 ---
d) Announcement of the RBC transition 

--- Document Chunk 18739 ---
e) Transfer of train supervision to the “Accepting” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 18740 ---
f) Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18741 ---
g) Registration to the new Radio Network of first Mobile Terminal (optional)  

--- Document Chunk 18742 ---
5.15.2.2 Step by step description  

--- Document Chunk 18743 ---
5.15.2.2.1 Pre-announcement 

--- Document Chunk 18744 ---
5.15.2.2.1.1 When the “Handing Over” RBC generates a movement authority which reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 18745 ---
border to another RBC area, it initiates the processes associated to the transition. 

--- Document Chunk 18746 ---
5.15.2.2.1.2 The “Handing Over” RBC informs the “Accepting” RBC about the RBC/RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18747 ---
handover. 

--- Document Chunk 18748 ---
5.15.2.2.2 Registration to the new Radio Network of second Mobile Terminal (optional) & 

--- Document Chunk 18749 ---
Establishment of the radio communication session with “Accepting” RBC  

--- Document Chunk 18750 ---
5.15.2.2.2.1 A radio communication session with the Accepting RBC  is opened by the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 18751 ---
equipment based on the RBC transition order received from the “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18752 ---
or from balise group (refer to chapter 3, section "management of radio 

--- Document Chunk 18753 ---
communication"). 

--- Document Chunk 18754 ---
5.15.2.2.2.2 In case of RBC/RBC handover including Radio Network change, the registration to 

--- Document Chunk 18755 ---
the new radio network of the second Mobile Terminal is completed before the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18756 ---
transition order is transmitted to the on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 18757 ---
5.15.2.2.3 Generation of MAs including the border 

--- Document Chunk 18758 ---
5.15.2.2.3.1 The “Handing Over” RBC is responsible for establishing the  movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 18759 ---
based on: 

--- Document Chunk 18760 ---
a) Information from the trackside equipment and interlocking of its own area (for the 

--- Document Chunk 18761 ---
part of route related information up to the border), 

--- Document Chunk 18762 ---
b) Information from the “Accepting RBC” for the part of route related information in 

--- Document Chunk 18763 ---
advance of the border.

5.15.2.2.3.2 When it is required to send a movement authority to the train, the “Handing Over” 

--- Document Chunk 18794 ---
RBC will request from the “Accepting” RBC information needed for extending the MA in 

--- Document Chunk 18795 ---
advance of the border. 

--- Document Chunk 18796 ---
5.15.2.2.4 Announcement 

--- Document Chunk 18797 ---
5.15.2.2.4.1 When the train reaches the border with its max safe front end, the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 18798 ---
on-board equipment sends a position report both to the “Handing Over” RBC and to 

--- Document Chunk 18799 ---
the “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18800 ---
5.15.2.2.4.2 The “Handing Over” RBC forwards the announcement information to the 

--- Document Chunk 18801 ---
“Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18802 ---
5.15.2.2.4.2.1 Note: The forwarding of the announcement information is executed because the 

--- Document Chunk 18803 ---
“Handing Over” RBC has no knowledge if the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is in 

--- Document Chunk 18804 ---
a degraded situation or not i.e. whether it can handle one or two communication 

--- Document Chunk 18805 ---
sessions. 

--- Document Chunk 18806 ---
5.15.2.2.5 Transfer of train supervision to “Accepting” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18807 ---
5.15.2.2.5.1 As soon as the on -board has sent to the “Accepting” RBC the position report, it 

--- Document Chunk 18808 ---
considers to be supervised by the “Accepting” RBC i.e. it uses in formation received 

--- Document Chunk 18809 ---
from the “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18810 ---
5.15.2.2.5.2 When the “Accepting” RBC receives a position report from the on-board and detects 

--- Document Chunk 18811 ---
that the max safe front end has passed the border, it takes over the responsibility and 

--- Document Chunk 18812 ---
informs the “Handing Over” RBC.  

--- Document Chunk 18813 ---

5.15.2.2.6 Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18825 ---

--- Document Chunk 18826 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment sends a position report to the “Handing Over” 

--- Document Chunk 18827 ---
RBC.  

--- Document Chunk 18828 ---
5.15.2.2.6.2 When this position report is received by the ”Handin g Over” RBC, it sends an order 

--- Document Chunk 18829 ---
to terminate the session to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 18830 ---

--- Document Chunk 18831 ---

--- Document Chunk 18832 ---
the new Radio Network of the first Mobile Terminal is initiated by the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 18833 ---
on-board equipment as soon as the communication session with the "Handing Over" 

--- Document Chunk 18834 ---
RBC has been terminated and the safe radio connection has been released. 

--- Document Chunk 18835 ---
5.15.3 Degraded situation: Only one communication session can be handled 

--- Document Chunk 18836 ---
5.15.3.1 Overview 

--- Document Chunk 18837 ---
5.15.3.1.1 In this case, the main functional steps needed for running from one RBC area to 

--- Document Chunk 18838 ---
another one are the following: 

--- Document Chunk 18839 ---
a) Pre-announcement of the transition by the “Handing Over” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 18840 ---
b) Generation of movement authorities including the border; 

--- Document Chunk 18841 ---
c) Announcement of the RBC transition 

--- Document Chunk 18842 ---
d) Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 18843 ---
e) Registration to the new Radio Network of the Mobile Terminal (optional) & 

--- Document Chunk 18844 ---
Establishment of the radio communication session with the “Accepting” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 18845 ---
f) Transfer of train supervision to the “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18846 ---
5.15.3.2 Step by step description  

--- Document Chunk 18847 ---
5.15.3.2.1 Pre-announcement 

--- Document Chunk 18848 ---
5.15.3.2.1.1 When the “Handing over” RBC generates a movement authority which reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 18849 ---
border to another RBC area, it initiates the processes associated to the transition. 

--- Document Chunk 18850 ---
5.15.3.2.1.2 The “Handing Over” RBC informs the “Accepting” RBC about the RBC/RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18851 ---
transition. 

--- Document Chunk 18852 ---
5.15.3.2.2 Generation of MAs including the border 

--- Document Chunk 18853 ---
5.15.3.2.2.1 The “Handing Over” RBC is responsible for establishing the movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 18854 ---
based on (see Figure 9) 

--- Document Chunk 18855 ---
a) Information from the trackside equipment and interlocking of its own area (for the 

--- Document Chunk 18856 ---
part of route related information up to the border), 

--- Document Chunk 18857 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18858 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18859 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18860 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 18861 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 18862 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 18863 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18864 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 18865 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 18866 ---
Page 67/100 

--- Document Chunk 18867 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18868 ---
b) Information from the “Accepting RBC” for the part of route related information in 

--- Document Chunk 18869 ---
advance of the border. 

--- Document Chunk 18870 ---
5.15.3.2.2.2 When it is required to send a movement authority to the train, the "Handing Over" 

--- Document Chunk 18871 ---
RBC will request from the "Accepting RBC" information needed for extending the MA 

--- Document Chunk 18872 ---
in advance of the border. 

--- Document Chunk 18873 ---
5.15.3.2.3 Announcement 

--- Document Chunk 18874 ---
5.15.3.2.3.1 When the train with its max safe front end reaches the border, the ERTMS/ ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 18875 ---
on-board equipment sends a position report to the “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18876 ---
5.15.3.2.3.2 The “Handing Over” RBC forwards the announcement information to the 

--- Document Chunk 18877 ---
“Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18878 ---
5.15.3.2.4 Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18879 ---
5.15.3.2.4.1 As requested by the RBC transition order, whe n the min safe rear end of the train 

--- Document Chunk 18880 ---
passes the location of the border, the on -board equipment sends a position report to 

--- Document Chunk 18881 ---
the “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18882 ---
5.15.3.2.4.2 When this position report is received by the “Handing Over” RBC, it sends an order 

--- Document Chunk 18883 ---
to terminate the session to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 18884 ---
5.15.3.2.5 Registration to the new Radio Network of the Mobile Terminal (optional) & 

--- Document Chunk 18885 ---
Establishment of the radio communication session with “Accepting” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18886 ---
5.15.3.2.5.1 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment receives the session termination 

--- Document Chunk 18887 ---
order from the “Handing Over” RBC, it terminates the session with the “Handing over” 

--- Document Chunk 18888 ---
RBC and opens a session with the “Accepting” RBC (refer to chapter 3, management 

--- Document Chunk 18889 ---
of radio communication). 

--- Document Chunk 18890 ---
5.15.3.2.5.2 In case of RBC/RBC handover including Radio Network change: as soon a s the 

--- Document Chunk 18891 ---
session with the "Handing Over" RBC is terminated, the registration to the new Radio 

--- Document Chunk 18892 ---
Network of the Mobile Terminal is enforced by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 18893 ---
prior to the opening of a session with the “Accepting” RBC (refer to chapter 3, 

--- Document Chunk 18894 ---
management of radio communication). 

--- Document Chunk 18895 ---
5.15.3.2.6 Transfer of train supervision to “Accepting” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18896 ---
5.15.3.2.6.1 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has established a communication 

--- Document Chunk 18897 ---
session with the “Accepting” RBC and sent to the “Accepting” RBC a position report, it 

--- Document Chunk 18898 ---
considers to be su pervised by the “Accepting” RBC, i.e. it accepts only information 

--- Document Chunk 18899 ---
received from the “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18900 ---
5.15.3.2.6.2 When the “Accepting” RBC receives a position report from the on-board and detects 

--- Document Chunk 18901 ---
that the max safe front end has passed the border, it takes over the resp onsibility and 

--- Document Chunk 18902 ---
informs the “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18903 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 18914 ---
5.15.4 Other degraded Situations 

--- Document Chunk 18915 ---
5.15.4.1 Note: If the “Handing Over” RBC is not able to extend the MA into the area of the 

--- Document Chunk 18916 ---
“Accepting RBC”, the driver may select "override", or manually change the level  to 

--- Document Chunk 18917 ---
move the train into the area of the “Accepting RBC”. 

--- Document Chunk 18918 ---
5.15.4.2 Note: If the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment cannot open a session with the 

--- Document Chunk 18919 ---
“Accepting RBC”, the train is stopped at the latest when it has reached the EOA given 

--- Document Chunk 18920 ---
by the “Handing Over” RBC. For passing the EOA the driver may select "override", or 

--- Document Chunk 18921 ---
manually change the level. 

--- Document Chunk 18922 ---
5.15.4.3 If the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is not able to terminate the session with the 

--- Document Chunk 18923 ---
“Handing Over” RBC: In case a communication session is established and  no request 

--- Document Chunk 18924 ---
to terminate the session is received from  the “Handing Over”  RBC within a fixed 

--- Document Chunk 18925 ---
waiting time (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) after sending the 

--- Document Chunk 18926 ---
position report (see 5.15.2.2.6) , the position report shall be repeated with the fixed 

--- Document Chunk 18927 ---
waiting time after each repetition. 

--- Document Chunk 18928 ---
5.15.4.4 After a defined number of repetitions (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value 

--- Document Chunk 18929 ---
Data), and if no reply is received within the fixed waiting time from the last sending of 

--- Document Chunk 18930 ---
the position report,  the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 18931 ---
communication session.  

--- Document Chunk 18932 ---
5.16 Procedure passing a non protected Level Crossing 

--- Document Chunk 18933 ---
5.16.1 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 18934 ---
5.16.1.1 In case the LX is not protected, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment (in FS , LS or 

--- Document Chunk 18935 ---
OS mode) shall temporarily supervise the LX start location as both the EOA and SvL 

--- Document Chunk 18936 ---
(instead of t he EOA/LOA and the SvL (if any) derived from  the MA), with no release 

--- Document Chunk 18937 ---
speed. 

--- Document Chunk 18938 ---
5.16.1.2 The supervision of the LX start location as both the EOA and SvL shall be substituted 

--- Document Chunk 18939 ---
by the inclusion of the LX speed restriction in the MRSP under  conditions depending 

--- Document Chunk 18940 ---
on whether stopping in rear of the LX start location is required or not. The conditions of 

--- Document Chunk 18941 ---
this substitution are specified in 5.16.2 or 5.16.3. 

--- Document Chunk 18942 ---
5.16.1.3 The start location of the LX speed restriction depends on the substitution conditions, 

--- Document Chunk 18943 ---
which are specified in 5.16.2 or 5 .16.3. The end location of the LX speed restriction 

--- Document Chunk 18944 ---
shall be the LX end location. 

--- Document Chunk 18945 ---
5.16.1.4 When approaching a non protected LX, the on -board equipment shall inform the driver 

--- Document Chunk 18946 ---
about the status of the LX, as soon as:  

--- Document Chunk 18947 ---
a) either the EOA or the SvL related to the LX start  location becomes the Most 

--- Document Chunk 18948 ---
Relevant Displayed Target (see 3.13.10.4.2), or 

--- Document Chunk 18949 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18950 ---

--- Document Chunk 18960 ---
b) the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment substitutes the supervision of the LX start 

--- Document Chunk 18961 ---
location as both the EOA and SvL  by the inclusion of the LX speed restriction in the 

--- Document Chunk 18962 ---
MRSP. 

--- Document Chunk 18963 ---

--- Document Chunk 18964 ---
is met: 

--- Document Chunk 18965 ---
a) information “LX is protected” is received on-board; 

--- Document Chunk 18966 ---
b) train has passed the LX end location with its min safe front end. 

--- Document Chunk 18967 ---

--- Document Chunk 18968 ---

--- Document Chunk 18969 ---
by trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall no longer supervise  the LX 

--- Document Chunk 18970 ---
start location as both the EOA and SvL  (i.e. the EOA/LOA and the SvL (if any) derived 

--- Document Chunk 18971 ---
from the MA shall be again supervised ) and shall immediately include the LX speed  

--- Document Chunk 18972 ---
restriction in the MRSP, starting from the estimated train front end. 

--- Document Chunk 18973 ---

train front end location

5.17 Changing Train Data from sources different from the driver 

--- Document Chunk 19029 ---
5.17.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 19030 ---
5.17.1.1 When valid Train Data is stored on -board, input information acquired from 

--- Document Chunk 19031 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external sources different from the driver may affect some of the Train 

--- Document Chunk 19032 ---
Data, depending on the type of train (e .g. tilting input information from tilting external 

--- Document Chunk 19033 ---
device may affect the train category and the loading gauge). 

--- Document Chunk 19034 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19035 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19036 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19037 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19038 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 19039 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 19040 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 19041 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 19042 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19043 ---
Page 71/100 

--- Document Chunk 19044 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19045 ---
5.17.1.2 The procedure here below describes the necessary steps performed by the 

--- Document Chunk 19046 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment from the detection of an input informatio n change 

--- Document Chunk 19047 ---
on an external interface, to the effective encountering of the Train Data change by the 

--- Document Chunk 19048 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 19049 ---
5.17.1.3 This procedure is not applicable for trains running in RV mode: on leaving RV mode, 

--- Document Chunk 19050 ---
the Train Data will always be invalidated or deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 19051 ---
5.17.2 Table of requirements for “Changing Train Data from sources different 

--- Document Chunk 19052 ---
from the driver” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 19053 ---
5.17.2.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 19054 ---
a flow chart in section 5.17.3. 

--- Document Chunk 19055 ---
5.17.2.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 19056 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 19057 ---
S0 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in one of the following modes: FS, LS, OS, 

--- Document Chunk 19058 ---
SR, SB, SN, UN, TR, PT and valid Train Data is stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 19059 ---
If a change of input information, which affects Train Data, is detected on an 

--- Document Chunk 19060 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board external interface (E0), the process shall go to D0 

--- Document Chunk 19061 ---
D0 According to the specific train implementation, Train Data which is/are affected by the 

--- Document Chunk 19062 ---
change of input information from the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment external 

--- Document Chunk 19063 ---
interface may require validation: 

--- Document Chunk 19064 ---
 If the affected data requires driver validation, the process shall go to D2 

--- Document Chunk 19065 ---
 If the affected data does not require driver validation, the process shall go to D1 

--- Document Chunk 19066 ---
D1 Depending on the type of Train Data which is/are affected by the change of input 

--- Document Chunk 19067 ---
information from the ERT MS/ETCS on -board external interface, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 19068 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 19069 ---
 If the impacted Train Data regards either train category, or axle load  category, 

--- Document Chunk 19070 ---
or traction system(s)  accepted by the engine, or loading gauge, the process 

--- Document Chunk 19071 ---
shall go to D3 

--- Document Chunk 19072 ---
 If the impacted Trai n Data regards any other type of Train Data, the process 

--- Document Chunk 19073 ---
shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 19074 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19075 ---
D3 Depending on the mode of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 19076 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 19077 ---
 If mode is FS, LS, or OS, the process shall go to D7 

--- Document Chunk 19078 ---
 If mode is SB or PT, the process shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 19079 ---
 If mode is UN, SN, SR, or TR the process shall go to D5 

--- Document Chunk 19080 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19081 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19082 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19083 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19084 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 19085 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 19086 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 19087 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 19088 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19089 ---
Page 72/100 

--- Document Chunk 19090 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19091 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 19092 ---
D5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall check whether MA and track 

--- Document Chunk 19093 ---
description, received from RBC, are stored on-board, in case a level 2/3 transition or a 

--- Document Chunk 19094 ---
RBC transition for a further location has been ordered: 

--- Document Chunk 19095 ---
 If MA and track description are stored, the process shall go to D7 

--- Document Chunk 19096 ---
 If MA and track description are not both stored, the process shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 19097 ---
D7 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall check whether the train is at standstill: 

--- Document Chunk 19098 ---
 If at standstill, the process shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 19099 ---
 If not at standstill, the process shall go to S2 

--- Document Chunk 19100 ---
A1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall inform the driver that Train Data has 

--- Document Chunk 19101 ---
been changed and the process shall go to A7 

--- Document Chunk 19102 ---
S2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall command the service brake, inform the 

--- Document Chunk 19103 ---
driver about the reason of this brake command and wait s for the train to be at 

--- Document Chunk 19104 ---
standstill; when the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment detects that the train is at 

--- Document Chunk 19105 ---
standstill (E2), the process shall go to S3 

--- Document Chunk 19106 ---
S3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request the driver to acknowledge the 

--- Document Chunk 19107 ---
brake command; when the driver acknowledges (E3), the process shall go to A5 

--- Document Chunk 19108 ---
A5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall release the brake command and the 

--- Document Chunk 19109 ---
process shall go to A7 

--- Document Chunk 19110 ---
D2 Depending on the mode of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 19111 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 19112 ---
 If mode is FS, LS, OS, SR, SB, SN or UN the process shall go to D9 

--- Document Chunk 19113 ---
 If mode is TR or PT, the process shall go to S1 

--- Document Chunk 19114 ---
S1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall wait for th e end of the Train Trip 

--- Document Chunk 19115 ---
procedure (see section 5.11). When the Train Trip procedure is exited (E1) (i.e. there 

--- Document Chunk 19116 ---
is a mode transition to another mode than TR, PT), the process shall go to D4 

--- Document Chunk 19117 ---
D4 Depending on the mode of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 19118 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 19119 ---
 If mode is FS, LS, OS, SR, SN or UN the process shall go to S6 

--- Document Chunk 19120 ---
 If mode is SH, the Train Data are invalidated and the process shall END 

--- Document Chunk 19121 ---
D9 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall check whether the train is at standstill: 

--- Document Chunk 19122 ---
 If at standstill, the process shall go to S6 

--- Document Chunk 19123 ---
 If not at standstill, the process shall go to S4 

--- Document Chunk 19124 ---
S4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall command the service brake, inform the 

--- Document Chunk 19125 ---
driver about the reason of this brake command and wait for the train to be at standstill; 

--- Document Chunk 19126 ---
when the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment detects that the train is at standstill (E4), 

--- Document Chunk 19127 ---
the process shall go to S5 

--- Document Chunk 19128 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19129 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19130 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19131 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19132 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 19133 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 19134 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 19135 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 19136 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19137 ---
Page 73/100 

--- Document Chunk 19138 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19139 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 19140 ---
S5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request the driver to acknowledge the 

--- Document Chunk 19141 ---
brake command; when the driver acknowledges (E5), the process shall go to A6 

--- Document Chunk 19142 ---
A6 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall release the brake command and the 

--- Document Chunk 19143 ---
process shall go to S6 

--- Document Chunk 19144 ---
S6 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request the driver to re -enter or re -

--- Document Chunk 19145 ---
validate the Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 19146 ---
Once Train Data is validated (E6), the process shall go to A7 

--- Document Chunk 19147 ---
A7 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall consider the Train Data as being 

--- Document Chunk 19148 ---
changed and shall apply, when relevant, the requirements regarding change of Train 

--- Document Chunk 19149 ---
Data (refer to clauses 3.18.3.4, 3.18.3.7 and 3.18.3.8). 

--- Document Chunk 19150 ---
The process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 19151 ---

--- Document Chunk 19255 ---
5.18 Indication of Track Conditions 

--- Document Chunk 19256 ---
5.18.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 19257 ---
5.18.1.1 This set of procedures specifies the sequences of driver indications related to the 

--- Document Chunk 19258 ---
following track-conditions: 

--- Document Chunk 19259 ---
a) powerless section with pantograph to be lowered 

--- Document Chunk 19260 ---
b) powerless section with main power switch to be switched off, 

--- Document Chunk 19261 ---
c) non-stopping area, 

--- Document Chunk 19262 ---
d) radio hole, 

--- Document Chunk 19263 ---
e) air tightness area, 

--- Document Chunk 19264 ---
f) Inhibition of a defined type of brake, 

--- Document Chunk 19265 ---
g) tunnel stopping area, 

--- Document Chunk 19266 ---
h) sound horn, 

--- Document Chunk 19267 ---
i) change of traction system. 

--- Document Chunk 19268 ---
5.18.1.2 Note: For every procedure a figure supports the textual description. The textual 

--- Document Chunk 19269 ---
description of the procedures contains reference to the figures (point B, point F,…). 

--- Document Chunk 19270 ---
5.18.2 Passing a powerless section with pantograph to be lowered 

--- Document Chunk 19271 ---
5.18.2.1 This procedure is dealing with the announcement and indication to the driver of a 

--- Document Chunk 19272 ---
powerless section with the pantograph to be lowered. 

--- Document Chunk 19273 ---
5.18.2.1.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 19274 ---
5.18.2.2 “Lower pantograph announcement” shall be displayed to the driver when the max safe 

--- Document Chunk 19275 ---
front end of the train reaches a location (point C) in rear of the beginning of the 

--- Document Chunk 19276 ---
powerless section (point D). 

--- Document Chunk 19277 ---
5.18.2.2.1 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 19278 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 19279 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 19280 ---
5.18.2.2.2 The displayed “Lower pantograph announcement” information shall also indicate if the 

--- Document Chunk 19281 ---
related functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 19282 ---
 automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 19283 ---
 if the driver is requested to act. 

--- Document Chunk 19284 ---
5.18.2.2.2.1 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 19285 ---
5.18.2.3 When the max safe front end of the train reaches the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 19286 ---
powerless section: 

--- Document Chunk 19287 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19288 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19289 ---

--- Document Chunk 19298 ---
 “Lower pantograph announcement” shall no longer be displayed to the driver, 

--- Document Chunk 19299 ---
 “Lowered Pantograph” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19300 ---
5.18.2.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 19301 ---
5.18.2.4.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 19302 ---
5.18.2.5 When the min safe front end of the train reaches the “Powerless section” e nd location 

--- Document Chunk 19303 ---
point E): 

--- Document Chunk 19304 ---
 “Lowered Pantograph” information shall no longer be displayed to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 19305 ---
 “Raise pantograph” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19306 ---

--- Document Chunk 19307 ---
functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 19308 ---
 automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 19309 ---
 if the driver is requested to act. 

--- Document Chunk 19310 ---
5.18.2.5.1.1 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 19311 ---

--- Document Chunk 19312 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the minimum safe rear end of the train has passed the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 19313 ---
“Powerless section”.

5.18.3 Passing a powerless section with main power switch to be switched off 

--- Document Chunk 19345 ---
5.18.3.1 This procedure is dealing with the announcement and indication to the driver of a 

--- Document Chunk 19346 ---
powerless section with main power switch to be switched off. 

--- Document Chunk 19347 ---
5.18.3.2 “Neutral section announcement” shall be displayed to the driver when the max safe 

--- Document Chunk 19348 ---
front end of the train reaches a location (point C) in rear of the beginning of the 

--- Document Chunk 19349 ---
powerless section. 

--- Document Chunk 19350 ---
5.18.3.2.1 This location (point C) shall be deter mined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 19351 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 19352 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 19353 ---
5.18.3.2.2 The displayed “Neutral section announcement” information shall also indicate if the 

--- Document Chunk 19354 ---
related functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 19355 ---
 automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 19356 ---
 if the driver is requested to act. 

--- Document Chunk 19357 ---
5.18.3.2.2.1 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 19358 ---
5.18.3.3 When the max safe front end of the train reaches the starting location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 19359 ---
powerless section: 

--- Document Chunk 19360 ---
 “Neutral section announcement” shall no longer be displayed to the driver, 

--- Document Chunk 19361 ---
 “Neutral section” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19362 ---
5.18.3.4 When the min safe front end o f the train reaches the “Powerless section” end location 

--- Document Chunk 19363 ---
point E): 

--- Document Chunk 19364 ---
 “Neutral section” information shall no longer be displayed to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 19365 ---
 “End of Neutral section” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19366 ---
5.18.3.4.1 The displayed “End of Neutral section” information shall also indicate if the related 

--- Document Chunk 19367 ---
functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 19368 ---
 Automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 19369 ---
 if the driver is requested to act.  

--- Document Chunk 19370 ---
5.18.3.4.1.1 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent.  

--- Document Chunk 19371 ---
5.18.3.5 The “End of Neutral section” information shall remain displayed for a fixed time (see 

--- Document Chunk 19372 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the minimum safe rear end of the train has pass ed the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 19373 ---
“Powerless section”. 

--- Document Chunk 19374 ---
5.18.3.5.1 Note: The train front end position, when this information disappears is shown as point 

--- Document Chunk 19375 ---
G in the Figure 14. 

--- Document Chunk 19376 ---

5.18.4 Passing a non stopping area 

--- Document Chunk 19392 ---
5.18.4.1 This procedure is dealing with the announcement and indication to the driver of an 

--- Document Chunk 19393 ---
area where stopping is not permitted. 

--- Document Chunk 19394 ---
5.18.4.2 As long as there are non stopping areas stored on -board, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 19395 ---
equipment shall continuously check the current speed and position of the train  whether 

--- Document Chunk 19396 ---
a full service brake command would stop the train within any of the stored non 

--- Document Chunk 19397 ---
stopping areas. This shall be achieved taking into account  for each non stopping area, 

--- Document Chunk 19398 ---
two virtual SBI supervision limits (SBID and SBIG), calculated at the estimated speed 

--- Document Chunk 19399 ---
from two SBD curves of which the f eet are the start location of the non stopping area 

--- Document Chunk 19400 ---
(point D) and a location (point G) at train length distance in advance of the end location 

--- Document Chunk 19401 ---
of the non stopping area: 

--- Document Chunk 19402 ---
a) If the max safe front end is in rear of the first SBI supervision limit  (SBID) no 

--- Document Chunk 19403 ---
information related to this non stopping area shall be displayed 

--- Document Chunk 19404 ---
b) If the max safe front end is in advance of the first SBI supervision limit (SBID) and 

--- Document Chunk 19405 ---
the min safe front end in rear of the second  SBI supervision limit  (SBIG), the non  

--- Document Chunk 19406 ---
stopping area related information shall be displayed to the driver  according to the 

--- Document Chunk 19407 ---
following clauses 5.18.4.3, 5.18.4.4. 

--- Document Chunk 19408 ---
c) If the min safe fr ont end is in advance of the second SBI supervision limit  (SBIG), no 

--- Document Chunk 19409 ---
information related to this non stopping area shall be displayed. 

--- Document Chunk 19410 ---
5.18.4.3 When the max safe front end is in rear of  the start location (point D) of the non 

--- Document Chunk 19411 ---
stopping area, the “Non stopping area announcement” shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19412 ---
5.18.4.4 When the max safe front end is in advance of  the start location (point D) of the non 

--- Document Chunk 19413 ---
stopping area: 

--- Document Chunk 19414 ---
 “Non stopping area announcement”, if any, shall no longer be displayed 

--- Document Chunk 19415 ---
running direction 

--- Document Chunk 19416 ---
Display: «Neutral 

--- Document Chunk 19417 ---
section» 

--- Document Chunk 19418 ---
Distance to begin of powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 19419 ---
D E C Display: «Neutral 

--- Document Chunk 19420 ---
section announcement» 

--- Document Chunk 19421 ---
Powerless section length 

--- Document Chunk 19422 ---
LRBG 

--- Document Chunk 19423 ---
Display: «End of 

--- Document Chunk 19424 ---
Neutral section» 

--- Document Chunk 19425 ---
G A 

--- Document Chunk 19426 ---
Powerless section

 “Open air conditioning intake” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19524 ---
5.18.6.4.1 The displayed “Open air conditioning intake” information shall also indicate if the 

--- Document Chunk 19525 ---
related functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 19526 ---
 automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 19527 ---
 If the driver is requested to act. 

--- Document Chunk 19528 ---
5.18.6.4.1.1 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 19529 ---
5.18.6.5 The “Open Air Conditioning intake” information shall remain displayed for a fixed time 

--- Document Chunk 19530 ---
(see Appendix A.3.1) after the minimum safe rear end of the train has passed the end 

--- Document Chunk 19531 ---
of the “Air tightness area”. 

--- Document Chunk 19532 ---
5.18.6.5.1 Note: The train front end position, when this information disappears , is shown as point 

--- Document Chunk 19533 ---
G in the Figure 17. 

--- Document Chunk 19534 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19535 ---
Figure 17: Passing an air tightness area 

--- Document Chunk 19536 ---

--- Document Chunk 19539 ---

--- Document Chunk 19540 ---

--- Document Chunk 19541 ---

--- Document Chunk 19542 ---

5.18.8 Advising a tunnel stopping area 

--- Document Chunk 19589 ---
5.18.8.1 This procedure is dealing with the indication to the driver of an area under a tunnel 

--- Document Chunk 19590 ---
where stopping is permitted, and suitable escaping paths are provided. 

--- Document Chunk 19591 ---
5.18.8.1.1 Note: the tunnel stopping areas are designed in such a way that the passengers can 

--- Document Chunk 19592 ---
step out, u se a walkway along the track and reach the safe area, taking into account 

--- Document Chunk 19593 ---
the longest admissible train in the tunnel stopped with its front end within the tunnel 

--- Document Chunk 19594 ---
stopping area. 

--- Document Chunk 19595 ---
5.18.8.2 On driver request, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall enable/disable the 

--- Document Chunk 19596 ---
display of the tunnel stopping area related information (initial state: disabled). 

--- Document Chunk 19597 ---
running direction 

--- Document Chunk 19598 ---

announcement»

--- Document Chunk 19616 ---

--- Document Chunk 19617 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19618 ---
5.18.8.3 As long as the display of the tunnel stopping areas is enabled (point C) and there are 

--- Document Chunk 19619 ---
tunnel stopping areas stored on -board, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 19620 ---
continuously check the current speed and position of the train  to determine whether 

--- Document Chunk 19621 ---
the driver can stop the train with the full service brake before reaching the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 19622 ---
closest tunnel stopping area. This shall be achieved taking into account a virtual 

--- Document Chunk 19623 ---
Permitted supervision limit (with no contribution of the GUI curve, if any) , calculated at 

--- Document Chunk 19624 ---
the estimated speed from an SBD curve of which the foot is the end location of the 

--- Document Chunk 19625 ---
tunnel stopping area: 

--- Document Chunk 19626 ---
a) If the train front end is in rear of the Permitted supervision limit , the tunnel stopping 

--- Document Chunk 19627 ---
area related information shall be displayed to the driver.  

--- Document Chunk 19628 ---
b) If the train front end is in advance of the  Permitted supervision limit, no information 

--- Document Chunk 19629 ---
related to this tunnel stopping area shall be displayed and the next tunnel stopping 

--- Document Chunk 19630 ---
area stored on-board, if any, shall be checked. 

--- Document Chunk 19631 ---
5.18.8.4 Before the train reaches the start location (point D) of the tunnel stopping area, the 

--- Document Chunk 19632 ---
“tunnel stopping area announcement” shall be displayed to the driver. This shall 

--- Document Chunk 19633 ---
include the indication of the remaining d istance to the start location of the tunnel 

--- Document Chunk 19634 ---
stopping area. 

--- Document Chunk 19635 ---
5.18.8.5 When the train front end reaches the start location (point D) of the tunnel stopping 

--- Document Chunk 19636 ---
area: 

--- Document Chunk 19637 ---
 “Tunnel stopping area announcement” shall no longer be displayed 

--- Document Chunk 19638 ---
 “Tunnel stopping area” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19639 ---
5.18.8.6 Note: the display of the “tunnel stopping area ” information will always end before the 

--- Document Chunk 19640 ---
point E is reached, because of the condition 5.18.8.3 b).

5.18.9 Sounding the horn 

--- Document Chunk 19673 ---
5.18.9.1 This procedure is dealing with the indication to the driver of a request to sound the 

--- Document Chunk 19674 ---
horn. 

--- Document Chunk 19675 ---
5.18.9.2 “Sound horn” shall be displayed to the driver when the estimated front end of the train 

--- Document Chunk 19676 ---
reaches a location (point C) in rear of the beginning of the “sound horn” area (point D). 

--- Document Chunk 19677 ---
5.18.9.2.1 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 19678 ---
taking into account the time necessary for the driver to perform the required action 

--- Document Chunk 19679 ---
(see Appendix A.3.1) and the current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 19680 ---
5.18.9.3 When the estimated front  end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the 

--- Document Chunk 19681 ---
“sound horn”  area, the indication “ Sound horn ” information shall no longer be 

--- Document Chunk 19682 ---
displayed. 

--- Document Chunk 19683 ---
5.18.9.4 Note: In order not to encourage the driver to stop sounding the horn too early, the track 

--- Document Chunk 19684 ---
condition “sound horn” is defined as an area so that the display of the indication 

--- Document Chunk 19685 ---
“Sound horn” continues during a certain distance sent by trackside  (i.e. until point E), 

--- Document Chunk 19686 ---
after the theoretical location of the board on the line (i.e. point D). 

--- Document Chunk 19687 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19688 ---
Figure 20: Sounding the Horn 

--- Document Chunk 19689 ---

--- Document Chunk 19754 ---
5.19 Procedure Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 19755 ---
5.19.1 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 19756 ---
5.19.1.1 The order to switch to Limited Supervision mode shall be given by means of a mode 

--- Document Chunk 19757 ---
profile. 

--- Document Chunk 19758 ---
5.19.1.2 An acknowledgement for running in Limited Supervision mode shall be r equested from 

--- Document Chunk 19759 ---
the driver. The conditions of the acknowledgement are specified below. 

--- Document Chunk 19760 ---
5.19.2 Limited Supervision is requested for current location (from modes 

--- Document Chunk 19761 ---
different from Stand By and Post Trip) 

--- Document Chunk 19762 ---
5.19.2.1 In a level 1 area, the beginning of the Limited Supervision area c an be the balise 

--- Document Chunk 19763 ---
(group) that gives the Mode Profile. When the train passes the balise group and 

--- Document Chunk 19764 ---
receives this information, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall immediately 

--- Document Chunk 19765 ---
switch to Limited Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 19766 ---
5.19.2.2 In a level 2 or 3 area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment can receive a mode 

--- Document Chunk 19767 ---
profile giving a Limited Supervision area which the train has already entered with its 

--- Document Chunk 19768 ---
max safe front end. In this case, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 19769 ---
immediately switch to Limited Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 19770 ---
5.19.2.3 The driver mus t acknowledge the Limited Supervision mode. A request of 

--- Document Chunk 19771 ---
acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19772 ---
5.19.2.4 If the driver has not acknowledged after the driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 19773 ---
Appendix A.3.1), the service brake command  shall be triggered. The  brake command 

--- Document Chunk 19774 ---
is released when the driver acknowledges, except if brakes are also applied for 

--- Document Chunk 19775 ---
another reason(s). 

--- Document Chunk 19776 ---
5.19.2.5 Note: Once in Limited Supervision mode, the speed supervision is such that the train 

--- Document Chunk 19777 ---
speed cannot exceed the LS mode speed limit. If, when ent ering the Limited 

--- Document Chunk 19778 ---
Supervision mode, the train speed was higher than the LS mode speed limit (because 

--- Document Chunk 19779 ---
a higher speed was allowed in Full Supervision mode, On Sight mode or in Staff 

--- Document Chunk 19780 ---
Responsible mode) then an emergency brake  command could be immediately 

--- Document Chunk 19781 ---
triggered, independently of the acknowledgement of the driver, but because of the LS 

--- Document Chunk 19782 ---
supervision (see Figure 22). 

--- Document Chunk 19783 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19784 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19785 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19786 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19787 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 19788 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 19789 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 19790 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 19791 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19792 ---
Page 87/100 

--- Document Chunk 19793 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19794 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19795 ---
location 

--- Document Chunk 19796 ---
speed 

--- Document Chunk 19797 ---
permitted speed in LS 

--- Document Chunk 19798 ---
mode 

--- Document Chunk 19799 ---
permitted speed 

--- Document Chunk 19800 ---
in previous mode 

--- Document Chunk 19801 ---
 Location of: LS request for  

--- Document Chunk 19802 ---
current location 

--- Document Chunk 19803 ---
Transition to LS mode triggers 

--- Document Chunk 19804 ---
EB command  

--- Document Chunk 19805 ---
(even if driver acknowledges 

--- Document Chunk 19806 ---
within 5s)  

--- Document Chunk 19807 ---
train speed 

--- Document Chunk 19808 ---
Brake command revoked 

--- Document Chunk 19809 ---
(conditions see SRS chapter 3, 

--- Document Chunk 19810 ---
Dynamic Speed Monitoring) 

--- Document Chunk 19811 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19812 ---
Figure 22: Train enters LS area with too high speed 

--- Document Chunk 19813 ---
5.19.2.6 Note: This sharp  brake reaction can be avoided in Full Supervision or On Sight mode 

--- Document Chunk 19814 ---
by giving with the previous MA an E OA (or a L OA = LS mode speed limit) at the 

--- Document Chunk 19815 ---
location of transition to Limited Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 19816 ---
5.19.2.7 If the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is already in LS mode  when receiving the LS 

--- Document Chunk 19817 ---
mode profile, no further acknowledgement shall be requested from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19818 ---
5.19.3 Limited Supervision is requested for a further location 

--- Document Chunk 19819 ---
5.19.3.1 The beginning of the Limited Supervision area can be a location that the train has not 

--- Document Chunk 19820 ---
reached yet. This occurs when: 

--- Document Chunk 19821 ---
a) In a level 1 area, a balise group gives a Mode Profile with an Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 19822 ---
area that is located at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 19823 ---
b) In a level 2 or 3 area, the RBC gives a Mode Profile with an Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 19824 ---
area that is located at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 19825 ---
5.19.3.2 A request for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver when the following 

--- Document Chunk 19826 ---
conditions are fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 19827 ---
a)  The distance between the estimated front end of the train and the beginning of 

--- Document Chunk 19828 ---
Limited Supervision area is shorter than a value, contained in the mode profile.   

--- Document Chunk 19829 ---
b) The speed is lower than the Limited Supervision mode speed limit (national value, 

--- Document Chunk 19830 ---
or value given in the mode profile). 

--- Document Chunk 19831 ---
c) The current mode is not Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 19832 ---
5.19.3.3 Note: The first 2 conditions define the “rectangle of acknowledgement”. 

--- Document Chunk 19833 ---
5.19.3.4 Once the acknowledgement request is displayed, it shall not be taken back if the train 

--- Document Chunk 19834 ---
leaves the “rectangle of acknowledgement” (for example: because the train 

--- Document Chunk 19835 ---
accelerates). 

--- Document Chunk 19836 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19837 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19838 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19839 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19840 ---

13/05/2016

--- Document Chunk 19843 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 19844 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19845 ---
Page 88/100 

--- Document Chunk 19846 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19847 ---
5.19.3.5 Until the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment has switched to LS mode,  the beginning 

--- Document Chunk 19848 ---
of the Limited Supervision area shall be temporarily considered as the EOA (instead of 

--- Document Chunk 19849 ---
the EOA/LOA derived from the MA)  and the SvL (with no release speed) shall be 

--- Document Chunk 19850 ---
determined according to the mode profile either: 

--- Document Chunk 19851 ---
a) as the SvL derived from the MA. In case the MA defines an LOA, the SvL shall be 

--- Document Chunk 19852 ---
derived as if no LOA had been given. 

--- Document Chunk 19853 ---
OR 

--- Document Chunk 19854 ---
b) as the beginning of the Limited Supervision area. 

--- Document Chunk 19855 ---
5.19.3.6 When the driver acknowledges the Limited Supervision mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 19856 ---
board equipment shall immediately switch to the Limited Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 19857 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19858 ---

--- Document Chunk 19859 ---

--- Document Chunk 19876 ---
5.19.3.7 If the max safe front end of the train reaches the beginning of the Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 19877 ---
area according the mode  profile and the driver has not yet acknowledged, the 

--- Document Chunk 19878 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall switch immediately to LS mode and a request 

--- Document Chunk 19879 ---
for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 19880 ---
transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 19881 ---
5.19.3.8 If, in this case , the driver does not acknowledge within the driver acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 19882 ---
time (refer to Appendix A .3.1) after the change to LS mode, the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 19883 ---
command shall be triggered. The command shall be released as soon as the driver 

--- Document Chunk 19884 ---
acknowledges (unless the command was triggered also for other reasons). 

--- Document Chunk 19885 ---

--- Document Chunk 19895 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19896 ---
5.19.4 Limited Supervision from Unfitted or SN mode 

--- Document Chunk 19897 ---
5.19.4.1 The mode profile with regards to an LS area is only evaluated in levels 1,2,3, although 

--- Document Chunk 19898 ---
the mode profile may have been received in level 0 (Unfitted mode) or NTC (SN 

--- Document Chunk 19899 ---
mode). A transition to Limited Supervision mode can therefore earliest occur at a 

--- Document Chunk 19900 ---
transition of level: from level 0 or NTC to level 1 or 2 or 3. 

--- Document Chunk 19901 ---
5.19.4.2 Requirements about the acknowledgement in section 5.19.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 19902 ---
5.19.5 Limited Supervision from Stand By or Post Trip mode 

--- Document Chunk 19903 ---
5.19.5.1 When performing a SoM or a Train Trip procedure and when the current level is 2 or 3, 

--- Document Chunk 19904 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment can receive a mode profile giving an Limited 

--- Document Chunk 19905 ---
Supervision area which the train has already entered with its max safe front end. In this 

--- Document Chunk 19906 ---
case, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall first require an acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 19907 ---
from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19908 ---
5.19.5.2 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform 

--- Document Chunk 19909 ---
the transition to Limited Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 19910 ---
5.19.6 Exit of Limited Supervision mode 

--- Document Chunk 19911 ---
5.19.6.1 General rule 

--- Document Chunk 19912 ---
5.19.6.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall exit the Limited Supervision mode when 

--- Document Chunk 19913 ---
the min safe front end of the train passes the end of the Limited supervision area. 

--- Document Chunk 19914 ---
5.19.6.2 First case: The Limited supervision area ends at the EOA/LOA of the current MA 

--- Document Chunk 19915 ---
5.19.6.2.1 This occurs when the end of the Limited Supervision area that is given by the Mode 

--- Document Chunk 19916 ---
Profile has the same location as the EOA/LOA of the related MA. 

--- Document Chunk 19917 ---
5.19.6.2.2 In this case, the train must receive a new Movement Authority to be able to exit the 

--- Document Chunk 19918 ---
Limited Supervision area. 

--- Document Chunk 19919 ---
5.19.6.3 Second case: The Limited Supervision  area ends before the EOA /LOA of the 

--- Document Chunk 19920 ---
current MA 

--- Document Chunk 19921 ---
5.19.6.3.1 In this case, the current Movement Authority already allows the train to exit the Limited 

--- Document Chunk 19922 ---
Supervision area. 

--- Document Chunk 19923 ---
5.19.6.3.2 When exiting the Limited Supervision area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 19924 ---
switches either to Full Supervision, On Sight or to Shunting mode (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 19925 ---
chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 19926 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19927 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19928 ---

--- Document Chunk 19991 ---
5.20 Generation of Track Conditions related information to an 

--- Document Chunk 19992 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external function 

--- Document Chunk 19993 ---
5.20.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 19994 ---
5.20.1.1 This set of procedures specifies the information generated by the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 19995 ---
board equipment to an ERTMS/ETCS external function in relation to the following 

--- Document Chunk 19996 ---
track-conditions: 

--- Document Chunk 19997 ---
a) powerless section with pantograph to be lowered, 

--- Document Chunk 19998 ---
b) powerless section with main power switch to be switched off, 

--- Document Chunk 19999 ---
c) passing an “air tightness” area, 

--- Document Chunk 20000 ---
d) inhibition of a defined type of brake, 

--- Document Chunk 20001 ---
e) change of traction system, 

--- Document Chunk 20002 ---
f) change of allowed current consumption, 

--- Document Chunk 20003 ---
g) station platform. 

--- Document Chunk 20004 ---
5.20.1.2 In the following sections, the remaining distance from the concerned train end to the 

--- Document Chunk 20005 ---
concerned track condition location shall be counted positive when the train end is in 

--- Document Chunk 20006 ---
rear of the location and shall be counted negative when the trai n end is in advance of 

--- Document Chunk 20007 ---
the location. 

--- Document Chunk 20008 ---
5.20.2 Passing a powerless section with pantograph to be lowered  

--- Document Chunk 20009 ---
5.20.2.1 This procedure is dealing with the generation of the information related to a powerless 

--- Document Chunk 20010 ---
section with the pantograph to be lowered. 

--- Document Chunk 20011 ---
5.20.2.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 20012 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches 

--- Document Chunk 20013 ---
the point C in rear of the start location of the powerless section (see 5.18.2.2.1 for the 

--- Document Chunk 20014 ---
definition of point C). 

--- Document Chunk 20015 ---
5.20.2.3 When the min safe rear end of the train is in rear of the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20016 ---
powerless section, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall provide the following 

--- Document Chunk 20017 ---
information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 20018 ---
 the remaining distance from the max safe f ront end of the train to the start location 

--- Document Chunk 20019 ---
(point D) of the powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 20020 ---
 the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to the end location 

--- Document Chunk 20021 ---
(point E) of the powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 20022 ---
5.20.2.4 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the start  location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20023 ---
powerless section, the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 20024 ---
point D shall no longer be generated. The remaining distance from the min safe front 

--- Document Chunk 20025 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20026 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20027 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20028 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 20029 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 20030 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 20031 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 20032 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 20033 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 20034 ---
Page 92/100 

--- Document Chunk 20035 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20036 ---
end of the train to the end location (point E) of the powe rless section shall continue to 

--- Document Chunk 20037 ---
be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20038 ---
5.20.2.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20039 ---
powerless section, the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 20040 ---
point E shall no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20041 ---
5.20.2.6 Note: The remaining distance from the train max safe front end to point D and the 

--- Document Chunk 20042 ---
remaining distance from the train min safe front end to point E are generated until the 

--- Document Chunk 20043 ---
min safe rear end passes respectively the point D and the point E to allow the 

--- Document Chunk 20044 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external function to manage each pantograph individually assuming that 

--- Document Chunk 20045 ---
this function knows the distance between each pantograph and the train front end. 

--- Document Chunk 20046 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20047 ---
Figure 25: Generation of the information to an ERTMS/ETCS external function for a 

--- Document Chunk 20048 ---
supervision of powerless section with pantograph to be lowered 

--- Document Chunk 20049 ---
5.20.2.7 Note: When resuming the initial state (see 3.7.3.2) or any other reason (e.g. see 

--- Document Chunk 20050 ---
Appendix A.3.4) leads to the shortening of a powerless section with pantograph  to be 

--- Document Chunk 20051 ---
lowered, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment considers the new end location (point 

--- Document Chunk 20052 ---
E) of the powerless section for the calculation of the remaining distance from the min 

--- Document Chunk 20053 ---
safe front end of the train to the point E. 

--- Document Chunk 20054 ---
5.20.2.8 If resuming the initial state (see 3. 7.3.2) or any other reason (e.g. see Appendix A.3.4) 

--- Document Chunk 20055 ---
leads to the deletion of the powerless section, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 20056 ---
shall stop providing information related to this powerless section to the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 20057 ---
external function. 

--- Document Chunk 20058 ---
5.20.3 Passing a powerless section with main power switch to be switched off  

--- Document Chunk 20059 ---
5.20.3.1 This procedure is dealing with the generation of the information related to a powerless 

--- Document Chunk 20060 ---
section with main power switch to be switched off. 

--- Document Chunk 20061 ---
running direction 

--- Document Chunk 20062 ---
A Generate the remaining 

--- Document Chunk 20063 ---
distance to point E

D E

--- Document Chunk 20068 ---
and the remaining distance to point E

--- Document Chunk 20084 ---
5.20.3.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 20085 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches 

--- Document Chunk 20086 ---
the point C in rear of the start location of the powerless section (see 5.18.3.2.1 for the 

--- Document Chunk 20087 ---
definition of point C). 

--- Document Chunk 20088 ---
5.20.3.3 When the min safe rear end of the train is in rear of the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20089 ---

--- Document Chunk 20090 ---
information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 20091 ---

--- Document Chunk 20092 ---
(point D) of the powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 20093 ---
 the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to the end location 

--- Document Chunk 20094 ---
(point E) of the powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 20095 ---
5.20.3.4 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20096 ---
powerless section, the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 20097 ---
point D shall no longer be generated. The remaining distance from the min safe front 

--- Document Chunk 20098 ---
end of the train to the end location (point E) of the powerless section shall continue to 

--- Document Chunk 20099 ---
be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20100 ---
5.20.3.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20101 ---
powerless section, the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 20102 ---
point E shall no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20103 ---
5.20.3.6 Note: The remaining distance from the t rain max safe front end to point D and the 

--- Document Chunk 20104 ---
remaining distance from the train min safe front end to point E are generated until the 

--- Document Chunk 20105 ---
min safe rear end passes respectively the point D and the point E to allow the 

--- Document Chunk 20106 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external function to manage the mai n power switch of each vehicle 

--- Document Chunk 20107 ---
individually assuming that this function knows the distance between each v ehicle and 

--- Document Chunk 20108 ---
the train front end.

5.20.4 Passing an “air tightness” area 

--- Document Chunk 20145 ---
5.20.4.1 This procedure is dealing with the generation of the information related to an air 

--- Document Chunk 20146 ---
tightness area. 

--- Document Chunk 20147 ---
5.20.4.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 20148 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches 

--- Document Chunk 20149 ---
the point C in rear of the start location of the air tightness area (see 5.18.6.2.1 for the 

--- Document Chunk 20150 ---
definition of point C). 

--- Document Chunk 20151 ---
5.20.4.3 When the max safe front end of the train is in rear of the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20152 ---
air tightness area , the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall provide the following 

--- Document Chunk 20153 ---
information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 20154 ---
 the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to the start location 

--- Document Chunk 20155 ---
(point D) of the air tightness area 

--- Document Chunk 20156 ---
 the remaining distanc e from the min safe rear end of the train to the end location 

--- Document Chunk 20157 ---
(point E) of the air tightness area 

--- Document Chunk 20158 ---
5.20.4.4 When the max safe front end of the train reaches the start location (point D) of the air 

--- Document Chunk 20159 ---
tightness area, the remaining distance from the max safe front end of  the train to point 

--- Document Chunk 20160 ---
D shall no longer be generated. The remaining distance from the min safe rear end of 

--- Document Chunk 20161 ---
the train to the end location (point E) of the air tightness area shall continue to be 

--- Document Chunk 20162 ---
generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20163 ---
5.20.4.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the e nd location (point E) of the air 

--- Document Chunk 20164 ---
tightness area, the remaining distance from the min safe rear end of the train to point 

--- Document Chunk 20165 ---
E shall no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20166 ---

5.20.5 Inhibition of a defined type of brake 

--- Document Chunk 20190 ---
5.20.5.1 This procedure is dealing with the generation of  the information related to the inhibition 

--- Document Chunk 20191 ---
of defined types of brake systems. 

--- Document Chunk 20192 ---
5.20.5.2 The procedure shows the case of the regenerative brake. Regarding eddy current 

--- Document Chunk 20193 ---
brake and magnetic shoe brake, the procedure is identical except that the generated 

--- Document Chunk 20194 ---
information refers to respectively eddy current brake or magnetic shoe brake. 

--- Document Chunk 20195 ---
5.20.5.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 20196 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches 

--- Document Chunk 20197 ---
the point C in rear of the s tart location of the regenerative brake inhibition area (see 

--- Document Chunk 20198 ---
5.18.7.3.2 for the definition of point C). 

--- Document Chunk 20199 ---

--- Document Chunk 20200 ---
regenerative brake inhibition area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board e quipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 20201 ---
provide the following information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 20202 ---
running direction 

--- Document Chunk 20203 ---
A 

--- Document Chunk 20204 ---

--- Document Chunk 20205 ---

--- Document Chunk 20207 ---
D E

and the remaining distance to point E

--- Document Chunk 20286 ---
system (point F), the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 20287 ---
point F and the identity of the new traction system shall no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20288 ---
5.20.6.5 Note: The remaining distance from the train max safe front end to point F is generated 

--- Document Chunk 20289 ---
until the min safe rear end passes the point F to allow the ERTMS/ETCS external 

--- Document Chunk 20290 ---
function, in c ase the change of traction system involves several pantographs, to 

--- Document Chunk 20291 ---
manage each pantograph individually assuming that this function knows the distance 

--- Document Chunk 20292 ---
between each pantograph and the train front end. 

--- Document Chunk 20293 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20294 ---
Figure 29: Generation of the information to an ERTMS/ETCS external function for a 

--- Document Chunk 20295 ---
supervision of change of traction system 

--- Document Chunk 20296 ---
5.20.6.6 If resuming the initial state (see 3.7.3.2) or any other reason (e.g. see Appendix A.3.4) 

--- Document Chunk 20297 ---
leads to the deletion of the change of tractio n system, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 20298 ---
equipment shall stop providing information related to this change of traction system to 

--- Document Chunk 20299 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function.

5.20.7 Changing the allowed current consumption 

--- Document Chunk 20320 ---
5.20.7.1 This procedure is dealing with the generation of the inform ation related to a change of 

--- Document Chunk 20321 ---
allowed current consumption. 

--- Document Chunk 20322 ---
5.20.7.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 20323 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches a 

--- Document Chunk 20324 ---
location (point C) in rear of t he location of change of allowed current consumption  

--- Document Chunk 20325 ---
(point F). 

--- Document Chunk 20326 ---
5.20.7.3 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 20327 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 20328 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 20329 ---
5.20.7.4 When the min safe rear end of the train is in rear of the location of change of allowed 

--- Document Chunk 20330 ---
current consumption (point F), the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall provide 

--- Document Chunk 20331 ---
the following information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 20332 ---
 the remaining distance from the m ax safe front end of the train to the location of 

--- Document Chunk 20333 ---
allowed current consumption (point F)  

--- Document Chunk 20334 ---
 the new allowed current consumption 

--- Document Chunk 20335 ---
5.20.7.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the location of change of allowed 

--- Document Chunk 20336 ---
current consumption (point F), the remaining dist ance from the max safe front end of 

--- Document Chunk 20337 ---
the train to point F and the new allowed current consumption shall no longer be 

--- Document Chunk 20338 ---
generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20339 ---
5.20.7.6 Note: The remaining distance from the train max safe front end to point F is generated 

--- Document Chunk 20340 ---
until the min safe rear end passes the poi nt F to allow the ERTMS/ETCS external 

--- Document Chunk 20341 ---
function, in case the change of allowed current consumption involves several 

--- Document Chunk 20342 ---
pantographs, to manage each pantograph individually assuming that this function 

--- Document Chunk 20343 ---
knows the distance between each pantograph and the train front end. 

--- Document Chunk 20344 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20345 ---
running direction 

--- Document Chunk 20346 ---
A 

--- Document Chunk 20347 ---
Distance to change of allowed current 

--- Document Chunk 20348 ---
consumption 

--- Document Chunk 20349 ---
