--- Document Chunk 20351 ---
and the new allowed current consumption

5.20.8 Station platform 

--- Document Chunk 20372 ---
5.20.8.1 This procedure is dealing with th e generation of the information related to a station 

--- Document Chunk 20373 ---
platform. 

--- Document Chunk 20374 ---
5.20.8.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 20375 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches a 

--- Document Chunk 20376 ---
location (point C) in rear of the start location of the station platform (point D). 

--- Document Chunk 20377 ---
5.20.8.3 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 20378 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 20379 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 20380 ---
5.20.8.4 When the min safe rear end of the train is in rear of the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20381 ---
station platform, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall provide the following 

--- Document Chunk 20382 ---
information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 20383 ---
 the remaining distance from the max safe front end  of the train to the start location 

--- Document Chunk 20384 ---
(point D) of the station platform 

--- Document Chunk 20385 ---
 the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to the end location 

--- Document Chunk 20386 ---
(point E) of the station platform 

--- Document Chunk 20387 ---
 the nominal height of platform above rail level (refer to TSI infrastructure) 

--- Document Chunk 20388 ---
 the position of the station platform (left side, right side, both sides) in reference to 

--- Document Chunk 20389 ---
the train orientation 

--- Document Chunk 20390 ---
5.20.8.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20391 ---
station platform, the remaining distance from the m ax safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 20392 ---
point D shall no longer be generated. The remaining distance from the min safe front 

--- Document Chunk 20393 ---
end of the train to the end location (point E) of the station platform as well as its 

--- Document Chunk 20394 ---
nominal height above the rail level and its position shall continue to be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20395 ---
5.20.8.6 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the 

--- Document Chunk 20396 ---
station platform, the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to point 

--- Document Chunk 20397 ---
E, the position of the station platform and its n ominal height above the rail level shall 

--- Document Chunk 20398 ---
no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 20399 ---
5.20.8.7 Note: The remaining distance from the train max safe front end to point D and the 

--- Document Chunk 20400 ---
remaining distance from the train min safe front end to point E are generated until the 

--- Document Chunk 20401 ---
min safe rear end pas ses respectively the point D and the point E to allow the 

--- Document Chunk 20402 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20403 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20404 ---

ERTMS/ETCS external function to manage each door individually assuming that this 

--- Document Chunk 20414 ---
function knows the distance between each door and the train front end.

--- Document Chunk 20586 ---
6.3 Scope 

--- Document Chunk 20587 ---
6.3.1.1 The chapter defines the composition of  envelope of legally operated system versions, 

--- Document Chunk 20588 ---
i.e. all the ERTMS/ETCS system versions that trackside shall be allowed to operate 

--- Document Chunk 20589 ---
and that on-board equipment shall support. 

--- Document Chunk 20590 ---
6.3.1.2 By default, all the clauses listed in the other SRS chapters are applicable regardless of 

--- Document Chunk 20591 ---
the system version operated (see SUBSET-104 § 6.1.3.2); this chapter includes the 

--- Document Chunk 20592 ---
exceptions to those clauses and the additional clauses, which apply when the system 

--- Document Chunk 20593 ---
version of some trackside constituents and/or the system version operated relates to a 

--- Document Chunk 20594 ---
version number older than the last one introduced. 

--- Document Chunk 20595 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20596 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20597 ---
SUBSET-026-6 

--- Document Chunk 20598 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 20599 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 20600 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 20601 ---
Chapter 6 : Management of older System Versions 

--- Document Chunk 20602 ---
Page 6/46

--- Document Chunk 20603 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20604 ---
6.4 Envelope of legally operated system versions 

--- Document Chunk 20605 ---
6.4.1 Incompatible versions 

--- Document Chunk 20606 ---
6.4.1.1 The system version number X, which a trackside infrastructure is allowed to operate 

--- Document Chunk 20607 ---
with, shall be one of the following: 1 or 2 

--- Document Chunk 20608 ---
6.4.2 Compatible versions 

--- Document Chunk 20609 ---
6.4.2.1 Within system version number X = 1, the system version number Y that a trackside 

--- Document Chunk 20610 ---
infrastructure is allowed to use shall be any of the following: 0 or 1 

--- Document Chunk 20611 ---
6.4.2.2 Within system version number X = 2, the system version number Y that a trackside 

--- Document Chunk 20612 ---
infrastructure is allowed to use shall be any of the following: 0 or 1 

--- Document Chunk 20613 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20614 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20615 ---
SUBSET-026-6

--- Document Chunk 20622 ---
6.5 Trackside requirements in relation to older system versions 

--- Document Chunk 20623 ---
6.5.1 Trackside areas operated with system version number X = 1 

--- Document Chunk 20624 ---
6.5.1.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 20625 ---
6.5.1.1.1 The section is applicable for trackside infrastructures that will be tendered and still 

--- Document Chunk 20626 ---
operated with the system version number X = 1, after the entry into force of this release 

--- Document Chunk 20627 ---
of the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 20628 ---
6.5.1.1.2 Within a trackside infrastructure operated with the system version number X = 1, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 20629 ---
be allowed to use the following values of M_VERSION: 1.0, and 1.1 

--- Document Chunk 20630 ---
6.5.1.1.3 Within a trackside area operated with an RBC certified to the system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 20631 ---
= 1, it shall also be allowed to use for balises the following values of M_VERSION: 2.0 

--- Document Chunk 20632 ---
and 2.1. 

--- Document Chunk 20633 ---
6.5.1.1.3.1 Note: this configuration is meaningful in case the trains operating on this RBC area 

--- Document Chunk 20634 ---
support the system version number X = 2 and the on-board requirements related to the 

--- Document Chunk 20635 ---
trackside information marked with 2.0 or 2.1 are applicable regardless of the operated 

--- Document Chunk 20636 ---
version (i.e. they are applied by the on-board equipment even if this latter operates with 

--- Document Chunk 20637 ---
the system version number X = 1 ordered by RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 20638 ---
6.5.1.2 Exceptions to chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 20639 ---
6.5.1.2.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 20640 ---
6.5.1.2.1.1 Section 3.6.2.4 shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 20641 ---
6.5.1.2.2 Clause 3.7.1.1 b) shall be replaced with: “When needed, limitations related to the 

--- Document Chunk 20642 ---
movement authority, i.e. Mode profile for On Sight or Shunting and signalling related 

--- Document Chunk 20643 ---
speed restriction (see sections 3.12.4 and 3.11.6). Mode profile and Signalling related 

--- Document Chunk 20644 ---
Speed restriction shall always be sent together with the MA to which the information 

--- Document Chunk 20645 ---
belongs” 

--- Document Chunk 20646 ---
6.5.1.2.3 In clause 3.7.1.1 c), the bullet “Optionally Speed restriction to ensure a given permitted 

--- Document Chunk 20647 ---
braking distance (see section 3.11. 11)” shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 20648 ---
6.5.1.2.4 In clause 3.7.2.4, the bullet “LX speed restrictions” shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 20649 ---
6.5.1.2.5 In clause 3.7.2.4, the bullet “Inhibition of revocable TSRs from balises in L2/3 (from 

--- Document Chunk 20650 ---
RBC only)” shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 20651 ---
6.5.1.2.6 Clause 3.9.3.2 shall be replaced with: “The orders shall be sent via balise groups.” 

--- Document Chunk 20652 ---
6.5.1.2.7 Clause 3.9.3.8.1 shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 20653 ---
6.5.1.2.8 Clause 3.11.3.2.2 c) shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 20654 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20655 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20656 ---
SUBSET-026-6 

--- Document Chunk 20657 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 20658 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 20659 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 20660 ---
Chapter 6 : Management of older System Versions 

--- Document Chunk 20661 ---
Page 8/46

--- Document Chunk 20662 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20663 ---
6.5.1.2.9 Clause 3.11.3.2.3.1 shall be replaced with: “If at least one other specific SSP is less 

--- Document Chunk 20664 ---
restrictive than any ”Cant Deficiency” SSP, it is the responsibility of the trackside 

--- Document Chunk 20665 ---
engineering to ensure that for all possible combinations of international train categories 

--- Document Chunk 20666 ---
a train might belong to, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment will not replace the 

--- Document Chunk 20667 ---
”Cant Deficiency” SSP as selected in 3.11.3.2.3 leading to an unsafe situation by 

--- Document Chunk 20668 ---
applying the requirement 3.11.3.2.6” 

--- Document Chunk 20669 ---

--- Document Chunk 21511 ---
Name Specific SSP category 

--- Document Chunk 21512 ---
Description It is the specific SSP category for which a differential value for the static line speed exists. 

--- Document Chunk 21513 ---

--- Document Chunk 21514 ---
go faster or lower than the “international basic static speed” given by V_STATIC. 

--- Document Chunk 21515 ---
Value 0 of NC_DIFF corresponds to the LSB of NC_TRAIN, value 14 of NC_DIFF to MSB (15-bit 

--- Document Chunk 21516 ---
variable) of NC_TRAIN.

6.5.1.5.34.1 Table 7.5.1.84 (NC_TRAIN) shall be replaced with: 

--- Document Chunk 21535 ---
Name International Train Category. 

--- Document Chunk 21536 ---
Description Train category to which the train belongs. 

--- Document Chunk 21537 ---
Thanks to NC_TRAIN, the train knows the “Specific” SSP category it must consider. 

--- Document Chunk 21538 ---
By receiving a list of static speed profile, thanks to NC_DIFF, the train can select the SSP it must obey. 

--- Document Chunk 21539 ---
Each bit represents one category. 

--- Document Chunk 21540 ---
A train can belong to various categories. 

--- Document Chunk 21541 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 21542 ---

6.5.1.5.36 Note: the packets listed above, which are not allowed for use in balise telegrams/loop 

--- Document Chunk 21613 ---
messages marked with system version number X = 1 or in messages from RBC/RIU 

--- Document Chunk 21614 ---
operating with system version number X = 1, may contain variables that have been 

--- Document Chunk 21615 ---
introduced in the system version number X = 2. These variables are not mentioned in 

--- Document Chunk 21616 ---
this section, since their use is implicitly forbidden by the fact that the packets using 

--- Document Chunk 21617 ---
them are not allowed.

General Format of Balise Telegram 

--- Document Chunk 21633 ---
Field No. VARIABLE Length ( bits) Remarks 

--- Document Chunk 21634 ---
1 Q_UPDOWN 1 Defines the direction of the information:  

--- Document Chunk 21635 ---
Down-link telegram (train to track) (0)  

--- Document Chunk 21636 ---
Up-link telegram (track to train) (1) 

--- Document Chunk 21637 ---
2 M_VERSION 7 Version of the ERTMS/ETCS system. 

--- Document Chunk 21638 ---
3 Q_MEDIA 1 Defines the type of media: Balise (0) 

--- Document Chunk 21639 ---
4  N_PIG 3 Position in the group. Defi nes the position of the balise in the 

--- Document Chunk 21640 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 21641 ---
5 N_TOTAL 3 Total number of balises in the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 21642 ---
6 M_DUP 2 Used to indicate whether the information of the balise is a 

--- Document Chunk 21643 ---
duplicate of the balise before or after this one. 

--- Document Chunk 21644 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21645 ---
7 M_MCOUNT 8 Message counter (M_MC OUNT) - 8 bits. To enable detection 

--- Document Chunk 21646 ---
of a change of balise group me ssage during passage of the 

--- Document Chunk 21647 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 21648 ---
8 NID_C 10 Country or region. 

--- Document Chunk 21649 ---
9 NID_BG 14 Identity of the balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 21650 ---
10 Q_LINK 1 Marks the balise group as  linked (Q_LINK = 1) or unlinked 

--- Document Chunk 21651 ---
(Q_LINK = 0) 

--- Document Chunk 21652 ---
 Packet 200 

--- Document Chunk 21653 ---
(optional) 

--- Document Chunk 21654 ---
29 Virtual Balise Cover marker 

--- Document Chunk 21655 ---
 Information Variable This information is composed according to the rules 

--- Document Chunk 21656 ---
applicable for packets. 

--- Document Chunk 21657 ---
 Packet 255 8 Finishing flag of the telegram 

--- Document Chunk 21658 ---

6.5.1.7 Additional requirements 

--- Document Chunk 21775 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 21781 ---
Chapter 6 : Management of older System Versions 

--- Document Chunk 21782 ---
Page 32/46

--- Document Chunk 21783 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21784 ---
6.5.1.7.1 Any balise telegram, which includes the packet 2, the packet 6, the packet 135, the 

--- Document Chunk 21785 ---
packet 145, the packet 200, the packet 203, the packet 206, the packet 207 or the 

--- Document Chunk 21786 ---
packet 239, shall be marked with the system version number 1.1. 

--- Document Chunk 21787 ---
6.5.1.7.2 An RBC that uses the packet 203, the packet 206, the packet 207 or the packet 239 

--- Document Chunk 21788 ---
shall transmit a system version number equal to 1.1, when negotiating the 

--- Document Chunk 21789 ---
establishment of the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 21790 ---
6.5.1.7.3 Any message transmitted by loop, which includes the packet 206, the packet 207 or the 

--- Document Chunk 21791 ---
packet 239, shall be marked with the system version number 1.1. 

--- Document Chunk 21792 ---
6.5.1.7.4 An RIU that uses the packet 206, the packet 207 or the packet 239 shall transmit a 

--- Document Chunk 21793 ---
system version number equal to 1.1, when negotiating the establishment of the 

--- Document Chunk 21794 ---
communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 21795 ---
6.5.1.7.5 A balise group or RBC message including the packet 203 shall also include the packet 

--- Document Chunk 21796 ---
3 (i.e. in a message, the packet 203 cannot be transmitted without the packet 3). 

--- Document Chunk 21797 ---
6.5.1.7.6 In the packet 70, the use of the value “00” of the variable Q_SUITABILITY shall be 

--- Document Chunk 21798 ---
forbidden. 

--- Document Chunk 21799 ---
6.5.2 Trackside areas operated with system version number X = 2 

--- Document Chunk 21800 ---
6.5.2.1 General 

--- Document Chunk 21801 ---
6.5.2.1.1 This section is applicable for trackside infrastructures that were operated with the 

--- Document Chunk 21802 ---
system version number X = 1, before the mi gration to the system version number X = 

--- Document Chunk 21803 ---
2. 

--- Document Chunk 21804 ---
6.5.2.1.1.1 This section is also applicable for trackside infrastructures with RBCs/RIUs certified to 

--- Document Chunk 21805 ---
the system version number X.Y = 2.0 or for trackside infrastructures with RBCs/RIUs 

--- Document Chunk 21806 ---
certified to the system version number X.Y = 2.1 where trains

--- Document Chunk 21807 ---
 are operated with on-

--- Document Chunk 21808 ---
board equipment whose highest supported system version number X.Y is only 2.0. 

--- Document Chunk 21809 ---
6.5.2.1.2 Within a trackside infrastructure operated with the system version number X = 2, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 21810 ---
be allowed to use the following values of M_VERSION: 1.0, 1.1, 2.0 and 2.1 

--- Document Chunk 21811 ---
6.5.2.2 Exceptions to chapter 3, 4, 5 

--- Document Chunk 21812 ---
6.5.2.2.1 For RBCs certified to the system version number 2.0 and for RBCs certified to the 

--- Document Chunk 21813 ---
system version number 2.1 handing over a train fitted with an on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 21814 ---
whose highest supported system version number X.Y is only 2.0, the bullet “The 

--- Document Chunk 21815 ---
system versions supported by the on-board equipment” in clause 3.15.1.2.1 b) shall not 

--- Document Chunk 21816 ---
apply. 

--- Document Chunk 21817 ---
6.5.2.3 Exceptions to chapter 7, 8 

--- Document Chunk 21818 ---
6.5.2.3.1 For the balise telegrams/loop messages marked with the system version number 1.0 or 

--- Document Chunk 21819 ---
1.1 and for messages transmitted by RIUs certified to the system version number 1.0 

--- Document Chunk 21820 ---
or 1.1, the exceptions listed in sections 6.5.1.5 and 6.5.1.6 shall apply by analogy. 

--- Document Chunk 21821 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21822 ---

--- Document Chunk 21895 ---
6.6 On-board requirements in relation to older system versions 

--- Document Chunk 21896 ---
6.6.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 21897 ---
6.6.1.1 This section covers the following situations: 

--- Document Chunk 21898 ---
a) Train is running on a trackside infrastructure operated with system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 21899 ---
= 1 

--- Document Chunk 21900 ---
b) Train is running on a trackside infrastructure operated with system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 21901 ---
= 2, but still transmitting some balise/loop/RIU information related to system version 

--- Document Chunk 21902 ---
number X = 1 (see section 6.5.2) 

--- Document Chunk 21903 ---
c) Train is running on a trackside infrastructure operated with system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 21904 ---
= 2, but on-board equipment has established a communication session with a 

--- Document Chunk 21905 ---
neighbouring RBC certified to system version number X = 1 

--- Document Chunk 21906 ---
d) Train is running on a trackside infrastructure operated with system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 21907 ---
= 1 or 2 and the on-board equipment has established a communication session with 

--- Document Chunk 21908 ---
a RBC/RIU certified to system version number X.Y = 2.0 

--- Document Chunk 21909 ---
6.6.2 Specific requirements for on-board  operating with system version number 

--- Document Chunk 21910 ---
X = 1 

--- Document Chunk 21911 ---
6.6.2.1 Exceptions to chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 21912 ---
6.6.2.1.1 Clause 3.12.3.4.7.2 shall be replaced with: “If the driver acknowledges before the end 

--- Document Chunk 21913 ---
condition is fulfilled, the on-board equipment shall consider the driver 

--- Document Chunk 21914 ---
acknowledgement as always ending the text display, regardless of the end condition 

--- Document Chunk 21915 ---
defined in 3.12.3.4.3.1”. 

--- Document Chunk 21916 ---
6.6.2.2 Exceptions to chapter 4 

--- Document Chunk 21917 ---
6.6.2.2.1 Clause 4.4.11.1.3 d) shall be replaced with: “balise groups giving the order ‘stop if in 

--- Document Chunk 21918 ---
SR’. This order shall immediately trip the train.” 

--- Document Chunk 21919 ---
6.6.2.2.2 Condition [54] in table 4.6.3 shall be replaced with: “(reception of information “stop if in 

--- Document Chunk 21920 ---
Staff Responsible”) AND (override is not active)”. 

--- Document Chunk 21921 ---
6.6.2.3 Exceptions to chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 21922 ---
6.6.2.3.1 Void 

--- Document Chunk 21923 ---
6.6.2.4 Exceptions to chapter 7, 8 

--- Document Chunk 21924 ---
6.6.2.4.1 Void 

--- Document Chunk 21925 ---
6.6.3 Handling of air gap data related to system version number X = 1 

--- Document Chunk 21926 ---
6.6.3.1 General 

--- Document Chunk 21927 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 21934 ---
Page 36/46

--- Document Chunk 21935 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21936 ---
6.6.3.1.1 For information received from trackside, the message consistency check shall be 

--- Document Chunk 21937 ---
achieved taking into account the exceptions to chapters 7 and 8, as described in 

--- Document Chunk 21938 ---
sections 6.5.1.5 and 6.5.1.6. 

--- Document Chunk 21939 ---
6.6.3.1.2 For information received from tra ckside, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 21940 ---
use the translation tables defined here below, in order to use the information as if it had 

--- Document Chunk 21941 ---
been elaborated in compliance with the current chapters 7 and 8. 

--- Document Chunk 21942 ---
6.6.3.2 Packets received from balise, loop, RIU, RBC 

--- Document Chunk 21943 ---
6.6.3.2.1 In the table below, the translation of information may depend on the on-board operated 

--- Document Chunk 21944 ---
system version at the time the information is received and accepted on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 21945 ---
6.6.3.2.2 When a level transition or an RBC/RBC handover is announced, the information stored 

--- Document Chunk 21946 ---
on-board in the transition buffer shall be translated according to system version 

--- Document Chunk 21947 ---
operated on-board at the time the information is released from the transition buffer (i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 21948 ---
the system version operated by the trackside infrastructure, towards which the train is 

--- Document Chunk 21949 ---
running). 

--- Document Chunk 21950 ---
6.6.3.2.3 Depending on the packet, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 21951 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 21952 ---
b) data is rejected, 

--- Document Chunk 21953 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 21954 ---
d) not relevant 

--- Document Chunk 21955 ---
R = Rejected T = Translated U = Unchanged NR = Not relevant

--- Document Chunk 22200 ---

--- Document Chunk 22202 ---
number X = 1.

--- Document Chunk 22204 ---

--- Document Chunk 22205 ---

--- Document Chunk 22207 ---

6.6.3.4 Messages transmitted to RBC/RIU 

--- Document Chunk 22256 ---

--- Document Chunk 22257 ---
an RIU certified to the system version number X = 1. 

--- Document Chunk 22258 ---

--- Document Chunk 22259 ---
versions is compatible with the one sent by trackside, it shall send a session 

--- Document Chunk 22260 ---
established report, including its telephone numbers, to the trackside.” 

--- Document Chunk 22261 ---
6.6.3.4.1.2 Clause 3.12.3.5.2 shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 22262 ---
6.6.3.4.2 Clause 3.18.4.5.4 shall be replaced with: “Only if valid Train Data is available: following 

--- Document Chunk 22263 ---
any entry/modification of the train runni ng number when a communication session is 

--- Document Chunk 22264 ---
already established or following the successful establishment of a communication 

--- Document Chunk 22265 ---
session when valid train running number is already available, the ERTMS/ETCS on-

--- Document Chunk 22266 ---
board equipment shall send the Train Data to the RBC.

6.6.3.4.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall elaborate the information to be 

--- Document Chunk 22280 ---
transmitted to the RBC/RIU certified to system version number X = 1, by applying the 

--- Document Chunk 22281 ---
following translation table to the corresponding information intended for an RBC/RIU 

--- Document Chunk 22282 ---
certified to the system version number X.Y = 2.1. 

--- Document Chunk 22283 ---
6.6.3.4.5 Depending on the transmitted message/packet, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 22284 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 22285 ---
b) data is deleted (i.e. it is not sent to the receiver) 

--- Document Chunk 22286 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 22287 ---
d) not relevant (i.e. no corresponding requirement to trigger the sending is applicable) 

--- Document Chunk 22288 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22289 ---
D = Deleted T = Translated U = Unchanged NR = Not relevant

--- Document Chunk 22744 ---
7.3 Components of ERTMS/ETCS Language 

--- Document Chunk 22745 ---
7.3.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 22746 ---
7.3.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS language is used in transmitting information over t he radio, balise 

--- Document Chunk 22747 ---
and loop airgaps. 

--- Document Chunk 22748 ---
7.3.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS language is based on variables, packets, messages and telegrams 

--- Document Chunk 22749 ---
(variables and packets are described in this section, while telegrams and messages 

--- Document Chunk 22750 ---
are described in chapter 8). 

--- Document Chunk 22751 ---
7.3.1.3 Note: A number of variables co ntain values which have to be assigned. Some of these 

--- Document Chunk 22752 ---
values have to be unique to ensure that the system functions properly. A centralised 

--- Document Chunk 22753 ---
handling of this assignment is therefore required (nationally or internationally, 

--- Document Chunk 22754 ---
depending on the variable). The var iables concerned have been marked. The values 

--- Document Chunk 22755 ---
included in this document for these variables are therefore not to be used without prior 

--- Document Chunk 22756 ---
verification of their validity. See SUBSET-054 for further details. 

--- Document Chunk 22757 ---
7.3.2 Definition of Variables 

--- Document Chunk 22758 ---
7.3.2.1 Variables are used to encode single data values. Variables cannot be split in minor 

--- Document Chunk 22759 ---
units. The whole variable has one type (meaning). 

--- Document Chunk 22760 ---
7.3.2.2 Variables may have special values which are related to the basic meaning of the 

--- Document Chunk 22761 ---
variable. 

--- Document Chunk 22762 ---
7.3.2.3 Special values have always the highest values in a variable (e.g. 32767 = “unknown”). 

--- Document Chunk 22763 ---
7.3.2.4 Spare values are located between the normal and special values in the variable range 

--- Document Chunk 22764 ---
7.3.2.5 Names of variables are unique. A variable is used in context with the meaning as 

--- Document Chunk 22765 ---
described in the variable definition. Variables with different me anings have different 

--- Document Chunk 22766 ---
names. 

--- Document Chunk 22767 ---
7.3.2.6 All variable definitions are independent of the transport media over which they are 

--- Document Chunk 22768 ---
used, if used in more than one media. 

--- Document Chunk 22769 ---
7.3.2.7 Signed values shall be encoded as 2’s complement. 

--- Document Chunk 22770 ---
7.3.2.8 One bit variables (Boolean) always use 0 for false and 1 for true. 

--- Document Chunk 22771 ---
7.3.2.9 Offsets for numerical values are avoided (0 is used for 0, 1 for 1, etc.) except where 

--- Document Chunk 22772 ---
justified. 

--- Document Chunk 22773 ---
7.3.2.10 When transmitting over the different transmission media, the most significant bit shall 

--- Document Chunk 22774 ---
be transmitted first. 

--- Document Chunk 22775 ---
7.3.2.11 All Variables have one of the following prefixes: 

--- Document Chunk 22776 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22777 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22778 ---
SUBSET-026-7 

--- Document Chunk 22779 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 22780 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 22781 ---
System Requirements Specification

Chapter 7

ERTMS/ETCS language

--- Document Chunk 22786 ---
A_ Acceleration 

--- Document Chunk 22787 ---
D_ distance 

--- Document Chunk 22788 ---
G_ Gradient 

--- Document Chunk 22789 ---
L_ length 

--- Document Chunk 22790 ---
M_ Miscellaneous 

--- Document Chunk 22791 ---
N_ Number 

--- Document Chunk 22792 ---
NC_ class number 

--- Document Chunk 22793 ---
NID_ identity number 

--- Document Chunk 22794 ---
Q_ Qualifier 

--- Document Chunk 22795 ---
T_ time/date 

--- Document Chunk 22796 ---
V_ Speed 

--- Document Chunk 22797 ---
X_ Text 

--- Document Chunk 22798 ---
7.3.3 Definition of Packets 

--- Document Chunk 22799 ---
7.3.3.1 Packets are multiple variables grouped into a sing le unit, with a defined internal 

--- Document Chunk 22800 ---
structure. 

--- Document Chunk 22801 ---
7.3.3.2 This structure consists of a packet header with: 

--- Document Chunk 22802 ---
 Track to Train: a unique packet number, the length of the packet in bits, the 

--- Document Chunk 22803 ---
orientation information, optionally the distance scale and an information section 

--- Document Chunk 22804 ---
containing a defined set of variables. The packet structure is as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 22805 ---
Number NID_PACKET Packet identifier 

--- Document Chunk 22806 ---
Direction Q_DIR Specifies the validity  direction 

--- Document Chunk 22807 ---
of transmitted data 

--- Document Chunk 22808 ---
Length L_PACKET  Number of bits in the packet 

--- Document Chunk 22809 ---
Scale Q_SCALE Specifies which distance scale 

--- Document Chunk 22810 ---
is used for all distance 

--- Document Chunk 22811 ---
information within the packet. 

--- Document Chunk 22812 ---
There is no Q_SCALE variable 

--- Document Chunk 22813 ---
in packets which do not contain 

--- Document Chunk 22814 ---
distance information. 

--- Document Chunk 22815 ---
Information ...... Well defined set(s) of variables. 

--- Document Chunk 22816 ---
 Train to Track: a unique packet number, the len gth of the packet in bits, optionally 

--- Document Chunk 22817 ---
the distance scale and an information section containing a defined set of variables. 

--- Document Chunk 22818 ---
The packet structure is as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 22819 ---
Number NID_PACKET Packet identifier 

--- Document Chunk 22820 ---
Length L_PACKET  Number of bits in the packet 

--- Document Chunk 22821 ---
Scale Q_SCALE Specifies which distance scale 

--- Document Chunk 22822 ---
is used for all distance 

--- Document Chunk 22823 ---
information within the packet. 

--- Document Chunk 22824 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22825 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22826 ---
SUBSET-026-7 

--- Document Chunk 22827 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 22828 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 22829 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 22830 ---
Chapter 7 

--- Document Chunk 22831 ---
ERTMS/ETCS language 

--- Document Chunk 22832 ---
Page 9/87 

--- Document Chunk 22833 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22834 ---
There is no Q_SCALE variable 

--- Document Chunk 22835 ---
in packets which do not contain 

--- Document Chunk 22836 ---
distance information. 

--- Document Chunk 22837 ---
Information ...... Well defined set(s) of variables. 

--- Document Chunk 22838 ---
7.3.3.3 The packet definition does not  change when transmitted over different transmission 

--- Document Chunk 22839 ---
media. 

--- Document Chunk 22840 ---
7.3.3.4 All currently not defined packet identifiers are reserved for future use  and shall be 

--- Document Chunk 22841 ---
considered as invalid values (i.e. like spare values)  when received by the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 22842 ---
equipment. Exception: reception of information only differing by Y with regards to the 

--- Document Chunk 22843 ---
highest system version number X supported by on-board (refer to section 3.17.3.11). 

--- Document Chunk 22844 ---
7.3.3.5 Exception: Packet 0 “Virtual Balise Cover marker” and Packet 255: “End of Telegram” 

--- Document Chunk 22845 ---
do not follow the above defined structure. 

--- Document Chunk 22846 ---
7.3.3.6 N_ITER specifies the number of iterations of a variable or group of variables which 

--- Document Chunk 22847 ---
follow. 

--- Document Chunk 22848 ---
7.3.3.7 If N_ITER is 0 then no variables follow. 

--- Document Chunk 22849 ---
7.3.3.8 Two nested levels of iterations can exist. 

--- Document Chunk 22850 ---
7.3.3.9 If, depending on the value of a previous qualifier variable in t he packet, a variable is 

--- Document Chunk 22851 ---
optional, it is written indented in the packet definition 

--- Document Chunk 22852 ---
7.3.3.10 Row “Transmitted by” in the description of a packet specifies which ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 22853 ---
trackside device (b alise, loop, RIU, RBC) can  transmit this packet.  “Any” means that 

--- Document Chunk 22854 ---
the packet can be transmitted by a balise, a loop, an RBC and a RIU. 

--- Document Chunk 22855 ---
7.3.3.10.1 Row “Transmitted to” in the description of a packet specifies to which ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 22856 ---
trackside device the packet can be transmitted. 

--- Document Chunk 22857 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22858 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22859 ---
SUBSET-026-7 

--- Document Chunk 22860 ---

7.4.2.39 Packet Number 255: End of Information 

--- Document Chunk 24161 ---
Description This packet consists only of NID_PACKET containing 8 bit 1s 

--- Document Chunk 24162 ---
It acts as a finish flag; the receiver will stop reading the remaining part of the 

--- Document Chunk 24163 ---
message/telegram when receiving eight bits set to one in the NID_PACKET 

--- Document Chunk 24164 ---
field. 

--- Document Chunk 24165 ---
Transmitted by Balise, Loop 

--- Document Chunk 24166 ---
Content Variable Length Comment 

--- Document Chunk 24167 ---

--- Document Chunk 24349 ---
7.5 Definitions of Variables 

--- Document Chunk 24350 ---
7.5.0.1 A_NVMAXREDADH1 

--- Document Chunk 24351 ---
Name Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (1) 

--- Document Chunk 24352 ---
Description Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains: 

--- Document Chunk 24353 ---
 With brake position “Passenger train in P”, and 

--- Document Chunk 24354 ---
 with special/additional brakes independent from wheel/rail adhesion. 

--- Document Chunk 24355 ---
This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 24356 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 24357 ---
6 bits 0 m/s2 3 m/s2 0.05 m/s2 

--- Document Chunk 24358 ---
Special/Reserved Values 61 No maximum deceleration, display target information in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 24359 ---
 62 No maximum deceleration, display time to Indication in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 24360 ---
 63 No maximum deceleration, no additional display 

--- Document Chunk 24361 ---
7.5.0.2 A_NVMAXREDADH2 

--- Document Chunk 24362 ---
Name Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (2) 

--- Document Chunk 24363 ---
Description Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains: 

--- Document Chunk 24364 ---
 with brake position “Passenger train in P”, and 

--- Document Chunk 24365 ---
 without special/additional brakes independent from wheel/rail adhesion. 

--- Document Chunk 24366 ---
This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 24367 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 24368 ---
6 bits 0 m/s2 3 m/s2 0.05 m/s2 

--- Document Chunk 24369 ---
Special/Reserved Values 61 No maximum deceleration, display target information in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 24370 ---
 62 No maximum deceleration, display time to Indication in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 24371 ---
 63 No maximum deceleration, no additional display 

--- Document Chunk 24372 ---
7.5.0.3 A_NVMAXREDADH3 

--- Document Chunk 24373 ---
Name Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (3) 

--- Document Chunk 24374 ---
Description Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains: 

--- Document Chunk 24375 ---
 with brake position “Freight train in P”, or 

--- Document Chunk 24376 ---
 with brake position “Freight train in G”. 

--- Document Chunk 24377 ---

7.5.1.62 M_AXLELOADCAT 

--- Document Chunk 24903 ---
Name Axle load category 

--- Document Chunk 24904 ---
Description The values allocated below correspond to a list of increasing axle load categories (i.e. B1 > HS17, B2 > 

--- Document Chunk 24905 ---
B1, D2 > C4, ….etc) and it is used by the on -board equipment to compare its axle load category with the 

--- Document Chunk 24906 ---
axle load category sent by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 24907 ---
For the underlying meaning of the axle load categories listed below (with the exception of HS17) refer to 

--- Document Chunk 24908 ---
CR INF TSI. 

--- Document Chunk 24909 ---
The category HS17 (axle load <= 17t) corresponds to a static load per axle only, as specified in HS RST 

--- Document Chunk 24910 ---
TSI clause 4.2. 3.2. The introduction of this artefact is necessary to ensure backward compatibility, 

--- Document Chunk 24911 ---
without any negative performance impact, in case ASPs are used on lines operated with system version 

--- Document Chunk 24912 ---
X = 1. 

--- Document Chunk 24913 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 24914 ---
7 bits    

--- Document Chunk 24915 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 A 

--- Document Chunk 24916 ---
 1 HS17 

--- Document Chunk 24917 ---

--- Document Chunk 24918 ---

--- Document Chunk 24919 ---
 4 C2 

--- Document Chunk 24920 ---

--- Document Chunk 24921 ---

--- Document Chunk 24922 ---

7.5.1.75.1 M_NVEBCL 

--- Document Chunk 25165 ---
Name Confidence level for emergency brake safe deceleration on dry rails 

--- Document Chunk 25166 ---
Description This variable is part of the National Values. 

--- Document Chunk 25167 ---
Based on the required confidence level, the on -board equipment selects its corresponding rolling stock 

--- Document Chunk 25168 ---
correction factor Kdry_rst(V). 

--- Document Chunk 25169 ---
The confidence level on emergency brake safe deceleration repre sents the probability of the following 

--- Document Chunk 25170 ---
individual event: the rolling stock emergency brake subsystem of the train does ensure a deceleration at 

--- Document Chunk 25171 ---
least equal to A_brake_emergency(V) * Kdry_rst(V), when the emergency brake is commanded on dry 

--- Document Chunk 25172 ---
rails. 

--- Document Chunk 25173 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25174 ---
4 bits    

--- Document Chunk 25175 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 Confidence level = 50 % 

--- Document Chunk 25176 ---
 1 Confidence level = 90 % 

--- Document Chunk 25177 ---
 2 Confidence level = 99 % 

--- Document Chunk 25178 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 25179 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 25180 ---
SUBSET-026-7 

--- Document Chunk 25181 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 25182 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 25183 ---
System Requirements Specification

7.5.1.75.2 M_NVKRINT 

--- Document Chunk 25197 ---
Name Integrated correction factor Kr 

--- Document Chunk 25198 ---
Description This is the train length dependent integrated correction factor. 

--- Document Chunk 25199 ---
M_NVKRINT(l) is valid for a train length between L_NVKRINT(l) and L_NVKRINT(l+1). 

--- Document Chunk 25200 ---
M_NVKRINT is valid between 0m and L_NVKRINT(1) 

--- Document Chunk 25201 ---
This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 25202 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25203 ---
5 bits 0 1.55 0.05 

--- Document Chunk 25204 ---
7.5.1.75.3 M_NVKTINT 

--- Document Chunk 25205 ---
Name Integrated correction factor Kt 

--- Document Chunk 25206 ---
Description This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 25207 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25208 ---
5 bits 0 1.55 0.05 

--- Document Chunk 25209 ---
7.5.1.75.4 M_NVKVINT 

--- Document Chunk 25210 ---
Name Integrated correction factor Kv 

--- Document Chunk 25211 ---
Description This is the speed dependent integrated correction factor. 

--- Document Chunk 25212 ---
M_NVKVINT(n) is valid for an estimated speed between V_NVKVINT(n) and V_NVKVINT(n+1). 

--- Document Chunk 25213 ---
M_NVKVINT is valid between 0 km/h and V_NVKVINT(1) 

--- Document Chunk 25214 ---
This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 25215 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25216 ---
7 bits 0 2.54 0.02 

--- Document Chunk 25217 ---

7.5.1.76 M_POSITION 

--- Document Chunk 25248 ---
Name Track kilometre reference value 

--- Document Chunk 25249 ---
Description The geographical position reporting function uses this variables content as a reference value.  

--- Document Chunk 25250 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25251 ---
24 bits 0 m 9’999’999  m 1 m 

--- Document Chunk 25252 ---
Special/Reserved Values 10’000’000-16’777’214 Spare 

--- Document Chunk 25253 ---
 16’777’215 No more geographical position calculation after this reference location  

--- Document Chunk 25254 ---
7.5.1.77 M_TRACKCOND 

--- Document Chunk 25255 ---
Name Type of track condition 

--- Document Chunk 25256 ---
Description  

--- Document Chunk 25257 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25258 ---
4 bits    

--- Document Chunk 25259 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0000 Non stopping area. Initial state: stopping permitted 

--- Document Chunk 25260 ---
 0001 Tunnel stopping area. Initial state: no tunnel stopping area 

--- Document Chunk 25261 ---
 0010 Sound horn. Initial state: no request for sound horn  

--- Document Chunk 25262 ---
 0011 Powerless section – lower pantograph. Initial state: not powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 25263 ---
 0100 Radio hole (stop supervising T_NVCONTACT). Initial state: supervise 

--- Document Chunk 25264 ---
T_NVCONTACT 

--- Document Chunk 25265 ---
 0101 Air tightness. Initial state: no request for air tightness 

--- Document Chunk 25266 ---
 0110 Switch off regenerative brake. Initial state: regenerative brake on 

--- Document Chunk 25267 ---
 0111 Switch off eddy current brake  for service brake . Initial state: eddy current 

--- Document Chunk 25268 ---
brake for service brake on 

--- Document Chunk 25269 ---
 1000 Switch off magnetic shoe brake. Initial state: magnetic shoe brake on 

--- Document Chunk 25270 ---
 1001 Powerless section – switch off the main power switch. Initial state: not 

--- Document Chunk 25271 ---
powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 25272 ---
 1010 Switch off eddy current brake for emergency brake. Initial state: eddy current 

--- Document Chunk 25273 ---
brake for emergency brake on 

--- Document Chunk 25274 ---
 1011 –1111 Spare 

--- Document Chunk 25275 ---
7.5.1.78 M_VOLTAGE 

--- Document Chunk 25276 ---
Name Traction System voltage 

--- Document Chunk 25277 ---
Description It indicates the voltage of the traction system installed on a specific line or respectively that can be used 

--- Document Chunk 25278 ---
by an engine 

--- Document Chunk 25279 ---
The identity of the traction system is given by M_VOLTAGE and, if M_VOLTAGE ≠ 0, by the country 

--- Document Chunk 25280 ---
identifier of the traction system (NID_CTRACTION)

7.5.1.79 M_VERSION 

--- Document Chunk 25301 ---
Name Version of ETCS system 

--- Document Chunk 25302 ---
Description This gives the version of the ETCS system 

--- Document Chunk 25303 ---
Each part indicates the first and second number of the version respectively. 

--- Document Chunk 25304 ---
- The first number distinguishes not compatible versions. (The three MSB’s) 

--- Document Chunk 25305 ---
- The second number indicates compatibility within a version X. (The four LSB’s) 

--- Document Chunk 25306 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25307 ---
7 bits     

--- Document Chunk 25308 ---
Special/Reserved Values 000 XXXX Previous versions according to e.g. EEIG SRS, UIC A200 SRS 

--- Document Chunk 25309 ---
 001 0000 Version 1.0, introduced in SRS 1.2.0 

--- Document Chunk 25310 ---
 001 0001 Version 1.1, introduced in SRS 3.3.0 

--- Document Chunk 25311 ---
 001 0010 Not valid 

--- Document Chunk 25312 ---
 ….  

--- Document Chunk 25313 ---
 001 1111 Not valid 

--- Document Chunk 25314 ---
 010 0000 Version 2.0, introduced in SRS 3.3.0 

--- Document Chunk 25315 ---
 010 0001 Version 2.1, introduced in SRS 3.5.0 

--- Document Chunk 25316 ---
 010 0010 Reserved for future use (this is a valid value) 

--- Document Chunk 25317 ---
 … … 

--- Document Chunk 25318 ---
 111 1111 Reserved for future use (this is a valid value) 

--- Document Chunk 25319 ---

equipment is fitted

--- Document Chunk 25327 ---
Name Number of iterations of a data set following this variable in a packet 

--- Document Chunk 25328 ---

--- Document Chunk 25330 ---

7.5.1.82.1 NC_CDDIFF 

--- Document Chunk 25358 ---
Name Cant Deficiency SSP category 

--- Document Chunk 25359 ---
Description It is the “Cant Deficiency” SSP category for which a different value for the static line speed exists. 

--- Document Chunk 25360 ---
Used together with V_DIFF to permit certain trains to g o faster or lower than  the “international basic 

--- Document Chunk 25361 ---
static speed” given by V_STATIC.  

--- Document Chunk 25362 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25363 ---
4 bits 0 15  

--- Document Chunk 25364 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 80 mm 

--- Document Chunk 25365 ---
 1 Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 100 mm 

--- Document Chunk 25366 ---

--- Document Chunk 25367 ---

7.5.1.82.2 NC_CDTRAIN 

--- Document Chunk 25377 ---
Name Cant Deficiency Train Category 

--- Document Chunk 25378 ---
Description Cant Deficiency Train category to which the train belongs. 

--- Document Chunk 25379 ---
Thanks to NC_CDTRAIN, the train knows the “Cant Deficiency” SSP it must obey. By receiving a list of 

--- Document Chunk 25380 ---
static speed profile, thanks to NC_CDDIFF, the train can select the “Cant Deficiency” SSP best suiting 

--- Document Chunk 25381 ---
its NC_CDTRAIN. 

--- Document Chunk 25382 ---
A train belongs to one and only one category of Cant Deficiency.  

--- Document Chunk 25383 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

7.5.1.83 NC_DIFF 

--- Document Chunk 25408 ---
Name Other specific SSP category 

--- Document Chunk 25409 ---
Description It is the “other specific” SSP category for which a different value for the static line speed exists. 

--- Document Chunk 25410 ---
Used together with V_DIFF to permit trains belonging to the corresponding “other international” train 

--- Document Chunk 25411 ---
category to go faster or lower than the “international basic static speed” given by V_STATIC.  

--- Document Chunk 25412 ---
Value 0 of NC_DIFF corresponds to the LSB of NC_TRAIN, value 14 of NC_DIFF to MSB (15 -bit 

--- Document Chunk 25413 ---
variable) of NC_TRAIN. 

--- Document Chunk 25414 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25415 ---
4 bits 0 15 Numbers 

--- Document Chunk 25416 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 Specific SSP applicable to Freight train braked in “P” position 

--- Document Chunk 25417 ---
 1 Specific SSP applicable to Freight train braked in “G” position 

--- Document Chunk 25418 ---
 2 Specific SSP applicable to Passenger train 

--- Document Chunk 25419 ---
 3-15 Spare 

--- Document Chunk 25420 ---
7.5.1.84 NC_TRAIN 

--- Document Chunk 25421 ---
Name Other International Train Category.  

--- Document Chunk 25422 ---
Description Other train category (different from Cant Deficiency) to which the train belongs. 

--- Document Chunk 25423 ---
Thanks to NC_TRAIN, the train knows the “Other specific” SSP category it must consider. 

--- Document Chunk 25424 ---
By receiving a list of static speed profile, thanks to NC_DIFF, the train can select the SSP it must obey. 

--- Document Chunk 25425 ---
Each bit represents one category. 

--- Document Chunk 25426 ---
A train can belong to various categories.  

--- Document Chunk 25427 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25428 ---
15 bits   Bitset 

--- Document Chunk 25429 ---
Special/Reserved Values 000 0000 0000 0000 Train does not belong to any of the “Other International” Train Category  

--- Document Chunk 25430 ---
 Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx1 Freight train braked in “P” position 

--- Document Chunk 25431 ---
 Xxx xxxx xxxx xx1x Freight train braked in “G” position 

--- Document Chunk 25432 ---
 Xxx xxxx xxxx x1xx Passenger train 

--- Document Chunk 25433 ---
 Xxx xxxx xxx 1xxx Spare 

--- Document Chunk 25434 ---
 Xxx xxxx xxx1 xxxx Spare 

--- Document Chunk 25435 ---

7.5.1.86 NID_C (Values to be assigned according to 7.3.1.3) 

--- Document Chunk 25462 ---
Name Identity number of the country or region 

--- Document Chunk 25463 ---
Description Code used to identify the country or region in which the balise group, the RBC or the RIU is situated. 

--- Document Chunk 25464 ---
These need not necessarily follow administrative or political boundaries. 

--- Document Chunk 25465 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25466 ---
10 bits 0 1023 Numbers 

--- Document Chunk 25467 ---

7.5.1.91.1 NID_MN (Values to be assigned according to 7.3.1.3) 

--- Document Chunk 25525 ---
Name Identity of Radio Network  

--- Document Chunk 25526 ---
Description The NID_MN identifies the GSM-R network the calling mobile station has to register with. The NID_MN 

--- Document Chunk 25527 ---
consists of up to 6 digits which are entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit 

--- Document Chunk 25528 ---
to be dialled first. In case the NID_MN is shorter than 6  digits, the remaining space is to be filled with 

--- Document Chunk 25529 ---
special character “F”. For further information about NID_MN refer to Subset-54. 

--- Document Chunk 25530 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25531 ---
24 bits 0 999999   Binary Coded Decimal 

--- Document Chunk 25532 ---
Special/Reserved Values For each digit ; 

--- Document Chunk 25533 ---
 Values A – E Not Used 

--- Document Chunk 25534 ---
 F Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 6 digits) 

--- Document Chunk 25535 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 25536 ---

7.5.1.92 NID_OPERATIONAL 

--- Document Chunk 25546 ---
Name Train Running Number 

--- Document Chunk 25547 ---
Description This is the operational train running number. The NID_OPERATIONAL consi sts of up to 8 digits which 

--- Document Chunk 25548 ---
are entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit to be entered first. In case the 

--- Document Chunk 25549 ---
NID_OPERATIONAL is shorter than 8 digits, the remaining space is to be filled with special character 

--- Document Chunk 25550 ---
“F”. 

--- Document Chunk 25551 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25552 ---
32 bits 0 9999 9999 Binary Coded Decimal 

--- Document Chunk 25553 ---
Special/Reserved Values For each digit ;  

--- Document Chunk 25554 ---
 Values A – E Spare 

--- Document Chunk 25555 ---
 F Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 8 digits) 

--- Document Chunk 25556 ---
 FFFF FFFF Spare 

--- Document Chunk 25557 ---
7.5.1.93 NID_PACKET 

--- Document Chunk 25558 ---
Name Packet identifier 

--- Document Chunk 25559 ---
Description This is used in the header for each packet, allowing the receiving equipment to identify the data which 

--- Document Chunk 25560 ---
follows. Regards defined values of NID_PACKET,.refer to “packet numbers” in the tables in chapter 

--- Document Chunk 25561 ---
7.4.1. 

--- Document Chunk 25562 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25563 ---
8 bits 0 255 Numbers 

--- Document Chunk 25564 ---
7.5.1.94 NID_PRVLRBG 

--- Document Chunk 25565 ---
Name Identity of previous LRBG  

--- Document Chunk 25566 ---
Description Previous LRBG detected when running towards the balise group identified as LRBG with no change of 

--- Document Chunk 25567 ---
direction in-between. 

--- Document Chunk 25568 ---
Country/region identity (NID_C) + balise identity number of the previous LRBG (NID_BG). 

--- Document Chunk 25569 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25570 ---
10 + 14 bits    

--- Document Chunk 25571 ---
Special/Reserved Values 16777215 unknown 

--- Document Chunk 25572 ---
7.5.1.95 NID_RADIO (Values to be assigned according to 7.3.1.3) 

--- Document Chunk 25573 ---
Name Radio subscriber number. 

--- Document Chunk 25574 ---
Description Quoted as a 16 digit decimal number.  

--- Document Chunk 25575 ---
The number is to be entered “left adjusted ” starting with the first digit to be dialled. Padding by the 

--- Document Chunk 25576 ---
special value F shall be added after the least significant digit of the number.  

--- Document Chunk 25577 ---
 For further information about NID_RADIO  refer to SUBSET-054. 

--- Document Chunk 25578 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 25579 ---
64 bits 0 9999 9999 9999 9999 Binary Coded Decimal 

--- Document Chunk 25580 ---
Special/Reserved Values For each digit ; 

--- Document Chunk 25581 ---
 Values A – E Not Used 

--- Document Chunk 25582 ---
 F Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 16 digits) 

--- Document Chunk 25583 ---
 FFFF FFFF FFFF FFFF Use the short number stored onboard 

--- Document Chunk 25584 ---

--- Document Chunk 26881 ---
8.3 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 26882 ---
8.3.1 Scope and Purpose 

--- Document Chunk 26883 ---
8.3.1.1 This chapter defines the format and content of messages necessary for ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 26884 ---
functions. 

--- Document Chunk 26885 ---
8.3.1.2 Concerning the transmission media, this chapter does not cover considerations such 

--- Document Chunk 26886 ---
as medium-specific use constraints (e .g. distance between track -circuit and balise…), 

--- Document Chunk 26887 ---
as well as functions (e .g. detection of balise reference, time and location stamp, 

--- Document Chunk 26888 ---
identifying type of receiving balise, Key Management, Releasing/maintaining a radio 

--- Document Chunk 26889 ---
connection…) and performance of the transmission media. 

--- Document Chunk 26890 ---
8.3.2 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 26891 ---
8.3.2.1 Transmission media considered hereafter are standard ERTMS/ETCS transmission 

--- Document Chunk 26892 ---
media used for ETCS (Eurobalise, Euroradio and Euroloop). 

--- Document Chunk 26893 ---
8.3.2.2 A message includes user data (application level) and protocol data (depending on the 

--- Document Chunk 26894 ---
transmission medium). 

--- Document Chunk 26895 ---
8.3.2.3 A Eurobalise mes sage is the information sent by a balise group (i.e. the message is 

--- Document Chunk 26896 ---
composed of one or several telegrams, sorted by balise number in the group (telegram 

--- Document Chunk 26897 ---
from balise number 1 first), ea ch telegram is transmitted by a Eurobalise). A 

--- Document Chunk 26898 ---
Eurobalise telegram conta ins one header and an identified and coherent set of 

--- Document Chunk 26899 ---
Packets. 

--- Document Chunk 26900 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26901 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 26902 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26903 ---
SUBSET-026-8 

--- Document Chunk 26904 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 26905 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 26906 ---

--- Document Chunk 26907 ---
Chapter 8 

--- Document Chunk 26908 ---
Messages 

--- Document Chunk 26909 ---
Page 8/33 

--- Document Chunk 26910 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26911 ---
  

--- Document Chunk 26912 ---
Reverse direction   Nominal direction 

--- Document Chunk 26913 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26914 ---

--- Document Chunk 26915 ---

--- Document Chunk 26916 ---
nominal direction: 

--- Document Chunk 26917 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 26918 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 26919 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 26920 ---
Balise telegrams read: 

--- Document Chunk 26921 ---

--- Document Chunk 26922 ---
3rd 2nd 1st 

--- Document Chunk 26923 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 26924 ---

--- Document Chunk 26925 ---

--- Document Chunk 26926 ---

--- Document Chunk 26927 ---
reverse direction:

--- Document Chunk 26930 ---

--- Document Chunk 26932 ---
variables (if needed) and Packets. 

--- Document Chunk 26933 ---
8.3.2.5 A Euroloop message contains one header and an identified and coherent set of 

--- Document Chunk 26934 ---
Packets.

ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 26945 ---
8.4 Rules 

--- Document Chunk 26946 ---
8.4.1 Common Rules 

--- Document Chunk 26947 ---
8.4.1.1 A message (Euroradio/Euroloop) or telegram (Eurobalise) is composed of 

--- Document Chunk 26948 ---
1. One Header, 

--- Document Chunk 26949 ---
2. When needed, a predefined set of variables (only for Radio), 

--- Document Chunk 26950 ---
3. When needed, a predefined set of Packets (only for Radio), 

--- Document Chunk 26951 ---
4. Optional Packets as needed by application. 

--- Document Chunk 26952 ---
8.4.1.2 The transmission order shall respect the order of data elements listed in the message 

--- Document Chunk 26953 ---
format (from top to bottom). 

--- Document Chunk 26954 ---
8.4.1.3 The behaviour of the receiv er shall not depend on the sequence of the Packets given 

--- Document Chunk 26955 ---
by the message. 

--- Document Chunk 26956 ---
8.4.1.3.1 Exception for Infill information: The locations given in the packets following packet 136 

--- Document Chunk 26957 ---
(Infill Location Reference) shall be referred to the balise group indicated in such 

--- Document Chunk 26958 ---
packet. 

--- Document Chunk 26959 ---
8.4.1.3.2 Note: orientations are in any case always referred to the directionality of balise group 

--- Document Chunk 26960 ---
(balise transmission), directionality of loop (Euroloop transmission) or directionality of 

--- Document Chunk 26961 ---
LRBG (radio transmission). 

--- Document Chunk 26962 ---
8.4.1.4 A track-to-train message shall contain at most one  instance of the same packet type 

--- Document Chunk 26963 ---
for the same direction. 

--- Document Chunk 26964 ---
8.4.1.4.1 Exception 1: A message can contain several packets 44 (Data used by applications 

--- Document Chunk 26965 ---
outside the ERTMS/ETCS system). 

--- Document Chunk 26966 ---
8.4.1.4.2 Exception 2: A message can contain several packets 65 (Temporary Speed 

--- Document Chunk 26967 ---
Restriction). In case of  revocable TSRs, the identities of the corresponding temporary 

--- Document Chunk 26968 ---
speed restrictions (variable NID_TSR) transmitted in the same message shall be 

--- Document Chunk 26969 ---
different. 

--- Document Chunk 26970 ---
8.4.1.4.3 Exception 3: A message can contain several packets 66 (TSR Revocation). The 

--- Document Chunk 26971 ---
identities of the  corresponding temporary speed restrictions (variable NID_TSR) 

--- Document Chunk 26972 ---
transmitted in the same message shall be different. 

--- Document Chunk 26973 ---
8.4.1.4.4 Exception 4: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain one packet 136 per 

--- Document Chunk 26974 ---
balise telegram per direction. Each packet 136 indicates which part of that telegram is 

--- Document Chunk 26975 ---
to be considered as part of the infill information. Multiple packets 136 in balises of a 

--- Document Chunk 26976 ---
balise group shall have identical content per direction. 

--- Document Chunk 26977 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 26978 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26979 ---
SUBSET-026-8 

--- Document Chunk 26980 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 26981 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 26982 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 26983 ---
Chapter 8 

--- Document Chunk 26984 ---
Messages 

--- Document Chunk 26985 ---
Page 10/33 

--- Document Chunk 26986 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26987 ---
8.4.1.4.5 Exception 5: A message can contain several packets 88 (Level Crossing informati on). 

--- Document Chunk 26988 ---
The identities of the corresponding Level Crossings (variable NID_LX) transmitted in 

--- Document Chunk 26989 ---
the same message shall be different. 

--- Document Chunk 26990 ---
8.4.1.4.6 Exception 6: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 254 

--- Document Chunk 26991 ---
(default balise, loop or RIU information). 

--- Document Chunk 26992 ---
8.4.1.4.7 Exception 7: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 145 

--- Document Chunk 26993 ---
(Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction). 

--- Document Chunk 26994 ---
8.4.1.4.8 Exception 8: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 0 

--- Document Chunk 26995 ---
(Virtual Balise Cover marker). 

--- Document Chunk 26996 ---
8.4.1.4.9 Exception 9: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 6 

--- Document Chunk 26997 ---
(Virtual Balise Cover order). The identities (pairs of variables NID_VBCMK and NID_C) 

--- Document Chunk 26998 ---
of the corresponding VBC transmitted in the same message shall be different. 

--- Document Chunk 26999 ---
8.4.1.5 A train-to-track message shall contain at most one instance of the same packet type. 

--- Document Chunk 27000 ---
8.4.1.5.1 Exception: A message can contain several packets 44 (Data used by applications 

--- Document Chunk 27001 ---
outside the ERTMS/ETCS system). 

--- Document Chunk 27002 ---
8.4.1.6 Note: For the purposes of clause 8.4.1.4, when the same packet is tra nsmitted by 

--- Document Chunk 27003 ---
duplicated balises, this is considered to be only a single instance of the packet within 

--- Document Chunk 27004 ---
the message. Justification: The on -board equipment will only use one of these 

--- Document Chunk 27005 ---
duplicated telegrams (and therefore only one set of duplicated packets) to co mpose 

--- Document Chunk 27006 ---
the balise group message (see 3.16.2.4.8.2). 

--- Document Chunk 27007 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 27008 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27009 ---
SUBSET-026-8 

--- Document Chunk 27010 ---
3.6.0 

--- Document Chunk 27011 ---
13/05/2016 

--- Document Chunk 27012 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 27013 ---
Chapter 8 

--- Document Chunk 27014 ---
Messages 

--- Document Chunk 27015 ---
Page 11/33 

--- Document Chunk 27016 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27017 ---
8.4.2 Rules for Eurobalise telegrams 

--- Document Chunk 27018 ---
8.4.2.1 The format of the telegram to be transmitted by each balise is as follows:  

--- Document Chunk 27019 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27020 ---
General Format of Balise Telegram 

--- Document Chunk 27021 ---
Field No. VARIABLE Length ( bits) Remarks 

--- Document Chunk 27022 ---
1 Q_UPDOWN 1 Defines the direction of the information:  

--- Document Chunk 27023 ---
Down-link telegram (train to track) (0)  

--- Document Chunk 27024 ---
Up-link telegram (track to train) (1) 

--- Document Chunk 27025 ---
2 M_VERSION 7 Version of the ERTMS/ETCS system. 

--- Document Chunk 27026 ---
3 Q_MEDIA 1 Defines the type of media: Balise (0) 

--- Document Chunk 27027 ---
4  N_PIG 3 Position in the group. Defines the position of the balise in the 

--- Document Chunk 27028 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 27029 ---
5 N_TOTAL 3 Total number of balises in the balise group  

--- Document Chunk 27030 ---
6 M_DUP 2 Used to indicate whether the information of the balise is a 

--- Document Chunk 27031 ---
duplicate of the balise before or after this one.  

--- Document Chunk 27032 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27033 ---
7 M_MCOUNT 8 Message counter (M_MCOUNT) - 8 bits. To enable detection 

--- Document Chunk 27034 ---
of a change of balise group message during passage of the 

--- Document Chunk 27035 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 27036 ---
8 NID_C 10 Country or region. 

--- Document Chunk 27037 ---
9 NID_BG 14 Identity of the balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 27038 ---
10 Q_LINK 1 Marks the balise group as linked (Q_LINK = 1) or un linked 

--- Document Chunk 27039 ---
(Q_LINK = 0) 

--- Document Chunk 27040 ---
 Packet 0 

--- Document Chunk 27041 ---
(optional) 

--- Document Chunk 27042 ---
14 Virtual Balise Cover marker 

--- Document Chunk 27043 ---
 Information Variable This information is composed according to the rules 

--- Document Chunk 27044 ---
applicable for packets. 

--- Document Chunk 27045 ---
 Packet 255 8 Finishing flag of the telegram 

--- Document Chunk 27046 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27047 ---
Number of bits in balise header: 50 

--- Document Chunk 27048 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27049 ---
8.4.2.2 The user information transmitted by a balise shall contain complete packets, i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 27050 ---
splitting a packet between two balises is forbidden. 

--- Document Chunk 27051 ---
8.4.2.3 When used, the packet 0 shall be transmitted as the first packet of the telegram (i.e. it 

--- Document Chunk 27052 ---
is appended to the header). 

--- Document Chunk 27053 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 27054 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27055 ---

8.4.4 Rules for Euroradio messages 

--- Document Chunk 27095 ---
8.4.4.1 The message identifier is unique (variable NID_MESSAGE). 

--- Document Chunk 27096 ---
8.4.4.1.1 All currently not defined message identifiers are reserved for future use and shall be 

--- Document Chunk 27097 ---
considered as invalid values (i.e. like spare values)  when received by the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 27098 ---
equipment. Exception: reception of information only differing by Y with regar ds to the 

--- Document Chunk 27099 ---
highest system version number X supported by on -board (refer to section 3.17.3.11 

--- Document Chunk 27100 ---
b)). 

--- Document Chunk 27101 ---
8.4.4.2 Each message shall indicate its own  length through the use of the  variable 

--- Document Chunk 27102 ---
L_MESSAGE. 

--- Document Chunk 27103 ---
8.4.4.2.1 If the computed length of the message is not equal to the length given by  

--- Document Chunk 27104 ---
L_MESSAGE, the entire message shall be rejected. 

--- Document Chunk 27105 ---
8.4.4.3 The messages shall be composed of predefined variables and packets. 

--- Document Chunk 27106 ---
8.4.4.4 For some messages, it shall be possible to add optional packets at the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 27107 ---
message. 

--- Document Chunk 27108 ---
8.4.4.4.1 The track to train messages possibly including optional packets are listed hereafter: 

--- Document Chunk 27109 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27110 ---
Track to Train message Mess. ID Optional packets 

--- Document Chunk 27111 ---

--- Document Chunk 27112 ---
Movement Authority 3 21, 27, 49, 80, plus common optional packets 

--- Document Chunk 27113 ---
Request To Shorten MA 9 49, 80 

--- Document Chunk 27114 ---
General Message 24 From RBC: 21, 27, plus co mmon optional 

--- Document Chunk 27115 ---
packets 

--- Document Chunk 27116 ---
From RIU: 44, 45, 143, 180, 254 

--- Document Chunk 27117 ---
SH authorised 28 3, 44, 49 

--- Document Chunk 27118 ---
MA with Shifted Location Reference 33 21, 27, 49, 80, plus common optional packets 

--- Document Chunk 27119 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27120 ---
Infill MA 37 5, 21, 27, 39, 40, 41, 44, 49, 51, 52, 65, 66, 68, 

--- Document Chunk 27121 ---
69, 70, 71, 80, 88, 138, 139

the message.

--- Document Chunk 27162 ---

--- Document Chunk 27163 ---

--- Document Chunk 27165 ---
No.

--- Document Chunk 27168 ---

--- Document Chunk 27169 ---
inclusive). 

--- Document Chunk 27170 ---

--- Document Chunk 27171 ---

--- Document Chunk 27172 ---
by the on-board equipment (message n° 146). 

--- Document Chunk 27173 ---

--- Document Chunk 27174 ---
… variables as

--- Document Chunk 27180 ---
required by

--- Document Chunk 27188 ---

--- Document Chunk 27189 ---

--- Document Chunk 27190 ---
session) shall include the variable M_ACK set to 0. Justification: see 3.5.5.3.

--- Document Chunk 27204 ---
Field 

--- Document Chunk 27205 ---
No. 

--- Document Chunk 27206 ---

--- Document Chunk 27213 ---

--- Document Chunk 27214 ---
NID_MESSAGE 

--- Document Chunk 27215 ---
If needed for this message. Used when sending variables which 

--- Document Chunk 27216 ---
are not included in a packet. 

--- Document Chunk 27217 ---
6  Packet 0 or 1 Train-to-track packet type 0 – Position report, or packet type 1 - 

--- Document Chunk 27218 ---
Position report based on two balise groups. Not included in 

--- Document Chunk 27219 ---
messages 146, 154, 155, 156 and 159. 

--- Document Chunk 27220 ---
7  Other Packets as 

--- Document Chunk 27221 ---
required by 

--- Document Chunk 27222 ---
NID_MESSAGE 

--- Document Chunk 27223 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27224 ---
8  Optional packets  

--- Document Chunk 27225 ---
 Padding If required. 

--- Document Chunk 27226 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27227 ---
8.4.4.7.2 Exception:  The position report (packet 0 or packet 1) is not included in the following 

--- Document Chunk 27228 ---
messages: 

--- Document Chunk 27229 ---
a) Message 146 (Acknowledgement), 

--- Document Chunk 27230 ---
b) Message 154 (No compatible version supported), 

--- Document Chunk 27231 ---
c) Message 155 (Initiation of a communication session), 

--- Document Chunk 27232 ---
d) Message 156 (Termination of a communication session), 

--- Document Chunk 27233 ---
e) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 27234 ---
f) Message 159 (Session Established). 

--- Document Chunk 27235 ---
8.4.4.7.3 Note: In section 8.6 giving th e contents of the messages, the padding information is 

--- Document Chunk 27236 ---
intentionally omitted. 

--- Document Chunk 27237 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27238 ---

--- Document Chunk 27249 ---
8.5 List of radio Messages 

--- Document Chunk 27250 ---
8.5.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 27251 ---
8.5.1.1 This section identifies the radio messages with corresponding Message Identifier 

--- Document Chunk 27252 ---
(“Mes. Id.”) and Message Name. It also gives a list of the version-invariant messages. 

--- Document Chunk 27253 ---
8.5.1.2 “Type” defines whether a message is to be sent as normal priority (N) or as high 

--- Document Chunk 27254 ---
priority data (E), as defined in Euroradio specifications. 

--- Document Chunk 27255 ---
8.5.2 Train to Track radio messages 

--- Document Chunk 27256 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27257 ---
Mes. Id. Message Name Type Invariant Transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 27258 ---

--- Document Chunk 28063 ---
9.3 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 28064 ---
9.3.1 Scope and Purpose 

--- Document Chunk 28065 ---
9.3.1.1 Chapter 9 lists a classification into categories of all the clauses in the chapters 1 to 8 of 

--- Document Chunk 28066 ---
the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 28067 ---
9.3.1.2 The purpose of this chapter is to ease the assessment of the compliance of an 

--- Document Chunk 28068 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment with the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 28069 ---
9.3.1.3 To that effect , this chapter comprehensively identifies which clauses contain 

--- Document Chunk 28070 ---
requirements allocated to the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment and conversely 

--- Document Chunk 28071 ---
which ones do not, either because they contain requirements allocated to the 

--- Document Chunk 28072 ---
ERTMS/ETCS trackside only or because they are of another type. 

--- Document Chunk 28073 ---
9.3.2 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 28074 ---
9.3.2.1 The following categories are used to classify each SRS clause: 

--- Document Chunk 28075 ---
a) ERTMS/ETCS on -board requirement : a c lause containing requirement(s) that 

--- Document Chunk 28076 ---
must be fulfilled by a SRS compliant ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 28077 ---
b) ERTMS/ETCS trackside requirement: a c lause containing requirement(s) that 

--- Document Chunk 28078 ---
must be fulfilled by a SRS compliant ERTMS/ETCS trackside, in case the 

--- Document Chunk 28079 ---
corresponding function is implemented 

--- Document Chunk 28080 ---
c) Definition: a c lause that is a necessary prerequisite to the correct interpretation of 

--- Document Chunk 28081 ---
requirement(s) or without which requirement(s) cannot be unambiguously 

--- Document Chunk 28082 ---
interpreted 

--- Document Chunk 28083 ---
d) Informative: a clause that helps the reader to better understand the context or the 

--- Document Chunk 28084 ---
justification of requirement(s) 

--- Document Chunk 28085 ---
e) Others: a clause that does not belong to any of the above categories 

--- Document Chunk 28086 ---
9.3.2.2 Throughout the SRS, the requirements are identified as sentences using the keyword 

--- Document Chunk 28087 ---
“shall”. However: 

--- Document Chunk 28088 ---
a) In section 9.4, tables are identified as a single entity through a reference based on 

--- Document Chunk 28089 ---
the accompanying clause number. They can be classified  as ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 28090 ---
board and/or trackside requirements even if they do not include the keyword “shall”. 

--- Document Chunk 28091 ---
b) Elements of the ERTMS/ETCS language (radio messages, packets and variables, 

--- Document Chunk 28092 ---
see chapters 7 and 8) are also described with tables. The numbered titles (i. e. the 

--- Document Chunk 28093 ---
name of the element preceded by a clause number) together with their associated 

--- Document Chunk 28094 ---
table are considered as single entities and are classified as both ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 28095 ---
board and trackside requirements, even if they do not include the keyword “shall” 

--- Document Chunk 28096 ---
either. 

--- Document Chunk 28097 ---
9.3.2.3 Amongst the categories listed in 9.3.2.1 only the two first ones can be combined , in 

--- Document Chunk 28098 ---
case a requirement equally applies to both ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment and 

--- Document Chunk 28099 ---
ERTMS/ETCS trackside or in case two unambiguously distinguishable on -board and 

--- Document Chunk 28100 ---
trackside req uirements are kept together in the concerned clause for readability 

--- Document Chunk 28101 ---
reasons. 

--- Document Chunk 28102 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 28103 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 28104 ---
